Currently, there are fourteen groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. Coumba Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.

Ms. Fatou G. is the head of Group No. 14. She, like many of the women, has a small stall in the market of Grand Thies, one of the bigger neighborhoods of Thies. She sells sandwiches, starting around 7 a.m. and often finishing around midnight. She says her specialty is a beef sandwich with fried onions. If she has the money, Ms. G. also buys handbags and bras to sell in the market. Ms. G. is married, and the mother of seven children.

Three of the other group members also work in the Grand Thies market: Ms. Amy N. runs a small restaurant, serving rice dishes, such as thiébu dieune (rice and fish); Ms. Fatou N. sells guedia (dried fish); and Ms. Ndeye Marième Djité sells women's clothing, mostly pants. The final group member, Ms. Adama N., sells vegetables and fish out of her home. Each member receives 100,000 FCFA to bolster their activities.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 11

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70 kilometers from Dakar. The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities. Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with Kiva partner, UIMCEC. Groups of five are financed through ten-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments. Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. F., the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.
Fatou F. is the young head of group No. 11. She is among the many women who sell vegetables in the market of Grand Thies, a neighborhood in the middle of the city. She sells cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables, depending on the season. She explains that she started out on her own in the market, and likes the daily interactions with the other vendors.
Group No. 11's other members are: Fatou Diarra G. and Aissatou L., who both sell lettuce and tomatoes; Sagar B., who sells fresh fish; and Awa F., who sells used clothing. Each of the group's members receives 100,000 XOF to bolster their activities.

loans.use: To bolster her small business

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 23 years old and is a single man. He lives in a small village close to Hebron, Palestine.

Murad owns a small bakery that attracts many clients from the region. His immediate need is to acquire basic ingredients to continue baking bread. This is why he’s looking for support from Ryada to obtain credit that will allow him to buy the ingredients he needs to continue his bakery business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Pamella Atieno

texts.en:
Pamella Atieno O. is 40 years old, is married, and is the mother of six children.

Pamella Atieno was initially a full-time farmer but decided to venture into the trade of seedlings as a means of income generation for the family. She buys her stock twice a month and sells market to market.

Pamella Atieno would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 which will go to increasing her stock of seeds.

loans.use: To increase her stock of seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 4

texts.en:
Bator S., a mother of six, heads Sope Serigne Babacar's Group No. 4. She travels once per week to the fishing town of Joal, about sixty kilometers away. Joal is well-known as the birthplace of Léopold Sedar Senghor, Senegal's first president. Ms. S. has been active in this trade for about ten years.

The other members of the group are: Ngaye Djité, who sells fancy shoes for women;  Aida S., who has a small breakfast stand; Maguette K. who sells perfumes; and Adama S. who travels to Gambia to buy fabrics for re-sale in Thies.

Each group member receives 100,000 FCFA to finance their activities.


Sope Serigne Babacar S. is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about seventy kilometers from Dakar.

The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. Their aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities.

Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC (Union of Institution Mutualiste Communautaire d’Epargne et de Credit). Groups of five are financed through ten-month loans of which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments.

Currently, there are fourteen groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar S. is headed by Ms. Coumba Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Benta Atieno

texts.en:
Benta Atieno M. started her current clothes-hawking business (selling door-to-door) in 1993 before which she was a retail shop owner. She is a 47 year old widow and a mother to one child.

Benta Atieno would like a loan of Kshs 40,000 which she says will go to expanding her current clothes stock.

Benta Atieno’s main future plan is to guarantee an education for her only child and to expand her business across the Kenyan border.

loans.use: To expand her current stock of clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hellen Atieno

texts.en:
Hellen Atieno O. is 33 years old, is married, and is blessed with three children. She lives in Rongo, Kenya where she also runs a clothing business.

Hellen Atieno started her business in 1999 as an expansion scheme of the tailoring business she had then. She gets her stock across the border from Uganda once a month and would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 to increase her stock.

Hellen Atieno’s main goal is give her family a good future.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Quinter Aluoch

texts.en:
Quinter Aluoch O. is married and is the mother of one child. She owns a tailoring business which she has run for three years and which is a result of the training she received at one of the tailoring institutes in Kenya. It was a way of raising school fees for the two orphans she is the guardian of.

Quinter Aluoch would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 which will go to obtaining more sewing machines and expanding her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines to expand her tailoring business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Billy Atieno

texts.en:
Billy Atieno O. started her tailoring business in 2008 after her tailoring course training. She is married and blessed with a child.

Billy Atieno’s main reason for joining K-MET was to work as a community health worker with the community, especially the widows and orphans in Rongo, Kenya.

Billy Atieno would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 to expand her tailoring business. She says her clothes are selling like hot cakes in Rongo market.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce Atieno

texts.en:
Joyce Atieno O. is a former voluntary secretary of an organization in Rongo, Kenya. This she begun back in 2007 after college but when employment was not forthcoming, she decided to venture into trade and started her current clothing business.

Joyce Atieno is 35 years old and is single. She would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 which will go to stocking her business and expanding into more markets.

loans.use: To restock her clothing business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Risper Adhiambo

texts.en:
Risper Adhiambo O. is a businesswoman who owns and operates a cereals business. Her specialty is in selling groundnuts (peanuts). This is because, she says, local production of peanut butter has increased and the demand for the raw material is high.

Risper Adhiambo is 50 years old, is married and is the guardian of eight children. She would like a loan of Kshs 40,000 which will be used to increase her stock of groundnuts.

loans.use: To increase her stock of groundnuts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Debora Auma

texts.en:
Debora Auma G. is a charcoal dealer in the Rongo market, Kenya. She is 24 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children.

Debora Auma’s former business was shoe-selling but the business did not do well. Thus she moved into the lucrative business, she says, of charcoal dealing.

Debora Auma would like a loan of Kshs 30,000 which will go into expanding her charcoal business as well as reviving her old shoe business.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business as well as to revive her shoe business

loans.name: Pamella A.

texts.en: Pamella A. O. runs a cereal business specializing in rice. She buys the rice once each week from farmers in Ahero, a neighboring district. She is 40 years old and married, and the mother of 5 children. Her future plan is to buy a dairy cattle and venture into the milk business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 40,000 to expand her rice business into new markets.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Akumu

texts.en: Mary Akumu O. owns a cereal business. Her main commodity is maize, which she sells at Rongo Market in Kenya. She is married and the guardian of 8 orphaned children. Her main plan is to ensure education for all the orphans in her care. She would like a loan of Kshs. 30, 000 to expand her business inventory which she buys twice a week and sells at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hellen Achieng

texts.en: Hellen Achieng O. is 26 years old, the mother of two children, and a wife. She is the proud owner of a salon in Kanga Town, Rongo District, Kenya. She plans to expand her salon into a boutique so it can be a one-stop attraction for all the women in her town. She would like a loan of Kshs. 50,000 to  kick-start her business expansion.

loans.use: To expand her salon to house a boutique

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pamella Auma

texts.en: Pamella Auma O. is a businesswoman who owns a grocery store. She is married, 55 years old, and the guardian of three children. She buys her inventory once each week. She plans to increase her inventory and expand her business. She would like a loan of Kshs.10,000 to invest in her expansion plan.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina A. sells dried cassava, which is a primary ingredient of the flour for "ugali,"  a porridge-like side dish that is a food staple in Kenya. She buys the cassava every week and her current plan is to increase her inventory because it is the cassava harvest time for most farmers. She would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to buy cassava to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Linet Auma

texts.en: Linet Auma O. sells used clothing door-to-door (known as "hawking"). She started her business in 2004 after quitting her kindergarten teaching job. She is 35 years old and married, and the mother of two children. She would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to increasing her inventory of clothing, which she buys twice every month. She wishes to buy a parcel of land and build a home for her family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Usuvilo Group

texts.en:
Amoni H. is 45 years old, is married with four children, and lives in Dar es Salaam. In the photo, Amoni is the second from the right in the back row in the striped blue and white shirt.

Amoni owns a chicken farm and sells eggs and chickens. He has been in the business for two years and currently earns 1.35 million shillings a month (approximately $1000).

This will be Amoni’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, he hopes to increase the size of his chicken farm, to invest in more chicken feed, and to improve his egg-selling business.

Amoni will share this loan with his loan group which is comprised of sixteen other men and women from his community. These members work in food sales and secondhand clothing sales.

loans.use: To increase the size of his chicken farm, to invest in more chicken feed, and to improve his egg-selling business

loans.name: Haisam

texts.en:
Haisam is a 21-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Haisam has been selling coal since 2004. Haisam requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase coal for his business. 

This is the first time that Haisam has requested a loan. His clients are his friends and neighbors, and sometimes tourists. When he first started his business, he was afraid of the competition, but he knew how to make himself known because he sells good quality coal. He decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase coal to sell

loans.name: Millicent Adhiambo

texts.en: Millicent Adhiambo A. used to sell clothing door-to-door, but she ventured into retail shop and maize business and she has never looked back. She is a 34-year-old mother of 4 children and she considers herself to be an iron lady of business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 50,000 to expand her business. Her dream is to ensure a future for her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of maize

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wafeek

texts.en:
Wafeek is a 53-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Wafeek has been working as carpenter for over 30 years. Wafeek requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase wood for his work. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Wafeek distinguishes himself by his skilled and precise work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and had experience in carpentry.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 22-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley. Bilal has owned and operated a coffee shop since 2006. He also offers "narguileh" (also known as a "hookah" or "shisha"), an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East in which people smoke fruit-flavored tobacco from a tall or short water pipe. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe and other countries. 

Bilal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to redecorate his business to make it more modern and attract more clients. This is the first time that Bilal has requested a loan. His business is favored because it is well located and he does his best to meet his clients’ demands and offer them the best. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. 

When he first started his business, he didn't have many clients because he was not well known, but he knew how to enlarge his network. He decided to start his business because he used to work as a waiter and gained experience from his previous jobs. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To redecorate his cafe

loans.name: Touni

texts.en:
Touni is a 42-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. Touni has owned a laundry since 1989. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase cleaning products and to repair one of his cleaning machines. 

This is the first time that Touni has requested a loan. His business is special because he does it well and is very precise in his work. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the tools required for his work. He decided to start his business because it was his family’s business. In the future, he plans to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products and to repair one of his cleaning machines.

loans.name: Mary Auma

texts.en:
Mary Auma O. sells cereals and clothes. She used to be in the tailoring business and still has a passion for making clothes. She is 39 years old, widowed, and the mother of 4 children. 

She would like a loan of Kshs. 50,000 to increase her inventory and expand her business. Her dream, which she says is driven by her businesses, is to ensure her children get the best education and to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cereal and clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mhamadi

texts.en:
Mhamadi is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their two children. Mhamadi has been working as a truck driver since 2000. He will transport anything that his clients request. His clients can be anyone from his region, but they are mainly firms. 

He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase tires for his truck. This is the first time that Mhamadi has requested a loan. His business is speciA. because he knows how to treat his clients and is punctuA.. When he first started his business, he had difficulty paying for his truck expenses. He decided to start his business because he likes to work independently work and be his own boss. In the future, he plans to improve his business so he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda H. sells firewood in Aduwawa in Edo State. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to become a major distributor of firewood in her community. She has been in this business for two years. 

Rhoda is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Her youngest child is 8 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more firewood. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Asef

texts.en:
Asef is a 36-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valey with his wife and their three children. Asef has been working in construction since 1994. Asef requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase metA. for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Asef's business is speciA. because of his good and precise work. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and he had experience in this field.

loans.use: To purchase metal for his work.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Hebron, Palestine with her husband and their two children. She owns a grocery store where she sells food and candy. She started her business to help her husbend with the family expenses. Her clients are friends and neighbors. 

Amal is requesting a loan of $2000 from Ryada to buy more groceries for her inventory and to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 47 years old. She is married and has nine children, the youngest of whom is 6 years old. She is a very hard-working woman. She wakes up daily at 4:30 a.m. to start preparing "fufu" (cassava dumplings) to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. Fufu is made from fermented cassava and it can be eaten with Nigerian soups like egusi (melon soup), vegetable soup, etc. 

Margaret is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava to make more fufu to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to make fufu

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 39-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife. Jihad has been working as a furniture painter since 2004. Jihad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his business. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.
 
Jihad's work is special because he is skilled and always does nice and precise work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and had experience in the field. However, when he first started his business, he had some financial issues. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. Husein has been working as a car painter since 2000. Husein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase tools to improve his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time. 

Husein's work is special because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and has experience in the field. However, when he first started his business, he had to face the competition. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella sells soft drinks at retail prices to make a living. She lives and works in Benin City, Edo, Nigeria. She is 32 years old and married, and she has four children. Her eldest child is 8 years old. She is a friendly woman and she is also hard-working. She is a LAPO client. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Angella is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Omo

texts.en:
Omo sells drinks at retail prices to her customers to make a living in Benin City, Edo State. She is 28 years old and is married with three children. Her eldest child is 4 years old. Omo is a friendly woman and she is also hardworking.

Omo has been in her business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

Omo is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 62-year-old widow who has two children. She has been working as a baker producing special Lebanese bread since 2007.

Today, Latifa is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy bakery merchandise in order to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy bakery merchandise

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky has been in this business of motor spare-parts for the past four years. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. Lucky is 32 years old and still single without children, but he hopes to get married very soon.

Lucky has been able to sustain himself with the profits from his business. He also wants to own a big spare-parts stall in the future. He is requesting for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more motor spare-parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Lucky is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has been selling women’s clothes and shoes for a long time and hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Veronica 57 years old and the mother of five children. All her children, with the exception of the youngest child, are graduates. She is very happy to be referred to as “Mama Graduates” in her neighborhood.

Veronica is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more women’s clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Veronica is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more women's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi has a bakery where she bakes loaves of bread to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Ngozi is 38 years old and married with five children. Her youngest child is 10 years old. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to take care of her family.

Ngozi needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Ngozi is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias has worked as a house painter since 1998. He is 32 years old and is married with three young children.

Working on a freelance basis, Elias manages a part of house projects in his town and its surroundings. With the help of the loan of $1,200, he managed to expand his business by buying tools such as paintbrushes and paints.

loans.use: To buy tools such as paintbrushes and paints

loans.name: Lolita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. desde muy temprano sale a la carretera los altos a vender frutas como sandilla, melón, papaya, elotes, jocote, mango, coyolito y piña entre otras. Ella con este trabajo puede darles el sustento a sus tres hijos por eso paso esta navidad trabajando e invertirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y diversidad.

Además este año lo concluyo feliz por el éxito de su negocio y con la espera que en este año nuevo sea mejor que el anterior.
texts.en:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. leaves very early for the Los Altos highway to sell fruit (watermelon, melon, papaya, corn, jocote, mango, coyol, and pineapple, among others). With this job she has been able to provide for her three children. For this reason she spent this Christmas working. She will use the loan to buy higher quantities of more diverse fruits.

This year ended happily for her because her business was successful, and she hopes this new year will be better than the last.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit (papaya, jocote, mango, pineapple, watermelon, etc.)

loans.name: Chukwuma

texts.en:
Chukwuma is 42 years old and is married with two children. He sells rechargeable phones and phone cards to make a living and has been in this business since four years. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers.

Chukwuma needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones and phone cards to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

Chukwuma is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and phone cards to sell

loans.name: Rosario Margarita

texts.es:
Rosario Cedeño de 44 años, vive en una casa de cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja en el taller de ebanistería tienen 3 hijos ya casados y trabajando.

Rosario comenzó a reunir dinero vendiendo colas, agua y helados para poder aportar a los ahorros para sacar el taller de muebles que querían con su esposo, ahora Rosario y su esposo tienen el taller en su casa, ella sigue vendiendo colas, agua y helados. Trabajan todos los días en el taller y vendiendo las bebidas, una de las mayores dificultades es la lluvia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar madera, clavos, materiales para su negocio, en el futuro quiere poner otra sucursal de ebanistería.
texts.en:
Rosario Cedeño is 44 years old and lives in a cement house with simple plumbing and electricity. Her house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her husband works in a wood-working shop. They have three children who are all married and working.

Rosario began saving money selling soft drinks, water, and ice cream in order to contribute to their savings for the furniture workshop that she and her husband wanted. Now, Rosario and her husband have the workshop in their home. She is still selling soft drinks, water, and ice cream. They work every day in the workshop and selling beverages. One of their greatest struggles is the rain.

With the loan, she wants to buy wood, nails, and materials for the business. In the future, she wants to start another branch of the wood-working shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood, nails, supplies

loans.name: Máximo Primitivo

texts.es:
Máximo R. de 49 años, vive en la zona Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa trabaja con el con ella tiene 2 hijos uno de 17 años, y 10 años estudian en una escuela particular. 

Máximo empezó trabajando en un almacén de artículos varios años, con la liquidación que le dieron comenzó vendiendo arroz y verduras en su casa, poco a poco pudo poner una tienda. Ahora gracias a los buenos ingresos que a obtenido pudo poner unas cabinas telefónicas y artículos de bazar el trabaja todos de lunes a domingo vendiendo arroz, atún, aceites, servicio de telefonía etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatos, ropa, maquillajes para poder surtir mejor su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner sucursales y poder así comprarse un auto para su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo R., age 49, lives in the Paraíso de Guayaquil neighborhood. His wife works with him. The pair have 2 children, ages 17 and 10, who attend a private school. Máximo began working in a wholesale grocer's shop. With the discount they gave him he began selling rice and vegetables from home. Little by little, he was able to set up a store. Now, thanks to the good income he has earned, he was able to install telephone booths and stock general goods. He works everyday, Monday to Sunday, selling rice, tuna, oils, telephone services, etc. With this loan he wants to buy shoes, clothing, and make-up to better stock his business. In the future he wants to start other branches of his business and thus be able to buy a car for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes, clothing, rice

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es: El señor Mario Francisco S. V., es casado y viven en el Bo. las Conchitas y su esposa trabaja como docente y le apoya con los gastos del hogar y con el negocio, ellos tienen 3 hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad, viven y trabajan de manera independiente, como familia a futuro planean la reconstruccion de su hogar para que la hija mayor habite con sus hijos. El señor  S. se ha dedicado desde hace 11 años a la venta de abarrotes y lacteos,el es dueño de una pulperia que les ha brindado el sustento dia a dia, es para este negocio que solicitó el prestamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos que le abastescan el local y les aumente los ingresos, esto les ayudará a enfrentar la enfermedad que aqueja al hijo ,es por él que la familia tiene como objetivo el empeño diario para sobrellevar los gastos del menor.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Francisco S. V. is married and lives in the Las Conchitas district. His wife works as a teacher and helps with the expenses of the home and with the business. They have 3 children, two of whom are adults who work and live independently. As a family, they plan to add on to their house in the future, so that their oldest daughter can live there with her children.

Mr. S. has worked for the past 11 years selling groceries and dairy products. He is the owner of a small grocery store that has provided for their day to day needs. It is for this business that he requested a loan to use to buy products to stock the store and increase earnings. This will help them to deal with their son's illness. The family's motivation for their daily efforts is to be able to deal with their young son's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Ana Geisel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa en el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Ana L. se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora ya que se dedica a la actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas siendo elaboradas y comercializadas por ella misma en el municipio y ofreciéndolas a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
Ella está solicitando un crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima como lo es maíz, leña y cal. Ella es soltera y con un hijo en edad escolar al que debe de brindarle las condiciones para que se desarrolle. Por ser muy trabajadora, inicia a las seis de la mañana a elaborar las tortillas siendo esta la actividad que le permite obtener el sustento para su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Ana L. is noted for being a dedicated, hard-working tortilla merchant in Chichigalpa municipality, Chinandega department. She is requesting funds in order to buy ingredients like corn, lime and firewood. She is single and has a school-age son for whom she must provide the proper conditions for his development. As she is a hard worker, she begins her work day at 6am making tortillas; it is this activity which permits her to provide support for her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lime and firewood.

loans.name: Paula Emelina

texts.es:
Muy alegre, la señora Paula S. se dedica a su actividad de tienda general donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles como pan dulce, pan simple, golosinas, huevos, arroz, cereales y otros. También ofrece productos varios como papel higiénico, jabones, servilletas y otros.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería con el fin de continuar beneficiando a su hijo en edad escolar ya que ella es madre soltera. Espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así logrará realizar el trabajo de venta de productos en el negocio en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Paula S. cheerfuly tends to her general store where she offers all kinds of food items like: sweet bread, regular bread, eggs, rice, cereals, etc. She also offers various non-food items like: toilet paper, soaps, paper napkins, etc. She needs funding to buy stock items for the store so that she can continue to provide for her young, school-age son since she is a single mother. She hopes to be favored with the loan approval so that she can continue to sell her products; she lives in León department.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La  señora Isabel Cristina O. S. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio 6 de Junio, ellos tienen 2 hijos entre las edades de 12 y 9 años ellos actualmente cursan la escuela primaria, Isabel se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de cosméticos pero se ha visto afectada por su pequeño presupuesto, pues  poco a poco las ventas se le han incrementdo, pero el capital para ofertar más productos no lo posee es por esta razón que desea invertir en su negocio y asi obtener mayores ingresos que le recuperen a corto tiempo el dinero, estó le serviria de mucha ayuda a al familia ya que le apoyaría economicamente y le brindaría mejores condiciones de vida para todos.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina O. S., 34, is married and lives in the 6 de Junio neighborhood. They have 2 children, 12 and 9 years old respectively, who are elementary school students. Isabel has sold cosmetics for the last 3 years but her small budget has affected her because, even though her sales have been steadily increasing, she lacks capital to increase her inventory in order to offer a greater variety of products. For this reason she would like to invest more in her busienss so as to have greater earnings which will allow her to recoup her investment in a shorter period of time. This will be of great help to her family in that it will provide for them economically and improve the quality of life for all of them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Rosario H. se dedica a vender útiles escolares como lapiceros, agendas, libretas, entre otros siendo ofrecidos ambulantemente en todo el mercado siendo este el trabajo con el que obtiene los ingresos para su hogar.

Es importante destacar que el trabajo ambulante es fatigoso por la exposición al sol y el desgaste de caminar todos los días. Sin embargo, la señora Rosario continua trabajando y para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los útiles escolares como lapiceros, agendas y libretas para dar continuidad a la venta de estos en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rosario H. sells school supplies in Managua's Mayoreo market. She stocks ball-point pens, agendas and notebooks, among other items. She does not have a stall in the market; she sells by moving throughout the market offering her wares. This is her source of household income. It is important to stress that this ambulatory method of working is exhausting because she is exposed to the sun and the constant walking is very tiring. However, Rosario continues to work and is asking Ceprodel for funding to buy stock items like pens, agendas and notebooks so that she can continue to sell them in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ball-point pens, agendas and notebooks to sell.

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
Grupo Rojo está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras ellas son Emma S. M. quien vende licor en su casa de habitación un negocio muy prospero, Silvia O. M. trabaja con las dos compañías telefónicas de Nicaragua Claro y Movistar con la ventas de recargas y Jairo Antonio S. tiene un pequeño bar.

Ellos desean seguir prosperando y mejorando por sus familias para que ellos puedan estudiar y tener una vida más prospera.
texts.en:
Grupo Rojo si made up of three, hard-working, enterprising and tenacious people. Emma S. M., sells liquor from her home; a very profitable enterprise. Silvia O. M. sells rechargable phone cards for two telephone companies: Nicaragua Claro and Movistar. And Jairo Antonio S. has a small bar. They would like to be able to continue to support their families so that they can study and have a more properous life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy liquor.

loans.name: Aquiles Jose

texts.es: El señor Aquiles Jose M. P., tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el barrio laureles sur, es casado y sus esposa es ama de casa, el señor M. es asalariodo siendo este el único ingreso económico que posee la familia, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales el mayor de 22 años de edad, está por terminar su carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, el mediano de 17 años estudia la escuela secundaria y la menor tiene tres años de edad. El señor Aquiles trabaja para el Ministerio de Educacion, Cultura y Deportes, tiene 7 años y medio de trabajar para ellos, lo cual esto demuestra una estabilidad y responsabilidad, pues tiene 9 creditos con Kiva de los cuales con ninguno a quedado en M. y todos los ha utilizado para realizar modificaciones en su vivienda, gracias a estos fondos la familia M. ha podido mejorar sus estilos de vida y comodidades en el hogar, con este prestamo ahora construirá un cuarto para el hijo mayor y de esta manera ofrecerle a su hijo mayor, una mejor privcidad que tanto necesita debido a la edad que posee.
texts.en:
Aquiles Jose M. P., 54, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He's married and his wife is a housewife. Mr. M. is a salaried employee and his earnings are the family's sole source of income. They have three children. The oldest, who is 22, is about to finish his professional Business Administration studies. The middle son is 17 and is in high school. The youngest is a three-year-old daughter. Aquiles has worked for the Education, Culture and Sports Ministry for seven-and-a-half years, which shows stability and responsibility. He has had 9 loans with Kiva and he hasn't defaulted on any of them. He used all of them to make home improvements. Thanks to these funds, the M. family has been able to improve their standard of living and the comfort level in their home. This loan will be used to build a bedroom for the oldest son so that he can have more privacy, something he now needs because of his age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro G. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa trabaja como comerciante con ella tiene 5 hijos todos están estudiando en escuelas fiscales.

Pedro comenzó ahorrando dinero para  poner una tienda en su casa, en poco tiempo empezó vendiendo víveres poco a poco pudo surtir más el negocio. Ahora trabaja en conjunto con su esposa vendiendo arroz, aceites, legumbres etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es la delincuencia de su sector.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, pollos, legumbres para poder agrandar la tienda, en el futuro quiere poner sucursales de su tienda para poder asegurar el futuro de sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Pedro G., 43, lives in the periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. His concrete house has all the basic services. His wife works as a merchant and they have children who are all enrolled in public school. Pedro started to save money in order to establish a grocery store in his home. He soon began selling food items and bit by bit was able to increase the variety of his stock items. Now, he works with his wife selling rice, cooking oils, vegetables, etc. One of the biggest obstacles for them is the high level of delinquency in their area. With this loan he will buy rice, cooking oil, chickens, vegetables to enlarge his stock. In the future, he would like to open additional branches of his store in order to insure the future of his 5 children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, chicken, cooking oil.

loans.name: Iris Del Rocio

texts.es:
Iris M. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene agua y luz como servicio básicos, es divorciada pero tiene 2 hijos uno de 10 años y 6 años los dos estudiantes en escuelas fiscales.

Iris empezó con la motivación de tener que mantener a sus hijos ella sola sin la compañía de su cónyuge, con la idea de unos conocidos empezó como vendedora Yanbal. Ahora Iris trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 17h00 todos los días  vendiendo por catalogo perfumes, shampoo, cremas desodorantes etc. Una de las mayores dificultades  es la delincuencia de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, shampoo, cremas para tener más variedad en lo que vende. En el futuro quiere unas vitrinas para así vender los productos desde su casa para poder tener más tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Iris M., 35, lives in the periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house has running water and electricity. She is divorced but has two children, 10 and 6 years old, who are enrolled in public school. Iris was motivated by the need to support her children alone without the help of her spouse. Some acquaintances introduced her to Yanbal products sales. She now works every day from 7am until 5pm selling perfumes, shampoo, creams, deodorants, etc. from the Yanbal catalogue. One of her greatest obstacles is the high degree of delinquency in her area. With the loan she will buy perfumes, shampoo and creams in order to have a greater variety of stock items to sell. In the future, she would like to have some display cases so that she can sell more from home and thereby have more time to spend with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, Shampoo, Creams.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El señor Dionicio G. R. tiene 53 años y vive en la localidad de Mallco Chapi a unos 21 km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Dionicio está casado con la señora Evarsita por más de 23 años y tienen un hijo de 20 años que vive con ellos y a demás de ayudar con el cuidado de las vacas también está estudiando en un instituto en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Dionicio se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y trabajaba sembrando diferentes productos en sus tierras. En esta casa es donde tiene 5 vacas lecheras que son su mayor fuente de ingreso.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos. También será destinado para el pago de una acción del pozo de agua que construirán en la zona para el riego de sus tierras.

Dionicio nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a su esposa y a su hijo, ya que su casa por el momento no cuenta con muchas comodidades o con los servicios necesarios. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Dionicio G. R., 53, lives in the Mallco Chapi area, which is about 21km from the city of Cochabamba. He has been married to Evarista for over 23 years and they have a 20 year-old son that lives with them. Their son helps him care for the cows in addition to studying at an institute in Cochabamba. Dionicio is a raw milk dairy farmer and also grows various crops on his lands. He has 5 dairy cows at home and they are his main source of income. The funding will be used to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase milk production and thereby his earnings. It will also be used to pay for a share in the water well that will be dug in his area in order to water his fields. Dionicio tells us that his gretest dream is to provide his wife and son with the most comfort possible since his house, for the moment, does not have many comforts nor basic services. He also tells us that he'd like to use his next loan to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and to pay for a share of water usage rights from the well to be built in the area where he lives.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El señor Braulio C. S. tiene 64 años y vive en la localidad de Mallco Chapi a unos 21 km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Braulio está casado por más de 36 años y tienen 3 hijos de 26, 22 y 19 años. Los dos menores viven con ellos y a demás de ayudar con el cuidado de las vacas también está estudiando en un instituto profesional en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Braulio se dedica a la producción de leche cruda por más de 20 años y trabajaba sembrando diferentes productos en sus tierras. En esta casa es donde tiene 5 vacas lecheras que son su mayor fuente de ingreso.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de alimento para ganado lechero que en esta época por la falta de lluvia el precio se incrementa, para de este modo poder alimentar a su ganado con normalidad y que su producción lechera y sus ingresos no se vean afectados. También será destinado para el pago de una acción del pozo de agua que construirán en la zona para el riego de sus tierras.

Braulio nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a su esposa y a sus hijos, ya que su casa por el momento no cuenta con muchas comodidades o con los servicios necesarios. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder construirles casa a sus hijos, y así vivan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Mr. Braulio C. S. is 64 years old and lives in the town of Mallco Chapi, about 21 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Braulio has been married for more than 36 years and they have three children who are 26, 22, and 19. The younger two live with them and along with helping care for the cows, also study at a technical school in the city of Cochabamba. Braulio has worked in fresh milk production for more than 20 years, and also farms different crops on his land. At his home he has 5 dairy cows, and they are his main source of income.

The loan will be used to buy food for the dairy cows, since the price has increased from lack of rain. In this way he can feed his livestock the normal amount and their milk production and his earnings will not be affected. The loan will also be used to pay for his share of the water well that they are building in the area to irrigate his land.

Braulio tells us that his biggest dream is to provide every comfort for his wife and children, since their house does not currently have many luxuries or necessary utilities. He also tells us that with the next loan he gets, he would like to build a house for his children, so that they can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for dairy cows and to help pay for a well

loans.name: Maribel Tania

texts.es:
La señorita Maribel E. P. tiene 22 años y vive en la zona de Sumumpaya en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Maribel aun no se caso y vive en casa de su madre. Maribel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y con esa leche elabora queso que vende en el mercado de Cochabamba y también se dedica a vender junto a su madre fruta, también en el mercado. En su casa tienen 3 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama para que ella se haga cargo, ya que su madre se dedica a la elaboración de queso hace muchísimos años.

Maribel quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos, pero ella nos cuenta que hace dos años una inundación destruyo la casa de su madre y apenas están terminando de construirla de nuevo y mientras ella no este cómoda, feliz y tranquila en su casa ella seguirá junto a ella. El crédito será destinado a la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos.

Maribel nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a su madre para que sea feliz y ya no sufra por falta de una casa. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel E. P. is 22, and she lives in the Sumumpaya area in the area south of the city of Cochabamba. Maribel has not yet married, and she lives in her mother’s house. Maribel’s business is the production of raw milk. She uses this milk to make cheese to sell in the Cochabamba market. She also sells fruit in the market with her mother. She has three dairy cows at home that her mother gave her to take care of because her mother has now been making cheese for many years. Maribel would like to have a family, children, and grandchildren in the future. She tells us that two years ago a flood destroyed her mother’s house, and they are just finishing building it again. She will continue to stay with her mother while her mother is not comfortable, happy, or at ease in her house. The loan is to buy another dairy cow. This way she will be able to increase her milk production and her income. Maribel tells us that her greatest dream is to be able to give all of the comforts that she can to her mother. She wants to do this so that she will be happy and not suffer from not having a house. She also tells us that with the next loan she would like to be able to improve the conditions of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Sr. Santiago se dedica al transporte de carga con su camioneta, actividad con la que se sostiene el solo ya que aun no se caso y vive solo con los papas a quienes les ayuda con los gastos del hogar. 

El credito solicitado es para la compra de repuestos para su movilidad.

Tambien podemos mensionar que el cliente es bastante responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
 
El Sr. Santiago esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Santiago transports cargo in his van. He is still single so his earnings are for his own needs and to help his parents, with whom he lives, to pay for household expenses. The funding requested is to buy replacement parts for his vehicle. We can mention, too, that he is quite responsible with his repayments. Santiago is very grateful both to Emprender and to Kiva for having confidence in him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar Agusto L. tiene 58 años de edad y vive en el barrio Laureles Sur es soltero pero tiene 5 hijos entre las edades de 19, 14, 11, 8, 4 años de edad, el mayor está terminando la escuela secundaria y tiene aspiraciones para comenzar su carrera universitaria, los demás estudian la primaria y la secundaria respectivamente, él se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 30 años, como toda empresa tiene sus momentos altos y bajos y aveces por estas inestabilidades economicas,  es que ha tenido problemas para pagar su cuota en tiempo y forma, pero espera comprensión de parte nuestra y solicita un nuevo prestamo que le ayude a reconstruir su casa y asi brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos debido a que habitan en una zona muy peligrosa, asi mismo ofrecerles mejores ocmodidades en un ambiente hogereño que aporte al buen vivir de todos.
texts.en:
Cesar Agusto L., 58, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is single, but he has five children. They are 19, 14, 11, 8, and 4. The oldest is finishing high school and has aspirations to start a university career. They others are in elementary school and high school. He has been selling clothes for 30 years. Like all businesses, it has its high and low moments. Sometimes, due to economic instabilities, he has had problems making his payment on time. He hopes that we will understand, and he is asking for a new loan to help him rebuild his house. That way he will provide his children with greater security because they live in a very dangerous area. He will also provide them with more comforts in a homey atmosphere that contributes to the well being of all.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build the front of his house

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa A. A. tiene 31 años y vive en la zona de A. Rancho en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Josefa está casada con el señor Wilson Escalera por más de 10 años, ambos tienen dos hijos pequeños que acuden a la escuela de la zona. Josefa se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clase de productos lácteos. En su casa tienen 10 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama para que ella se haga cargo, ya que su familia es conocida en la zona por los muchos años que trabajan con vacas lecheras. Mientras que su esposo viaja de ciudad en ciudad colocando postes de luz para una compañia de energia electrica.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos. Josefa nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder incrementar de tal manera su ganado lechero que pueda dejarle una herencia a ambos de sus hijos con lo cual ellos puedan tener una calidad de vida buena.
texts.en:
Josefa A. A., 31, lives in the A. Rancho area in the area south of the city of Cochabamba. Josefa has been married to Wilson Escalera for over ten years. They have two small children who go to school in the area. Josefa’s business is the production of crude milk. She then sells it to a company that makes all kinds of dairy products. She has ten head of dairy cows at home. Her mother gave them to her. Her family is well known in the area for the many years they have worked with dairy cows. Her husband travels from city to city placing light poles for an electrical company. The loan is to buy another dairy cow in order to be able to increase milk production and her income. Josefa tells us that her greatest dream is to be able to increase her livestock to be able to give both of her children an inheritance in order to have a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Divinas está integrado por Maribel P., Ría C. García, Orlando S. y Jenny del Carmen. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que desde temprana edad han tenido que salir adelante por sus familias.

Maribel P. inicio a vender ropa interior gracias a la ayuda económica que le dio su madre y luego con el tiempo empezó a trabajar en ADIM  lo que le ha permitido crecer. Mientras sus compañeros de grupo tienen comercializan otros productos Ría C. García tiene una fritanga un pequeño restaurante popular, Orlando S.  vende fresco y gaseosa y por último se encuentra Jenny del Carmen quien vende repuestos de bicicleta.
texts.en:
The Las Divinas group is comprised of Maribel P., Ría C. García, Orlando S., and Jenny del Carmen. They are hardworking women who, from an early age, have had to provide for their families. Maribel P. began selling underwear thanks to the economic help of her mother. Later, she began to work with ADIM, which has allowed the business to grow. Other group members have various businesses. Ría C. García has a “fritanga,” a small, popular restaurant. Orlando S. sells juice and soft drinks. And finally, Jenny del Carmen sells bicycle parts.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Maria vende ataúdes, los cuales los manda hacer con los carpinteros y ella se encarga de pintarlos y luego los comercializa a las funerarias. Además Maria vende ropa a pedido.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cajones blancos.
Los sueños de Maria son tener una funeraria y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, is a member of the Morenita II communal bank. She lives with her life partner and her 4 children. Maria sells coffins which she has made by local carpenters; she paints them and then sells them to funeral parlors. In addition, Maria sells clothing on order. She needs a 600 sol loan to buy white coffins. Maria's dream is to have a funeral parlor and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy white coffins.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 54 años y 9 hijos, Felicitas tiene un puesto en el terminal pesquero D. la ciudad en donD. venD. pescado, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, también envía pescado a la selva ayacuchana.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pescados.
Los sueños D. Felicitas son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 54, is a member of the Morenita II communal bank. She is married and has 9 children. She has a stand in the fishing terminal in her city where she sells fish on Saturdays and Sundays. She also ships fish to the Ayacucho back country. Felicitas needs a 900 sol loan to buy fish. Her dream is to proviD. her children with education so that they will become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Nancy Elsa

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Nancy es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en su casa de ciudad de Pichari en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, a donde viaja una vez por semana, también vende ropa a pedido.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the communal bank "Morenita II." She is married, 33 years old, and has 4 children. Nancy has a store in her house where she sells groceries and fresh vegetables from the city of Pichari, where she travels once a month. She also sells clothing on order. She needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Nancy dreams of improving her business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Freddys Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Freddys D. es dueño de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia vendiendo sus productos a los clientes que le visitan y de esta manera busca como obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería y también para la compra de gasolina para ofrecerla a sus clientes ya que en su localidad hay muy pocos lugares donde se vende la gasolina. Es por esta razón que espera que el crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Freddys D. is the proprietor of a small general store located in the town of El Sauce in the department of León. From the early hours of the morning, he begins selling his products to the customers, in this way earning the income to take home. Freddys is seeking a loan to invest in products for the store, and also to buy gasoline to sell. In this area, there are very few places selling gasoline. He hopes the loan will be granted so he can continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for general store

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Maria es soltera, tiene 28 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, de profesión Profesora de Lengua y Literatura, Maria vende ropa variada a pedido, que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
El sueño de Maria es trabajar en el campo de Docencia.
texts.en:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II. Maria es soltera, tiene 28 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, de profesión Profesora de Lengua y Literatura, Maria vende ropa variada a pedido, que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa. El sueño de Maria es trabajar en el campo de Docencia. Maria, 28, is a member of the Morenita II communal bank. She is single and expecting her first child. Maria is trained as a Spanish and Literature teacher. She sells a variety of clothing articles on order among her friends and family. Her sales are on credit. Maria needs a 900 sol loan to invest in clothing. Maria's dream is to work as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Walter Teodosio

texts.es:
Walter es socio del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Walter es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Walter se dedica a la crianza de cuy en Carmen Alto en casa de su familia, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 personal, sus ventas los realiza en los recreos. Walter tiene proyectado aperturar un recreo en su casa.
Walter necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en los acabados del recreo.
Los sueños de Walter son aperturar su recreo e implementar un hostal.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita II. He lives with his partner partner, is 48 years old and has 2 children. Walter breeds cuy (guinea pig) in Carmen Alto in his family's house, an activity which he does with the help of 1 person. He sells in the markets, and has plans to open a market in his house. Walter needs a loan of 1200 soles, money which will be invested in the finishing touches of his market. Walter's dreams are to open his market and set up a guest house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing touches for a market

loans.name: Marina Enriqueta

texts.es:
Marina S. es una dama muy trabajadora que vive en el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León donde tiene 21 largos años de laborar como maestra en un colegio del municipio con el fin de obtener el ingreso para invertirlo en la remodelación de su vivienda ya que así lo necesita y debe llevarlo a cabo para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto ama. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción.
Es importante destacar que esta remodelación la llevará a cabo para cumplir sus sueños de brindarle a su pequeña hija excelentes condiciones para vivir y que tenga un techo digno donde desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Marina S. is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the municipality of El Sauce, León department, where for 21 long years she has worked as a teacher in a municipal college with the purpose of obtaining money to invest in the remodelling of her house. She requires the money to bestow better living conditions on her family, who she loves so much. She is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials. It is important to emphasise that Marina will take this remodelling project to completion, to realise her dreams of giving excellent living conditions to her little daughter and a dignified roof over her head where she can develop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
María C. de 49 años, su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona Perimetral de Guayaquil tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos, es viuda con 5 hijos de 25, 23, 22, 17 y 14 quien todavía estudia en una escuela fiscal.

María empezó estudiando para ser costurera ya hace 2 años atrás comenzó con su negocio de confección de ropa. Ahora ella trabaja todos los días en las tardes confeccionando, haciendo arreglos de ropa etc. Una de las mayores dificultades que tiene es la falta de clientela que a veces tiene en su sector, porque la gente busca ya ropa confeccionada. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arreglos para su casa como techo, correas y la mano de obra. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener otra maquina para coser.
texts.en:
María C. is 49 years old. Her home is located in the zone of Perimetral de Guayaquil, which has the basic services of water and light. She is a widow with 5 children - 25, 23, 22, 17 and 14, the last of which still studies at school. María began studying to be a seamstress 2 years ago, and also started her dressmaking business. Now she works every day in the afternoon dressmaking, repairing clothes etc. One of the biggest difficulties she has is the lack of clients in her sector, because people look for ready-made clothing. With this loan María wants to buy repairs to her house for the roof, gutters and labouring. In the future she wants to construct her house and have another sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof, gutter repairs and labour hire

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega, el señor Carlos M. ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que requiere brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir y un lugar donde puedan desarrollarse satisfactoriamente. 

Es por esta razón que el señor Carlos está llevando a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción  y así  continuar con dicha obra hasta acabarla y lograr la satisfacción de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos M. has begun to make some home improvements to his house in the town of Somotillo in Chinandega. He wants to provide his children with a proper home where they can develop satisfactorily. This is why he is making these improvements to his home and why he needs funding to buy building materials to finish his project thereby attaining satisfaction for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Julia es casada, tiene 59 años y 7 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, aceite.
El sueño de Julia es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia, 59, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is married and has 7 children. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruits daily; her daughter helps her out. Julia needs 1500 soles to buy stock items like sugar and cooking oil. Julia's dream is that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Donald Agustín

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Donald B. se dedica arduamente a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su hogar y así brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia por medio de la reconstrucción de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones por mucho tiempo pero ahora ha iniciado a mejorar gracias al apoyo del señor Donald.

Con la obra de mejoramiento de vivienda saldrá adelante brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y esta es la razón por la que solicita un crédito en Ceprodel el cuál invertirá en la compra de los materiales de construcción para culminar su obra y lograr la satisfacción de su familia.
texts.en:
Donald B. lives in Somotillo in Chinandega department. He works hard to support his family and provide better living conditions for them through home improvements. His house has been in poor condition for some time now and he has started to make improvements, thank to help from Donald. This construction project will improve his family's living conditions so he is asking Ceprodel for funding to be used to buy building materials so that he can complete the job to his entire family's satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Aidee Margarita

texts.es:
Aidee es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Aidee es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Aidee tiene una chicharroneria llamada El Sabroso, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Aidee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, carne y manteles.
Los sueños de Aidee son tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Aidee is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She 42 years old and is married with three children. Aidee operates a “chicharroneria,” a restaurant specializing in “chicharrón,” fried pork rinds. The restaurant is called “El Sabroso” and is located in the city center. It is open every day. Aidee requires a loan of 2000 soles to invest in soft drinks, meat, and tablecloths. Her dreams are to have her own house, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, meat, and tablecloths for restaurant.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Hermelinda es separada, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Hermelinda venD. comida en un puesto alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días al mediodía, también reparte la comida en taper a los comerciantes del mercado. Además Hermelinda en épocas venD. tuna.
Hermelinda necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal.
Los sueños D. Hermelinda son tener casa propia y un restaurante granD..
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the communal bank Amauta Huamanga. She is separated, 43 years old, and has 1 child. Hermelinda sells food from a rented stand, an activity that she carries out each day at noon. She also distributes food in containers to the market traders. At times Hermelinda also sells tuna. She needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil and salt. Hermelinda dreams of owning her own home and a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Martha Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Martha P. se ha dedicado a la actividad de elaboración y venta de alimentos que son preparados por ella con la más alta calidad acompañada con su gran experiencia en este negocio.
Ella siempre ha buscado la manera de ir mejorando en su negocio y ha logrado captar varios clientes. El crédito que actualmente solicita es para la compra de la materia prima para continuar elaborando los riquísimos platillos y de esta manera continuar supliendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha P. makes and sells high-quality prepared meals which she, herself, makes; she has a lot of experience in this line of work. She is always looking for ways to improve her business and has managed to secure several regular customers. The funding requested will be used to buy ingredients so that she can continue to prepare her delicious meals thereby continuing to meet the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Alberta es soltera, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Alberta vende ropa y zapatos a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y conocidos, sus ventas son al crédito. Además en época de cosecha hace papa seca en su casa.
Alberta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Alberta sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos fuera de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Alberta, 41, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has 2 children. Alberta sells clothing and shoes on order to her friends and acquaintances; her sales are on credit. In addition, at harvest time, she prepares dehydrated potato in her home. Alberta needs a 3000 sol loan to buy assorted clothing. Alberta dreams with providing her children with a good education outside of the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted articles of clothing.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Rosmery es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Rosmery junto a su esposo tienen una vidrieria llamada Ross, que esta ubicada en la casa de su mama, cuenta con 2 personas que ayudan en la venta de los productos.
Rosmery necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de transporte de sus productos.
Los sueños de Rosmery son comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a member of the communal bank Amauta Huamanga. She is married, 32 years old, and has 2 children. She and her husband have a glass workshop called Ross that is located in her mother's house. They have 2 people who help with the sale of their products. Rosmery needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles that she will use to pay for the transportation of their products. Rosmery dreams of being able to buy land to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the transportation of their products

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hija, Marisol tiene un cafetín en el aeropuerto de la ciudad en donde vende comida, golosinas, bebidas, cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan en la atención y preparación de la comida.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados, golosinas.
El sueño de Marisol es comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Marisol, 34, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has one daughter. She has a small café in her city's airport where she sells food, sweets and beverages. She has two people that help her tend to customers and prepare food. Marisol needs a 2500 sol loan to buy frozen treats and sweets. Marisol's dream is to buy a lot where she can build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy frozen treats and sweets.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Giovanna es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, es técnica en enfermería, Giovanna tiene una botica llamada Jhomar en un local alquilado, además vende artículos de regalo y de tocador, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
Giovanna sueña con ampliar su botica y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 38, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has two children. She is a technical nurse and has a drug store called Jhomar in a rented locale. In addition, she sells gift and beauty items every day. Giovanna needs 2000 soles to buy medicines. Giovanna dreams with enlarging her drug store and building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga.
Sandra es soltera, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Sandra es cosmetóloga y brinda servicios a domicilio y también en su misma casa. Además Sandra vende ropa variada a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito. 
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de líquidos y tintes.
Los sueños de Sandra son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Sandra, 29, is a member of the Amauta Huamanga communal bank. She is single and has two children.
