Sandra is a cosmetologist and provides home service as well as takes care of customers in her own house. In addition, Sandra sells assorted clothing on order; her sales are on credit. Sandra needs a 1500 sol loan to buy dyes and other liquid supplies. Sandra's dream is to have a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Lucinda Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lucinda, inicia su ciclo 13  con  19 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, leña, verduras, calzados, panes, golosinas, cosméticos, abarrotes en general, comida, combustibles, materiales D. construcción.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Leonora que es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Leonora venD. fruta D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado central, actividad que realiza D. lunes a viernes, mientras que los días sábados viaja a L. feria en donD. compra cereales que venD. en el mercado D. abastos.

Mientras que Elsa es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Elsa junto a su esposo tienen una tienda D. calzados en un local alquilado, sus productos los adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima y Trujillo.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. frutas, cereales, calzados, arroz, azucar, aceite, leche, carne, golosinas y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, tener local propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Lucinda begins its 13 season with 19 female members. The members all have different businesses, such as the sale of cereals, firewood, vegetables, footwear, bread, lollies, cosmetics, general grociers, food, fuel, and construction materials. For example, señora Leonora lives with her partner, is 45 years old and has 6 children. She sells fruit in the central market, an activity which she does from Monday to Friday, and on Saturdays she travels to the market where she buys cereals that she sells in the wholesale food market. Elsa lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 2 children. Together with her husband Elsa has a shoe shop in a rented place. She aquires her products in the cities of Lima and Trujillo. The members need different loan amounts, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, making a total of 9,900 soles in loans from the Banco Comunal. The loans will be invested in the purchase of fruit, cereals, shoes, rice, sugar, oil, millk, meat, lollies and cosmetics. The dreams of the members are to build their houses, own their own houses, that their children become professionals and that they improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fruit, cereals, shoes, rice, sugar, oil, milk, meat, lollies and cosmetics.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace cuatro años adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con un dinero que tenía ahorrado. Empezó alquilándola a un chofer particular y luego con el tiempo pudo adquirir otra unidad que también alquila para su respectivo trabajo. 

El tiempo de uso que se le ha otorgado a su primera mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir fallas en el motor y que necesite de reparación urgente, María no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas reparaciones, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María es una madre responsable y que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder comprarse otra unidad.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 and lives with her husband and her two children in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. It has been four years since she acquired a mototaxi (a motor vehicle for transporting cargo and passengers) with money that she saved. She began to rent the car to a chauffeur and, with time, she was able to acquire a second car that she also rented out for business. Usage over time caused the taxi to suffer motor failure and it now requires urgent repair. Maria does not have enough capital to afford these repairs and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is a responsible mother and is always finding ways to help her family get ahead. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to buy another car for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenditures for repairs and maintenance of mototaxis

loans.name: Rosa Gladiz

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Casablanca, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales desde hace seis años. Ella compra animales de poca edad para criarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado de Lambayeque y ocasionalmente a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Usualmente cría ovejas y aves de corral.

Este negocio es la fuente más estable de ingreso con la que cuenta ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola. Es por ello que Rosa está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos pero, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de progresar en el futuro. Rosa es una madre responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old, married, and living with her husband and two children in the sector Casablanca in the district Mórrope, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. Her business of six years is the purchase, care and sale of animals. She buys young animals to raise and sell them in the Lambayeque market and occasionally to the businessmen who visit the zone where they live. She typically raises sheep and poultry. This business is the most stable source of income since her husband works from time to time as an agricultural laborer. For this reason Rosa is thinking of expanding her business by purchasing more animals to raise and sell. However, since she does not have enough capital to do so, she is requesting for the first time a loan of 1000 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest wish is to give her children the opportunity to progress. Rosa is a responsible mother and is always looking after the well being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of animals to raise and sell

location.town: Caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca - Morrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Yencala Leon, distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves. El cría los animales para luego sacrificarlos y vender su carne entre los vecinos de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para su comunidad ya que provee de carne a sus vecinos, que no pueden ir hasta el mercado para adquirirla porque la zona en donde viven queda en una zona rural alejada del centro de la ciudad.

Andrés desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El es un joven bastante responsable y muy respetado en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Andrés, 30, is single and lives with his parents in the Yencala Leon sector, Lambayeque district, which is 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 6 years he has raised pigs and fowl. He raises the animals and later sacrifices them to sell their meat among his neighbors. This is a very important business in his community in that he provides his neighbors, who are unable to travel to the market because they are located in a rural area far from the city center, with meat. Andrés would like to enlarge his business purchasing more animals but he lacks sufficient capital to do so. He has called upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time therefore, to request funding in the amount of 1500 new soles. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to provide his family with a better quality of life. He is quite a responsible young man who is held in high regard in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda H. is from the village of Lower Puntod. She is 50 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Erlinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio Gordón G. quiere hacerle mejoras a su vivienda por fuera ya que desde hace años no le hace arreglos a la parte frontal de su casa. El quiere cambiarle el color y poner piso firme para que se vea mejor; la pintura esta muy descolorida y el quiere darle gusto a su esposa de escoger el color para que se vea bien.
El es una persona trabajadora de maquiladora para que a su familia no le haga falta nada y darle las comodidades que estén a su alcance es por ello que pide el apoyo de ustedes. El anteriormente se le dio un crédito en el que pago muy bien y agradece por a ver podido realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Cornelio Gordón G. wants to do some home improvements on the outside of his house because it's been years since he's improved the front of his house. He wants to change its color and install a firm floor so that it will look better; the paint is very faded and he wants to please his wife letting her choose whatever color she likes best. He is a hard-working employee of a maquiladora (bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border) so that his family will not lack anything and to provide whatever comfort he can and this is why he is asking for your help. He received a loan previously that he repaid promptly and he is grateful to have been able to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy house paint.

loans.name: Helder

texts.es: Helder C. R. esta muy contento de la familia que tiene es por ello que el desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. La casa que el tiene es de Interés social es muy pequeña y necesita algunos arreglos, las paredes con el tiempo se van deteriorando y la puerta la cierra con una cadena atravesada para que este protegida de algún delincuente que quiera robar. Pero el y su esposa al momento de irse a trabajar no se quedan a gusto por que la casa se queda sola y temen que puedan tirar la puerta y robar las pertenencias que con mucho esfuerzo han ido comprando.
texts.en:
Helder C. R. is very happy with the family he has and for this reason wants to give them a better quality of life. The house he has is a very small, publicly subsidized house, that needs repair. The walls have deteriorated over time and the door must be closed with a chain through it so that it can be protected against any delinquent that may want to rob them. He and his wife worry when they leave to go to work because their house is left unattended and they fear that someone could simply push the door down and take their belongings which they have worked so very hard to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair walls and doors.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es: Claudia Elena S. tiene un negocio que empezó desde hace un año vendiendo fritos, chicharrones, dulces, pan de barra y mas. Ella quiere surtir y tener más mercancía para mejorar sus ventas. Claudia es madre soltera de 2 hijos a quien tiene que vestir y dar de comer es por ello que lucha cada día para darles una buena educación ya que es lo único que puede darles por el momento, es por ello que pide el apoyo para tener mas ganancias y así mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia Elena S. started a business a year ago selling Fritos, fried pork rinds, candies, loaves of bread, and other items. She wants to vary her stock so that her sales will improve. Claudia is a single mother of two children that she must clothe and feed so she struggles daily to provide a good education for them since this is all she can give them for the time being. She asks for help so that her profits will be better and thus her quality of life will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente ya lleva varios prestamos el cual esta agradecido por que el apoyo que se le da lo ha aprovechado muy bien. El desde hace 4 años que fue pensionado opto por vender ropa usada para poder mantener a su familia. En este momento el quiere comprar mas mercancía por el cambio de clima que se aproxima para no estar desprevenido y así tener mas ganancias para su negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardo has proven to be an excellent client; he has had several loans already for which he is grateful because he has used them well. Four years ago, when he was laid off from work, he opted to sell used clothing to support his family. At the present time he wants to buy more merchandise now that the season is about to change with the weather. He wants to be prepared so that his profits will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa Maria C. esta agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindo ya que ella ha visto resultados  satisfactorios en su negocio desde que se le dio su primer crédito, observo  el cambio económico  ya que ha ido prosperando poco a poco . Este crédito lo quiere para comprar mas mercancía para su tienda llamada “Estanquillo Rosa” que ya tiene 18 años de estar establecido y para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener mas ganancias quiere comprar mercancía nueva para que su clientes encuentren lo que buscan y se vallan satisfechos por las compras.
texts.en:
Rosa María C. is grateful for the help she has received in that she has seen satisfactory results in her business since she got her first loan. She noted a change in her economy in that she has been making progress little by little. This loan will be used to buy more stock items for her store, called "Estanquillo Rosa," which has been in business now for 18 years and to improve her quality of life having higher profits to buy new merchandise so that her customers will find what they are looking for and leave satisfied with their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rath

texts.en: Rath T. is 60 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, where she owns and operates a small farming business. She has been growing rice since before 1998. Rath T. is married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She now has two children. One of her children is married and lives independently. The other one is single and sews clothes to help provide income for the family’s living expenses. Currently Rath T. faces difficulty with irrigating her crop because her farm is far from the watering system. To solve the problem, she looks for a loan to purchase a used machine to pump the water. (Rath T. was busy working at her farm when the photo taken so her daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a used pump

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mr. Chin C., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Poe Dany, 24, live with their parents along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple just has a young son. Chin was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Chin is a construction worker and is a motor taxi driver as well. His wife used to be a garment factory worker but she now stays at home to take care of their son.

Chin is asking for his second loan of US$500 to help provide capital to enable his sister to purchase vegetables to sell and a cart to carry them.

loans.use: To provide capital for his sister to purchase vegetables and a cart

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok R. is 47 years old and resides in Kampong Chhnang province. She was not available for the photo, so her husband is shown instead.

Hok R. owns and operates a small handicraft business in which the main activity is making traditional clay stoves. She buys clay from people who live near the mountain and turns them into many sets of stoves at her home.

Hok R. also relies on the income from her husband who works in construction. The couple was married years ago and is blessed with three children: one is married and has ready started a new home while other two are single.

Hok R. has been building a new home for a few months but the construction is suspended due to the lack of equipment. In order to continue building her house, she requested a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy articles required for housebuilding

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang P. (photographed with her daughter) has been a farmer for 20 years. She is 57 years old and lives along National Road No. 1 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has nine children:  three sons and six daughters. Two of them are married and live away from the family home, two are garment factory workers, three attend school and the other two assist their mother with the farm. 
Heang is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum T., 29, is a garment factory employee who earns a salary to feed her young child. She sews cloth in the factory and earns an average wage of $70 a month.

Chum T. is married, but she divorced her husband when her child was a baby. She is taking out her loan to buy a cow which she will rent for a fee to farmers who need a cow to plow their farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to rent out

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao Chhai and her husband, Mr. Chea Pen, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six sons, one of whom is a security guard, two are fishermen, and the other three are in school.

Mao and her husband have been fishing for more than ten years. They catch fish in the lake at the back of their house and sell them at the Koki market.

Mao is requesting her second loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. She also will use a part of her loan to purchase piglets to raise. She will able to earn extra income from selling the pigs after they grow big enough.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and piglets to raise

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Miss Yan C., 29, is single and lives with her parents and brother in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Yan has been a silk weaver for five years – a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Yan is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Dit

texts.en: Dit T. has some beauty tools to provide a service for wedding parties. She is also hired by people to do their makeup before they join a party. She is a divorced woman who currently has two young school-aged kids who are dependent on her income. She lives with her old father who is a rice farmer. Dit T. makes $12 a day which she uses to solve her family’s financial problems. Dit T. has been running her trade for a long time but she requires more accessories to perform her service. That is why she decided to look for a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL.

loans.use: To purchase accessories

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich R., 47, has been a scarf weaver for five years. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to build a shop for her son’s tailoring business. She will also use part of her loan to buy cotton thread for her scarf-weaving business. 

Mrs. Pich R. has six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of them are married and live in separate homes and the youngest is the tailor. She lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To build a shop for her son’s tailoring business and buy cotton thread for her scarf weaving business

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie F. is from the village of Alitaya, Mangaldan, Pangasinan, Philippines. He is 31 years old, married, and has an infant-aged child. To make a living, Freddie operates a family member's rice processing business. While not the only means of revenue, providing rice-processing services to local community members is the main source of income for the business. Freddie has been engaged in his business for over 10 years, and he earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Freddie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services that would help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Freddie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in his business's expansion. This loan will be Freddie's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients consist mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expand rice processing business

loans.name: José Santiago

texts.es: José Santiago Caravantesde 40 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposa y su hijo de dos años de edad. Él  posee un centro de distribución y venta de sorbetes y paletas, las cuales las comercializa por mayoreo o por unidad. Este negocio lo ha tenido durante 11 años, lo cual le ha demostrado que es muy rentable. Es por ello que el desea poder invertir más en el, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de sorbetes y paletas, así también conos para colocar los sorbetes. José cuenta con la ventaja de tener su heladería en un lugar de mucho comercio, debido que esta rodeado de escuelas, otros negocios y así mismo se encuentra muy próximo al mercado del lugar. Esto le incentiva mucho a poder seguir adelante con su venta, la cual se transforma en ganancias para el presente y futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
José Santiago C., 40, lives in Cojutepeque, in Cuscatlán Department. His family consists of his wife and two-year-old son. He has a distribution facility selling sorbets and popsicles, either wholesale or by the piece. He has had this business for 11 years, and it has proved to be very profitable. Therefore he wants to increase his investment in it, and has requested a loan in order to purchase a larger quantity of sorbets and popsicles, as well as cones for the sorbets. José has the advantage of having his ice cream shop in a busy commercial area surrounded by schools and other businesses, as well as being located very close to the marketplace. This motivates him to keep on with his sales, which translate into earnings for the present and future benefit of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sorbets and popsicles for his business

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Aisas

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisas S., 40, has been selling recycling materials for four years, while her husband has been a security guard for five years. She wants to create a new business raising a cow; she will be able to earn extra income from selling the cow after it grows big enough. Hence she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to raise.

Aisas and her husband, Mr. Kasoem S., 45, were married in 1997 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two children are married and live away from the family home. One is a garment factory worker and the other two attend school. The family lives along National Road No. 6 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth G. G., reside en Opico en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. A sus 24 años de edad, Roxana posee la responsabilidad de un hogar y el de trabajar por brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos junto a su esposo. Es por ello que Roxana posee una tienda de productos perecederos desde hace 3 años, la cual nació con la esperanza de tener una vida mejor. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos perecederos, sobre todo aquellos que cuentan con mayor demanda tales como: detergente, huevos y leche entre otros más. Roxana espera mejorar la situación económica de su hogar, ya que con anterioridad no había podido invertir en la tienda debido a que las necesidades del hogar le han exigido las ganancias del negocio, es por ello que su esperanza es el mejorar las ventas gracias al dinero obtenido del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth G. G. lives with her husband and 2 school-age children in Opico, La Libertad Department. At the age of 24, Roxana takes care of both home and work in order to provide a better life for her husband and children. This is why Roxana has had a shop selling household goods for the last 3 years, which she began with the hope of a better life. She is asking for a loan to purchase a larger quantity of products, above all those that are in the greatest demand such as detergent, eggs, and milk among other things. Roxana hopes to improve the economic situation of her home, since up to this time she has not been able to invest in the shop because she had to spend the earnings of the business on her household needs. This is why she hopes for greater sales thanks to the funds obtained from the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household products

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La señora María Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 66 años y 8 hijos, ya son independientes.

Su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de verduras como: (maduros, yucas, fréjol huasca, habas), y se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. 

María Victoria, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su tienda diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todas las verduras que el ama de casa necesita y es ella, quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma y amabilidad que siempre le ha caracterizado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará racimos de plátanos, sacos de yucas, kilos de maní y fréjoles en diferentes variedades. 

María Victoria, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. María Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs), which is in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 66 years old, married, and has eight children, all of whom are independent.

Motivated by her desire to fulfill her dreams, María Victoria started her own business selling produce, such as plantains, cassava, and different varieties of beans. Her vending location is in the Central Market in her district.

To date, María Victoria has been gaining customers who come by daily to buy from her because she carries all the vegetables that a housewife needs. She greets each of her customers with her charismatic and friendly personality.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase produce such as bananas in bunches, sacks of cassava, peanuts by the kilo, and beans of different varieties. María Victoria feels very strongly about continuing her work and is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her to have opportunities to develop in the communities where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 11 hijos, 03 que aun están bajo su poder y dependen de ella.

Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de verduras como: (papa, yuca, plátano, maíz molido), se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes fijos, que ya conocen del trabajo que realiza. 

Santos, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su puesto diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todas las verduras que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará verduras como: racimos de plátanos, sacos de yucas, fréjoles en diferentes variedades, kilos de maíz. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas mercaderas, así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Santos, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs), which is in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of eleven children, three of whom are still dependent on her.

Motivated by her desire to fulfill her dreams, Santos started her own business selling produce, such as potatoes, cassava, bananas, and cornmeal. Her vending location is in the Central Market in her district, which is well-suited for attending to her customers who have known about her work.

To date, Santos has been gaining customers who come by daily to buy from her she carries all the vegetables that a housewife needs. She personally greets each of her customers with the charisma that she possesses.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will purchase produce such as bananas in bunches, sacks of cassava, beans of different varieties, and kilos of corn. Part of the money will also be used to buy shopping bags so that she can keep her customers happy.

Santos feels very strongly about continuing her work. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her to have opportunities to develop in the communities where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase produce & shopping bags

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo B. is from the village of Lobong, San Jacinto, Pangasinan. He is 36 years old. Reynaldo is single. To make a living, Reynaldo owns & operates a business providing recycling services, hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional waste & junk material to sell. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP. which will be used to purchase additional waste & junk material to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Reynaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste & junk material to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana B. de 59 años de edad, reside en Apopa. Vive junto a su esposo y una hija menor de edad. Feliciana posee una tortillería en la cual su hija le ayuda, repartiéndolas en las casas de sus clientes. Así mismo la señora Feliciana, vende huevos, golosinas y pan, de manera que pueda obtener algunas ganancias extras. Ella se destaca por ser una señora muy trabajadora y honrada, la cual sabe apreciar la oportunidad que tiene de poseer un negocio lo cual en la actualidad es muy difícil de sostener, sobre todo cuando la mayor cantidad de ganancias están siendo usadas para los gastos del hogar. Feliciana solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con la capacidad monetaria de poder comprar maíz al por mayor y de esta manera poder obtener la materia prima de su productos a precios más bajo, así mismo desea poder comprar otros productos perecederos para surtir la pequeña venta que posee.
texts.en:
Feliciana B., 59, lives with her husband and one daughter in Apopa. Feliciana is helped by her daughter in a tortilla business, they deliver to the homes of their clients. Also, señora Feliciana sells eggs, candies, and bread for extra profit. She stands out as an honest, hard-working woman who knows how to take advantage of the opportunity to have a business, which is difficult to maintain because she must spend most of the profits on household expenses. Feliciana is requesting a loan in order to purchase corn, the raw material for her products, at the lower wholesale price. She also would like to buy other household products in order to increase her small sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and other household products

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Delina

texts.es:
La señora Delina,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 65 años tiene 03 hijos, los 03 ya son independientes.  

Delina, es una mujer trabajadora y con su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. Venta D. Cosméticos D. la línea Esika, y Oriflame, sin tener que tener un jefe y horario. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada, ella venD. al contado y al crédito con pagos D. manera diaria, semanal quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 800.00, comprará productos D. belleza como: colonias, esmaltes, bisutería como aretes, collares y anillos, así como perfumes para varón que salen en ofertas, quiere tener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Delina, sueña con crecer en este negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella para ganar buenos premios. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Delina is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank, which is in the District and Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is 65 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are independent.

Delina is a working woman who has always had a fighting spirit and the desire to succeed. With her own resources, she started a business selling cosmetics from the Esika and Oriflame lines. She neither reports to a boss nor has a set schedule. Gradually she has become known among her customers and today she says her business is doing very well. She currently has a loyal clientele. Delina sells her products through cash payments or credit installments on a daily, weekly, biweekly, or monthly basis.

With her loan of 800 soles, she will buy beauty products, such as perfumes, nail polishes, costume jewelry (necklaces and rings), and men’s cologne. Delfina wants her business to be well-stocked so that she can give her customers good service and proviD. them with what they need. She dreams of growing her business and becoming one of the top sellers in order to win prizes. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Delfina has been able to continue her business along with many other women who want to grow personally and as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Andrea De Jesús

texts.es: Andrea de Jesús R. de 46 años de edad, reside en el Departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales son todos menores de edad y se dedican a estudiar. Andrea es una mujer muy humilde y de buenos valores, la cual se esfuerza día con día por brindarles una vida digna a sus hijos. Ella trabaja arduamente en su hogar, haciendo y vendiendo tortillas, así mismo posee una venta de Shampoo, cigarros y especias.  Andrea solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, así mismo comprar una reserva de cilindros de gas propano. De esta misma manera ella desea iniciar su propia tienda de productos perecederos, debido a que Andrea es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, ella debe buscar la manera de poder obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual beneficie en gran manera a sus hijos, los cuales son la inspiración para que ella se esfuerce más y más por lograr sus metas de poder mejorar su negocio, todo con vista en el presente y futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andrea de Jesús R., 46, lives in the Departamento de San Salvador. She lives with her four children, all still in school. Andrea is a modest woman of strong values, motivated to provide a decent life for her children. She works hard in the home, making and selling tortillas, and she also sells shampoo, cigarettes and spices. Andrea is requesting a loan so she can buy a larger quantity of corn, as well as extra tanks of propane gas. She hopes to start her own shop selling household products. Since she is a single mother with four children, she must find a way to increase her earnings. This will greatly benefit her children, who are her inspiration to keep striving to achieve her goal of improving her business, always with the present and future of her children in view.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and propane gas

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the village of Lobong, San Jacinto, Pangasinan. She is 50 years old. Lourdes is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Delicia

texts.es:
La señora María Delicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal ”Santa Ana” Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 66 años, 03 hijos, los 03 ya son independientes.

María Delicia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atender a sus clientes. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital S/. 200.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
María Delicia, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
María Delicia, 66, is a member of the "Santa Ana" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are independent. María Delicia is a hard-working and tenacious woman who decided to set up her own carbonated beverage business. She tends to her customers herself with neither a schedule nor a boss. She tells us that she began with a capital investment of 200 soles and bought 5 cases of soft-drinks. When she saw that she did well, little by little she began to invest more. Currently, she has the same business and is well-known by her customers, who are her neighbors, family members and friends. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy cases of soft-drinks in various flavors, sizes and brands as well as still and sparkling mineral water. María Delicia has many goals before her and she is very motivated to make her dreams come true and to reach those goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help. She is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa Lidia S. V. D. M. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en el Departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a un nieto D. 17 años D. edad, el cual se ha transformado en la razón por la cual debe esforzarse día con día. Rosa posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual no cuenta con muchas unidades para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Así mismo posee una panadería, negocio con el cual cuenta gracias a que desD. muy pequeña aprendió el oficio D. hacer pan, lo cual en el presente le ha permitido subsistir. 
 La señora Rosa solicita un préstamo, todo con la ilusión D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar harina, huevos, utensilios para hornear el pan, así mismo poder surtir la tienda, ya que ella desea poder contar con más productos D. primera necesidad como, comida enlatada, embutidos y otros más. Rosa es una persona la cual necesita mejorar sus ganancias, ya que esto le permitirá poder no solamente tener una vida mejor en la actualidad, sino también poder ahorrar para su vejez, lo cual es uno D. sus mayores deseos.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia S. V. D. M., 53, is living in the Departamento D. San Salvador. She lives with a 17-year-old nephew, who has become her inspiration to keep striving day by day. Rosa has a shop selling household items, although she does not have much stock to offer to her clients. She also has a bakery, thanks to the fact that she recently learned how to make bread, and this has supported her. Señora Rosa is requesting a loan in order to stock the shop with more daily necessities such as canned goods, cold meats, and other things. Rosa needs to increase her earnings, not only in order to improve her present life, but also to save for her old age, which is one of her greatest desires.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, eggs, and other daily necessities

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng I., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Sok (pictured together), 39, were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. They live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Chheng has been a construction worker for three years. He works in his village. Mrs. Kunthea Sok has been producing rice wine for 16 years. 

Chheng is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to help his wife purchase additional materials for producing rice wine and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy materials for producing rice wine and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Exsilda

texts.es:
La señora Exsilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 63 años  y es madre de 06 hijos, ya independientes.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Exsilda, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Exsilda, 63, is a member of the "Santa Ana" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of six children, all of whom are now independent. Her character and desire to see her dreams come true motivated her to open her own grocery store in her home. The earnings from the store go to meeting household expenses. From the beginning she has been acquiring regular customers. Currently, they come to her house on a regular basis because they find all the items a housewife needs and because they receive the personal attention that she, herself, gives them with her characteristic good humor and charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cookies, pasta, packages of salt, cases of milk and preserved fish of various brands, flats of eggs and personal hygiene items to continue to provide excellent customer service. Exsilda feels good to continue to work and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos pequeños, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Luzmila, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a pesar de las dificultades, que paso en el trascurso de su vida, siguió adelante. Lleva 08 años, dedicandose a este tipo de actividad y hoy en día vende productos de catálogos de línea: Avon y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Luzmila, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 42, is a member of the "Las Abejitas" communal bank, which is located in the Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She has two small children who are in school and who depend on her. Luzmila is a hard-working and tenacious woman who sells beauty products. Despite the difficulties she has had in life, she has forged ahead. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and she sells catalogue-listed products of the Avon brand. She is very happy to have accomplished this. With this 800 sol loan she will buy beauty poroducts to stock her inventory like: perfumes for women and men, creams, compact powder, talcs for adults and babies, lipsticks, nail polish, as well as a display case to exhibit her wares. Luzmila, with her level of maturity, is an example to many women who are starting out in business and who, with perseverance, reach their goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her own business and for helping other women as well to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeun L., age 59, and her husband, Mr. Thorn Lois, age 63, are farmers. They grow rice and cucumber on their farmland in the village. They have been married since 1970 and have ten children: three sons and seven daughters. Six of them are married and live in separate homes and the other four work in a garment factory. The family lives approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Yeun and her husband do not have enough capital to maintain their farm. So, Yeun is asking for her first loan of $1,100 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed and pay for plowing

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Manuela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es  Soltera, tiene 43 años, es madre de 04 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Manuela, lleva años vendiendo pasamanería como floreros, peluches, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y el carisma  que siempre le caracteriza. Nos cuenta que le va muy en su negocio y trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,600.00, comprará pasamanería como: floreros y peluches. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos.

Manuela, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Manuela belongs to the Las Abejitas Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 43, single, and has four dependent children. For years Manuela has been selling decorative items like vases and stuffed animals. Little by little she was generating her own income and saving her money. Her business is in an area in her house that is well equipped to tend to her customers. She always waits on them with her characteristic kindness and charisma. She tells us that it is going very well for her in her business. She works on orders that her customers make. She will use this loan for 1,600 PEN to buy decorative items like vases and stuffed animals. She will use part of the money to buy a display case where she can show her products. Manuela now feels like a fulfilled woman with a great desire to make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and for helping many women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy decorative items like vases and stuffed animals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Nancy, lleva varios años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.

Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1300.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Nancy, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the “Las Abejitas” Communal Bank, in the Moyobamba district of Moyobamba province, Department of San Martin, Peru. She is 39 years old and married, and has 3 children who still depend on her. For many years Nancy has been working as a dressmaker. Bit by bit she generated her own income and saved her money, as she wanted to set up her own dressmaking shop. Since she had good sewing skills she was confident in doing this, and with the help of the Manuela Ramos movement she decided to set up her own business, located in her home. She tells us the her dressmaking work is going well. She works completing orders that her customers have made in advance. She attends to them with her characteristic charisma and good nature. With this loan of 1300 Peruvian soles, she will buy fabrics by the meter, of different types and colors, and also instruments for cutting, large spools of thread in various colors, sewing needles, pins, and buttons. Today Nancy feels like a very fulfilled woman, with the desire to achieve and make real the rest of her dreams. She thanks the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her start her business and for helping many women who want to grow in their business skills.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Teresa Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Teresa del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 04 hijas, que aun dependen de ella, es por esta razón que se esfuerza día a día.

Teresa del Pilar, se dedica a la confección de manualidades y venta de juguetes, se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 
Teresita, como le dicen de cariño, es una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día, le pone empeño a su trabajo, de esta manera, cumplir sus demás sueños y darle una buena educación a sus hijas y verlas profesional, mas adelante.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará materiales, para la confección de sus diseños como: temperas profesionales, pinceles, lápices, telas, para sus manualidades. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes de plástico para niños y niñas.

Teresa del Pilar, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciarse en su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa del Pilar belongs to the “Las Abejitas” Communal Bank, in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 38 years old, in a stable relationship, and the mother of 4 daughters who still depend on her. It is for them that she endeavors day after day. Teresa del Pilar dedicates herself to making hand-sewn artistry and selling toys. Her shop is located in her own house, in an ambiance well conditioned for attending to her customers. Teresita, as she is lovingly called, is a very hard-working woman who day after day, puts much effort into her work. In this manner, she attempts to achieve her dreams and provide a good education for her daughters and see them become professionals down the road. With this loan of 1,300 New Sols she will buy materials to create her designs, including professional patterns, artist's brushes, pencils, and cloth for making her hand-sewn artistry. Part of the money will be used to buy plastic toys for boys and girls. Teresa del Pilar today feels like an accomplished woman, with much desire to continue forward and turn her dreams into reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela de Ramos for helping her start her business, as well as those of many other women who wished to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY  MATERIALS FOR MAKING HER EMBROIDERY AND PLASTIC TOYS TO SELL

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun S., age 51, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhoeun Khim, age 52, live along National Road Number six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1979 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One son is a fisherman and the other one is a driver. Their daughter is attending school.   

Sun and his wife are rice farmers. He is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to assist him on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Doris Judith

texts.es:
La señora Doris Judith,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.  

Doris Judith, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que ejerce. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la línea: Esika, Unique y Avon y ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad.
En la actualidad cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada. Doris Judith, vende sus productos de belleza al contado y al crédito, con pagos de manera diaria, semanal, quincenal o mensual.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00, comprará productos de belleza como: colonias refrescantes, perfumes para damas y caballeros, billuteria como aretes, collares y anillos. Anhela implementar más su negocio y contar con una buena cantidad de productos de belleza en stock, de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes fijos.

Doris Judith, sueña con crecer en el negocio y llegar a ser una vendedora estrella. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris Judith belongs to the communal bank Las Abejitas, in the district of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martin. She is 41 years old, single and the mother of one son that she supports. Doris Judith is a woman who is very dedicated to her family, happy and charismatic—qualities that help in her business. She sells cosmetics from various lines: Esika, Unique, Avon. She has already been doing this for several years and has a loyal clientele. She sells these beauty products for cash or credit with payments on a daily, weekly, biweekly or monthly basis. With this loan of 3000 PEN she will buy beauty products such as scented deodorants, women’s perfumes, and men’s cologne. She will also by jewelry to sell: earrings, necklaces, and rings. She longs to increase her business and have a large inventory of beauty products for sale, thus satisfying her regular customers. Doris Judith dreams of growing her business and becoming a star in sales. She would like to thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to develop personally and professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre de 05 hijos, ya independientes.

Josefina, lleva 05 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicado en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Josefina, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Josefina belongs to the communal bank Las Abejitas in the district of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martin. She is 64 years old, married and the mother of 5 children who are all now independent. Josefina has been engaged in clothing production for 5 years. Little by little she has generated her own income and is saving money to start her own shop. Because she has good sewing skills and the help of the Manuela Ramos Movement she has no doubt that she can do it, building a shop in her own home with a nice environment to serve her customers. She tells us that she is doing well in sales, working on many advance orders from her customers. Currently she continues with her business and has a very loyal clientele, with customers coming daily to put in orders. She serves them all herself with her characteristic friendliness. With this loan of 1000 PEN she will buy different kinds of fabric in bulk, and tools such as scissors, needles, sewing machines, pins and buttons. Josefina today feels like a very accomplished woman with even more desire to achieve and fulfill her dreams. She wants to thank the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sewing materials

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 52 años y 05 hijas, ya independientes.

Isabel, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con ganas de seguir adelante, así aportar en el ingreso económico, en su hogar.
Lleva 05 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse más en el campo, así que con su esfuerzo estableció un pequeño ambiente, ubicado en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde atiende  a sus clientes; con el carisma y alegría que siempre le ha caracterizado. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos de arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos de plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.

Isabel, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Activas de Belen” in the district of Moyobamba, in the Province of Moyobamba, in the Department of San Martin. She is in a domestic partnership, is 52 years old and has 5 independent daughters. Isabel is a hard-working and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and bring in more income to help support her home. She has been working in food sales, and seeing that it generates a good income, she decided to work more in this area. She put in the effort to open a small stand located in the Central Market in her district. She attends to her clients with the charisma and joy that have always characterized her. Currently she is continuing with the same business and tells us that it is going very well and that already she is well-known and has a good reception. With this loan of 1500 PEN she will buy supplies to prepare her dishes, such as kilos of rice, sugar, potatoes, plantains, live chickens in crates; as well as some kitchen tools to replace the old ones. Isabel feels that she is a calm, happy, and successful woman with a desire to ensure a peaceful retirement. She would like to thank the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to fulfill her dreams and goals, as well as for helping other women who want to grow professionally.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, del Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 43 años y 04 hijos, 02  que aun dependen de ella.

Consuelo, se dedica a la venta de aguajes y turrones, iniciándose con un capital de S/. 100.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio, por las mañanas y tardes,  ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio y esta muy  contenta con el trabajo que realiza.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará sacos de aguaje, maní en sacos, para sus turrones.

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Ms. Consuelo belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Activas de Belen”, in the district of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She is 43 years old, single, and has 4 children, two of whom are dependent on her. Consuelo sells aguajes (a small fruit) and nougat. She started with working capital of 100 PEN, and continues today with the same business. She works in the mornings and afternoons. Her stand is located in the center of the city. She tells us she is doing very well in her business and is very pleased with the work that she does. With this loan of 3000 PEN she will buy aguajes, and bags of peanuts to make the nougat. She feels very happy despite the difficulties she knows are part of trying to get ahead with her family. She recognizes the strong support that the Manuela Ramos Movement is providing to her and to other women in the San Martin region.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and nuts

loans.name: Nisida

texts.es:
La señora Nisida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 23 años y 01 hijo, que aun  depende de ella.

Nisida, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y granos, hace varios años atrás donde poco a poco, fue implementando su negocio. Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños y seguir adelante, le motivaron a establecer su negocio, ubicado en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Posteriormente, con cuyas ganancias, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de verduras.

Nisida, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su tienda diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todos los productos, que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra de granos, en diferentes especies.

Nisida, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Nisida is a member of the "Mujeres Activas de Belén” Community Bank in the district of Moyobamaba, Moyobamba Province, San Martin Provincial Department. She is 23 year old, single and has one son, who she still supports. Nisida sells groceries and grains. She started her business many years ago and built it little by little. Her character and yearning to follow her dreams and move forward have motivated her to establish her business in the district's central market. With the income from her business she later decided to implement a vegetables sales business. She has been gaining customers, who come to her store daily since they can find everything a household needs there. She tends to them herself, with the kindness and charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of S/.3,000.00 she will buy sacs of rice and sugar, noodles in packages, boxed milk and fish preserves in a variety of brands, household cleaning supplies and personal health items to better serve her customers. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of different types of grains. Nisida is very motivated to continue working. She is very thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunity to improve themselves within the activity they develop.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Rosa Nery

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Nery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas de Belén”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 08 hijos, 06 que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Desde entonces, poco a poco, ha ido ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y supo salir adelante.

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta que sus ventas, le están yendo muy bien y sus clientes día a día, acuden a su tienda a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todo lo necesario, que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal, paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa Nery, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R. por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Rosa Nery belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Activas de Belén,” located in the Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 40 years old, and is the mother of 8 children, 6 of whom are still dependent upon her. Her personality and her desire to accomplish her dreams motivated her to start her own business selling groceries, located in the central market of her district. Since then, little by little, she has gained experience in this type of activity and has learned how to succeed. Rosita, as she is affectionately called, tells us that her sales are going very well and that her customers come to her store each day to buy because she has all of the necessary items that a housewife could need. She personally attends to her customers with her characteristic charm. With this loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, packaged noodles, cartons of milk and boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, household cleaning and personal care products and packs of soft drinks with different flavors and brands so that she can satisfy her clients and provide them with better service. Rosa Nery feels very capable of continuing to work, and she is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela R. organization for helping women like herself so that they can have the opportunity to develop in their field of enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Vannsy

texts.en:
Mr. Vannsy P. (pictured here), age 41, and his wife, Mrs. Sarun Ung, age 40, have been married since 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and the other two stay at home. The family lives approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vannsy has been a construction contractor for 27 years and his wife has been a farmer for two years. He doesn’t have enough construction materials to operate his business and he wants to purchase more. So, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Patricia Yesenia

texts.es: Patricia Yesenia O. D. S. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como contador, y junto a sus dos hijas quienes estudian. Patricia posee una venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, y así mismo posee una pequeña librería, la cual desea poder surtirla, debido a que esta es la única que esta ubicada en su colonia, por esto cuenta con muchos clientes, a los cuales en muchas ocasiones no pueD. brindarles todo lo que solicitan debido a que no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir la librería y equiparla con todo lo necesario. es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda en primer lugar surtir la librería con todo lo necesario para poder brindarles el mejor servicio a sus clientes, así mismo desea poder comprar más productos D. primera necesidad con los cuales surta la tienda y así D. esta manera podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Patricia Yesenia O. D. S. is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters in San Salvador. Her husband is an accountant and her daughters are still in school. Patricia owns a grocery store, which sells basic products, and a small bookstore. She wishes to add merchandise to the bookstore since it’s the only one in their neighborhood. She has a lot of customers, but she is sometimes unable to proviD. the products they need because she does not have the money to buy merchandise for the bookstore. This is the reason why she is requesting this loan. She wants to purchase merchandise for the bookstore to be able to proviD. a better service to her customers.
