She would also like to buy more basic products to supply her grocery store and be able to obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper goods and merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Amilcar

texts.es: Juan Amílcar G. E. de 43 años de edad, reside en Apopa, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Juan posee una venta de trapeadores, los cuales el también los elabora con la ayuda de su esposa. Así mismo cultiva maíz junto a su hijo mayor, producto el cual lo vende por mayor a sus clientes. Juan es un hombre muy responsable el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, y así mismo ha sabido enseñarles a sus hijos el valor del trabajo. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de los trapeadores, ya que es este el negocio más rentable para Juan debido a que sus ganancias son diarias y los puede vender durante todo el año, a diferencia del maíz el cual debe esperar a que este listo para vender. Juan desea poder mejorar la economía de su hogar y de esta manera brindarles todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Amílcar G. E. is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in Apopa, San Salvador. Juan makes and sells mops with his wife’s help. He also grows corn with his oldest son and sells it at wholesale. Juan is very responsible and cares about his family’s well being. He has taught his sons the value of work. He is requesting a loan to buy materials to make mops. This is the most profitable business for Juan since it provides daily income and can be sold year round. Corn on the other hand, has a waiting time until it’s ready for sale. Juan hopes to improve his family’s income and to be able to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make mops.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es: Rosa Marina M. A. de 55 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y así mismo como agricultor, tres hijos y un nieto. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, como sopas, embutidos, leche, crema y otros productos más. Rosa es una señora muy trabajadora la cual cuenta con muy buena reputación por parte de sus vecinos ya que siempre se ha esforzado por ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y por trabajar arduamente por sus hijos, dos de los cuales ayudan a su padre en el cultivo de maíz. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda con todo lo necesario para poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa Marina M. A. is 55 years old. She lives with her husband, three children and a grandson in Tonacatepeque, San Salvador. Her husband is a bricklayer and a farmer. She owns a general store where she sells basic products, such as soups, sausages, milk, cream and others. Rosa is a hardworking lady who has a great reputation with her neighbors. She has made a great effort to help her husband with the household expenses and to work hard for her children, two of which help their dad growing corn. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her store hoping to improve her sales and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe G. D.  P. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Apopa, vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero y su hijo D. 13 años D. edad el cual se dedica a estudiar. Guadalupe posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y así mismo un taller D. corte y confección en el cual se encarga D. realizar prendas D. vestir para hombres, mujeres y niños. Así mismo ella elabora ropa sin pedido previo los cuales los comercializa con las personas D. la zona, esto con el fin D. obtener otras fuentes D. ingresos. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar hilo, telas, botones y todo lo relacionado a la materia prima que ella utiliza para realizar su trabajo. Ella desea poder brindarle una mejor ayuda económica a su esposo, es por ello que trabaja tanto por obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Guadalupe G. D. P. is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her 13 year-old son in the municipality of Apopa. Her husband is a carpenter and her son is still in school. Guadalupe owns a store where she sells perishable products and a sewing shop where she makes clothes for men, women and children. She also makes clothes to sell around her neighborhood in order to earn additional income. Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy sewing materials such as threads, fabric, and buttons. She hopes to be in a better position to help her husband financially; she works really hard to bring additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing material.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Sara Inés

texts.es: Sara Inés G. D. de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su pequeña hija de 8 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Residen en el municipio de Opico en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella posee una panadería en la cual se encarga de hacer y vender el pan, el cual es cocinado en un horno artesanal hecho de ladrillo y cemento. Este negocio es el cual le permite llevarle el sustento diario a su hija y así mismo poder darle todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. Sara solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda reparar el techo del lugar en el cual esta ubicado el horno, debido a que ella no cuenta con el dinero para poder arreglarlo, lo cual le urge  ya que en tiempos de lluvia esto se vuelve totalmente incomodo, debido a que el horno se moja y esto le impide elaborar el pan mientras llueve, lo cual la atrasa con los pedidos de pan. Sara es una mujer quien trabaja mucho por su hija, ya que es madre soltera, lo cual hace que deba esforzarse el doble por el bienestar de su pequeña.
texts.en:
Sara Ines Gomez is 31 years old. She lives with her little daughter, who is eight years old and goes to school. They live in the town of Opico in the department of La Libertad. She has a bakery in which she makes and sells the bread. It is baked in an artisanal oven made from brick and cement. This business is what allows her to support herself and her daughter as well as give her everything she needs for a dignified life. Sara is asking for a loan with which she will be able to repair the roof in the place where the oven is located. She does not have the money to be able to repair it. It is urgent, because in the rainy season it becomes completely uncomfortable, since the oven gets wet and this impedes her from making bread while it rains. This slows down the bread orders. Sara is a woman who works a lot for her daughter, since she is a single mother. This makes her double her efforts for the wellbeing of her little girl.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the Roof of her Home

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Aracely R. H. de 43 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo  sus dos hijos. Ella posee un taller de confección de ropa para hombre, mujeres y niños, la cual la comercializa en su hogar o de manera ambulante. Así mismo se encarga de trabajar por pedidos, lo cual es lo más usual en su forma de trabajo. Aracely es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y muy responsable la cual realiza su trabajo a tiempo y así mismo desempeña una labor excelente, razón por la cual las personas la prefieren. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar repuestos para la maquina de coser, así mismo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de tela, hilos y botones. Para Aracely el hecho de mejorar sus ganancias la incentiva mucho ya que para ella es vital brindarle ayuda económica a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Aracely R. H. is 43 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, in the Departament of La Libertad, El Salvador. She lives with her husband and her two children. She has a workshop where she makes clothing for men, women and children, which she sells from her home or door to door. She also works to order, which is quite typical in her line of work. Aracely is someone who distinguishes herself with her hard work and responsibility. She finishes her work on time and also does an excellent job, which is why people prefer her work. She is asking for a loan through which she can buy replacement parts for her sewing machine, and also to be able to buy more cloth, thread and buttons. For Aracely the opportunity to improve her earnings is a great incentive, because it is vital for her to offer her husband help paying the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, thread and buttons.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Elminaz

texts.en: Elminaz is 55 years old. She is married and has seven children. The Mammadov family lives in the Fuzuli region. She has been in the cattle business for 15 years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy four calves to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Mrs. Nangheng Ann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan consists of 11 members who all receive different individual loans. Mrs. NanghE. A. is the village-bank president. She lives in Daeum Pring village in the Kandal province. 

Mrs. NanghE. A. and her husband, Mr. Vean S., are farmers who own a plot of land on which to cultivate rice for their living. They have four children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory and two of whom are studying at a public school near their home. 

Although this couple tries to work hard in their field, they still do not have enough rice yield to support their family. Thus, Mrs. NanghE. A. decided to apply for a third loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Mr. Phan Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phan K., 46, is a village-bank president who lives in Krouch village in the Kandal province. This village bank consists of 10 members who receive different individual loans. 

Mr. Phan K. is a palm-juice collector who gathers juice to sell for an income. He now has a problem because he does not have enough money to buy bamboo to tie to the palm tree to climb. Mr. Phan K. decided to borrow a loan to buy bamboo for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. San Kang, is a farmer with four children: One is a laborer, two are studying at local public school and the other one is too young to go to school or study.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to tie to the palm tree to climb

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L., 36, is a hardworking mom and entrepreneur. She is married to Primo L., a vendor, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband in earning an income so that their family can have a better life. She has been repacking and selling  flavorings and spices for 15 years. She also direct sells ready-to-wear clothes and is into food processing.

Lina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT), a Kiva partner, for more than seven years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 20 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used all the money she borrowed as additional capital for all her businesses. Her three businesses let her earn a total net profit 16,500 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and she will buy assorted clothes for her ready-to-wear business.

She dreams that she can have her own property to establish her business and prays that all her children will finish their studies someday and have a better life. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Buying assorted clothes for her ready-to-wear business

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
Mrs. Nay S. is 42 years old. She has three children, two of whom are studying at the public local school while the other helps with housework. Her husband, Mr. Lort Bon, is a farmer. They all live in Pongro village in the Takeo province. 

Mrs. Nay S. is a duck breeder. In this career, she does not have any problems, but her field does not have enough water because it does not have an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Nay S. decided to apply for a loan to buy a pump, rice seeds and pesticides to increase her rice yield in this current year.

loans.use: To buy a pump, rice seeds and pesticides to increase her rice yield in this current year

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Pum Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. is 36 years old. She is a group leader. This group in Veal Prei village in the Takeo province consists of five members who receive different individual loans. 

Mrs. Sopheap P. is a silk weaver who owns a little supply of silk to weave. She wanted to expand her business, so Mrs. Sopheap P. decided to apply for a loan to buy more silk. 

Her husband, Mr. Samet Buot, is a farmer. Mrs. Sopheap P. is the mother of five children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Mrs. Phal Kung Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Doun Pheu village in the Takeo province. These members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phal K. is the group leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

Mrs. Phal K. and her husband, Mr. Sdeung Chhorm, are farmers who breed ducks. They can make a small income. Currently, Mrs. Phal K. needs some money buy fertilizers to support her farming crop and to buy ducklings and duck food for her second business. Thus, Mrs. Phal K. decided to ask for a loan to buy these items.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to support her farming crop and buy ducklings and duck food for her second business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. lives in the Fuzuli region. He was born in 1968. He is married and has three children. He has been in the general-store business for four years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Kun Ou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These are members of a group loan in Keo Chamroeun village in the Takeo province led by Mrs. Kun O.. This village bank consists of eight people and they will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Kun O. is a widow with four children who are all silk weavers. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Kun O. wants to expand, so she is requesting a loan to buy more silk to weave for her customers. She hopes to increase her income with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun Y. is group leader of a group with five members who are all in the village of Prey Chheu Teal in Takeo province. She is 50 years old, lives with her husband, Mr. Khoeun Phork, and they have one child who is attending a local school.

Mrs. Phoeun Y. is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand her business. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more silk: with the remainder of the loan she would like to buy seed rice and fertilizers to support a 0.6 hectare field.

loans.use: To buy more silk, and seed rice and fertilizers to support a 0.6 hectare field

loans.name: Mrs. Sovann Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
A village bank loan to a group led by Mrs. Sovann U. is located in Prey Theat village in TaK. province. This village bank loan is to a group consisting of nine people and they will each be using the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sovann U. is a livestock breeder who raises pigs and chickens. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sytha Sean, is a laborer in the local village and he earns a small income for supporting his family. Mrs. Sovann U. is the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while two children are too yoU. to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Torng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Torng D. is the group leader of four people in Kampao Village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who earns a small income from the 1-hectare field which she owns where she cultivates rice. She now has a problem in her farming because she does not have enough money to buy seed rice to cultivate rice.

She therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy seed rice, using the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Nil Khim, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Torng D. is the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another two are students in the local school and the other one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy seed rice to cultivate rice and to buy fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn T. is 56 years old. She is the group leader of five members who will use the loan for different purposes. They all live in Khnar Thum village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sorn T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land and she is also a silk weaver. Since her silk weaving business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sorn T. decided to request a second loan to buy silk to weave. She is a widow with three children. Two of her children are weavers and the other is studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy silk to weave.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon K. is 43 years of age and is currently a resident of Siem Reap province, located about over 300 kilometers from Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she and her husband always wake up in the late morning to go to the middle of the river by boat with some tools and they fish. They hurry up and bring their fish to sell at retail in the market when they finish fishing. This couple is able to earn $5 per day, which they use to cover their family’s daily living expenses. Recently a machine on their fishing boat broke down while they were catching fish. Suon K. is applying for a loan to replace the broken machine. Suon K. has given birth to four young children who are going to school or to work.

loans.use: To replace broken equipment

loans.name: Oduwa

texts.en: Cooking oil is one lucrative business for Oduwa. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Cooking oil is very essential in the preparation of foods in Nigeria and the demands for it are high. She is 42 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client.  LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Pheon Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pheon C. is 61 years old. She is the village bank president of 15 members who all live in Anlong Romiet Khang Tbou village in Kandal province. Mrs. Pheon C. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Orel Loem, is a farmer. They own two hectares of land for growing rice to support their family. This family now faces a big problem because their rice field has interfile soil. Thus, Mrs. Pheon C. decided to apply for a second loan to bU. fertilizer to increase their rice yield. This couple has three children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory; one helps selling groceries and the other is studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Chhay  Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Channy C. is 39 years old. She is a village bank president of thirteen members who will use the loan for different purpose. They live in Anlong Romiet Khang Tbou village in Kandal province. Mrs. Channy C. is a Khmer noodle seller who can earn a little income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sruoy Phon, is a construction laborer.  Since her Khmer noodle sales are going well, Mrs. Channy C. decided to request a second loan to spend on selling Khmer noodles. She is a mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory, one is studying at the local public school, and the youngest is too young to go school or work.

loans.use: To buy Khmer noodles to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace owns a restaurant where she cooks Nigerian foods and drinks. She loves cooking and that is why she commercialized her cooking skills. She is 46 years old and married to an automobile mechanic. They are blessed with three children. Her youngest child is 12 years old. Grace hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is married with three children and her youngest child is two years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports his home.

Felicia sells groceries and foodstuffs to make a living and has been in this business for a long time. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Felicia is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Ly Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao Ly T. is 28 years old and she is the village bank president. This village bank loan consists of fifteen members who will each use the loan for a different purpose. They all live in Snuol Khpos village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Sao Ly T. is a silk weaver and her husband, Mr. Pan Nea Buon, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. He is also a laborer who is able to make a small income to support the family living.

This family now faces a problem because Mrs. Sao Ly T. has insufficient money to buy silk. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy silk for weaving to increase her income. This couple has two children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Mrs. Saroem Long Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroem L. is 61 years old. She is the village bank president who leads nine members and they all live in Snuol Khpos village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Saroem L. is a silk weaver and her husband, Mr. Say Nget, is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to support their family living.

Mrs. Saroem L. now wants to expand her weaving business. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy more silk to support her business. This couple has two children and both are silk weavers too.

loans.use: To buy more silk to support her business

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say N. has been a business woman for a long time and lives in the province of Siem Reap. In the beginning of 2007 Say N. built a grocery shop in front of her home and sells various cooking item to her nearby neighbors. Also, she and her husband cultivate a rice crop during the farming season.  

Say N., 57, has given birth to eight children. Two of the children are married and the others are single. They are employed at a variety of jobs. Say N. has been increasing her clientele, but her inventory is not adequate to serve her customers. She would like to improve her enterprise through a loan from HKL to increase her grocery inventory and meet the needs of the customers.

loans.use: To increase her  grocery inventory.

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget T., 62 years old, is a group leader of four members who will each use the loan for different purposes. This group is located in Smau Khnhei village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Nget T. is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Men Mor is a farmer who owns 1.5-hetars. In her breeding business, Mrs. Nget T. has a problem as she does not have enough money to buy pig feed. She decided to request a loan to buy pig feed to support her business. This couple has a grandchild who lives with them.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Oghenekume

texts.en:
Oghenekume lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old and married to a commercial driver. She is LAPO client. The Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

She is a fashion designer and she makes lovely designs for her customers. She has been in this business for 7 years. She also sells sarongs. Oghenekume is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a sewing machine and also more supplies of sarongs. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and supplies of sarongs to sell

loans.name: Kimchheng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimchheng H. is 31 years old and she is the group leader of four members. They will each use the loan for a different purpose and they all live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Kimchheng H. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Sophiep Chuon, is a construction laborer. Mrs. Kimchheng H. now wants to expand her store so she decided to ask for a loan to buy groceries to support her business.

Mrs. Kimchheng H. is the mother of four children, three of whom are studying at a local public school and the other is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy groceries to support her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 44 years old and married to a civil servant. She is the mother of three children and her youngest child is 9 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school.

Alice sells groceries and foodstuffs and has been in this business for six years. During the holidays her children assist her with sales. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Alice hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Alice is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has been applied for by four low-income people. One of these people, Mrs. Lay S., has been promoted by the other members of the group to be the leader.

Lay S. was born in 1980 and has been married for many years to Mr. Siem Sok, age 30. This couple now has three young children who are studying.

Lay S. and her husband catch fish in the river to earn their living. Recently they can’t catch as many fish as before because some of their equipment is ruined and needs repair. Lay S. is therefore asking for a loan to repair their broken equipment as well as to buy new items for fishing.

The other borrowers are: V., a fisherman, who requests a loan to buy a fishing boat; S. who catches fish and needs a loan to redecorate her old house; and D. who requests a loan to buy a boat for fishing. D. was not available for the photo so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To repair broken fishing equipment and to buy new items

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a LAPO client. The Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is 52 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband moulds construction blocks to support the family. She sells cooked foods and drinks by hawking her cooked foods within her community in Benin City, Edo state. 

Victoria loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to receive a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Danor

texts.en:
Mrs. Danor Y., 24 and her husband, Mr. Sovanara Young, 28, live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are still young.   

Danor has been selling grocery for five years. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. Mr. Sovanara has been a security guard for a month. 

Danor hopes to expand her business to become bigger and bigger, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her stock.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Ven Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members who are located in Liek village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Touch V. is the village bank president. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a policeman and the other two are studying at the local school.

Mrs. Touch V. and her husband, Mr. Phan Sam, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because it is the harvesting season and she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest her rice. Thus, Mrs. Touch V. decided to ask for a second loan to hire laborers for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin sells pastries like meat pies and egg rolls to make a living. He is a hardworking man and he sells for long hours to support his home.

Edwin is 32 years old and married with two children, his youngest child being two years old. His children are still dependent on him and they go to school.

Edwin hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more baking materials like bags of flour to bake more pastries to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Mrs. Khen C., 44, and her husband, Mr. Prach Prak, 50, live on an island on the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of their children is a garment factory worker, one attends school, and another stays at home.
Khen and her husband are farmers. They grow cucumbers, tomatoes and corn on their farmland in the village. In addition, Khen wants to create a new business raising cows, and hopes to earn extra income from selling the cows when they have grown big enough. She is therefore requesting a loan of $800 USD to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Pring Din Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen members who are located in Liek village in Kandal province. Each of the members will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Pring D. is the village bank president. She is 48 years old and the mother of three children who are studying at the local public school.

Mrs. Pring D. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice, and her husband, Mr. Saorum K., is a construction laborer.

Mrs. Pring D. now has an obstacle because this is the harvesting season but she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest her rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a second loan to hire laborers to harvest her rice.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth is 28 years old and married with a child. Her husband molds blocks to support the home. Loveth makes a living by selling used clothes. The demand for these is high in her community because there are many people who cannot afford new clothes. She has been involved  in this business for two years and enjoys it. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Loveth is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more used clothes to sell. She sends her thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sothim Poa Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twenty members who are located in Liek village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sothim P. is the village bank president. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are working in a garment factory and the other is studying at the local public school. Mrs. Sothim P. is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Vean Gneab, is a construction worker.

Although her husband tries to work hard, he still earn less income than needed to support the family so Mrs. Sothim P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a thousand kilograms of rice for eating.

loans.use: To buy a thousand kilograms of rice for consumption

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and married with four children. His wife is a petty trader and she also supports the home. His children are excelling well in school and Joseph hopes to give them a good quality education.
Joseph is a farmer who grows cassava and yams on his farm. He has been in the farming business for five years. He loves farming because he is happy whenever he harvests his crops. Joseph is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization, and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to clear his farmland and purchase more cassava seedlings to plant during the next planting season. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To clear his farmland and purchase cassava seedlings

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Mr. Chheoun C. is 39 years old and lives with his wife, Mrs. Tha Sieb, in Knong Preaek village in Kandal Province. They have two children, one of whom attends the local public school and the other of whom is too young to go to school or work.
Mr. Chheoun C. is a construction worker and his wife is a vegetable seller. Since her vegetable-selling business is going well, Mrs. Tha Sieb wants to expand it. Therefore, Mr. Chheoun C. decided to apply for a fourth loan to buy more vegetables for the business. His wife is shown with him in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa M. is 42 years old and lives in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal Province. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are studying at the local public school.
Mrs. Channa M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing crops and rice, while her husband, Mr. Chhoeur Cham (shown on the right of the picture), is a chef. On her plantation, Mrs. Channa M. has a problem because her soil is infertile. Therefore, she decided to ask for a third loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of her loan, she will buy rice seeds and dig a well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and dig a well

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a farmer and she plants cassava and plantain on her farm. She has been in this farming business of five years. She loves farming because she is happy whenever she harvests her crops.

Blessing is 27 years old and married with a child. Her child is excelling in school and she hopes to provide a quality education. Her husband is a farmer and he also supports the home.

Blessing is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to clear her farmland and to purchase more plantain suckers and cassava seedlings to plant for the next planting season. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Blessing is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To clear her farmland and to purchase cassava seedlings and plantain suckers

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun K. is 45 years old and lives in Preaek Thum village in Kandal Province. He is the father of five children, all of whom are studying at the local public school. His wife, Mrs. Koem Oraun, is a Khmer cake maker, and is shown on the left of the photo.
Mr. Bunthoeun K. is a rice middleman and also a motorbike taxi driver. Since his rice-selling business is going well, he wants to expand it and is therefore requesting a second loan to buy more rice to resell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with four children, the eldest of whom is 12 years old. Grace's husband sells planks to support his family. Grace is a friendly and hardworking woman who sells foodstuffs to make a living. She works for long hours to enable her to meet the demands of her customers and also her family members. With her children still growing up, she hopes to give them a good quality education. Grace also loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.
Grace is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization(LAPO)
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mr. Seak H. is 57 years old and lives in Khsom village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Kong Peagn (shown on the right), is a housewife. The couple has five children, two of whom work at gasoline stations, one of whom helps work in the field, and the others of whom are studying at the local public school.
Mr. Seak H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables and rice. He is also a Khmer teacher. Although he works hard on his land, he still does not earn enough income to support his family. In order to improve his family's living conditions, Mr. Seak H. has decided to ask for a third loan to buy a water machine to support his rice field in order to increase his yield.

loans.use: To buy a water machine for his rice field

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 27 years old and married with a child. Her husband sells planks to support the home. For the last four years, Rosemary has been selling drinks and rechargeable phone cards at retail prices. She is a friendly woman who uses her skills to attract more customers to her stall.
Rosemary is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

About Lift Above Poverty Organization
Lift above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Sruy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sruy S. is 61 years old and lives in Kor village in Takeo Province. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a silk weaver, one of whom works for a microfinance institution, and the others of whom are studying at the local public school.
Mrs. Sruy S. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Srieng Orom (shown on the left of the picture), is a famer who owns a 1.5-hectare field for cultivating rice. With this rice-growing business, they face a problem because their field is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Sruy S. has decided to request a second loan to buy fertilizer. The rest of the loan will be used to buy pesticide, rice seeds, and fuel.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seeds and fuel

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy O. is 41 years old and lives in Dak Por village in Takeo Province. She is a vegetable and fruit seller, and her husband, Mr. Chor Nou (shown on the left of the picture), is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables and rice. The couple has three children, one of whom is a coconut seller while the others attend the local public school.
In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sophy O. has decided to ask for a third loan to buy a cart to transport her vegetables to market. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy potatoes and watermelons to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to transport her vegetables, and potatoes and watermelons to sell

loans.name: Shabana Group

texts.en:
This is Shabana group. It is made up of three members, and Gul Aziz is the group leader.
Gul Aziz would like to take a loan for his shop so that he can expand his business. He has four children who are in school. Nafesa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy some necessary materials for her business. Najeba wants to take a loan for her husband’s dish-selling shop. He wants to purchase more glasses, plates and so on for his business.
The group has requested a group loan of 42,000 AFN. With this loan they can expand their businesses, support their families, and make a better future for themselves.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Saphorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saphorn L., who lives in Damnak village in Takeo province, is 46 years old. She is the mother of three children who are laborers in a garment factory.

Mrs. Saphorn L. is a Khmer cake maker and her husband, Mr. Chakreyor Tet, is a farmer who own two hectares (five acres) of land that he uses to grow rice for a living.

Mrs. Saphorn L. faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy a motorbike for her personal use. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her personal use

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 33 years old and married with two children, both in primary school. Her husband works with an electricity company in Benin City, Edo State.

Kate sells colorful sarongs and she also makes lovely designs for her customers. She has been in this business for seven years. She loves her tailoring skills because it enables her make more profits to support her home.

Kate is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to own a fashion shop in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Alero

texts.en:
Alero A. is a newly-wedded young lady who is expecting her first child. She is 29 years old and her husband is a businessman.

Alero owns a beauty accessories shop where she sells hair extensions, beauty cream, hair cream and cosmetics. Her expectation is to see her business progress and attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more beauty accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Alero is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty accessories to sell

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Назарова Ситора проживает в городе Душанбе. Не замужем. Возраст 27 лет, имеет среднее образование. Ситора более 2 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где в основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sitora N. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She's 27 and unmarried with a middle school eduation. Sitora has been a vendor for more than two years. She has a shop at the market where she sells mainly clothing. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 33 years old and her husband is an engineer. They are blessed with four children.

Joy owns a beauty accessories shop where she sells hair extensions, beauty cream, hair cream and cosmetics. Her expectation is to see her business progress and attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more beauty accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Joy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty accessories to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50-year-old married man with four children. He works as a farmer and has been involved in this ocupatiion since 1980. He is the one supporting his family with his business.

Today, Ali is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a special agriculture machine made to cultivate his ground and to be able to augment his productivity.

loans.use: buy a special agriculture machine

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is married with five children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a carpenter. She is 40 years old. She sells drinks and groceries such as milk, noodles, bread, biscuits, and toothbrushes. Blessing says her business is not moving as expected due to a financial setback that affected her family recently. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.)  Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel sells sarongs and laces to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is 50 years old, and married with six children. Three of her children are in post-secondary institutions and two are in secondary school. The eldest child is married. Mabel's husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. Mabel is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Mabel is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel E., popularly known as Emma, is a hard working businessman. He is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Emmanuel is determined to excel in his business. He is 35 years old and married with two children. He sells groceries such as milk, soaps, biscuits, juice, wine and table water. He has been in this business for a long time and he hopes to expand it. He needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and juice to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace O. is a well known beef seller at the market in Benin City. She has been in this business since 2006. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Peace is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more beef to sell.

Peace is 32 years old and married with three children. Her children are in school and she hopes to give them quality education. Her husband is an athlete and he also supports the family. Peace hopes to see her business grow and expand in the future. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith sells sarongs and laces to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Judith is 45 years old, and married with six children. Her youngest child is 7 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the family. Judith is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Judith is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo N. is 32 years old and married with three children; all her children are in primary school. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is a Yoruba by tribe but she lives in Benin City, Edo state. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Titilayo sells cosmetics to make a living. She does not have a stall; she sells her cosmetics door-to-door within and outside her community. Titilayo says her major challenge is getting a store in a strategic location for her business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen O. is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) She is 41 years old and the mother of five children. She owns a beer parlor where she sells various kinds of drinks. She also sells groceries. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase drinks to attract more customers. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose P. sells local gin at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years. She is 32 years old and married, with two children who are excelling in school. Her husband is a driver in a private company. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.)  Bose needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Cape Coast. Evelyn has received junior high education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Evelyn has been selling fresh fish since 2002, supporting her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and to reinvest in her business to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Simar

texts.en:
Simar is a 29-year-old married woman with one child. She has been working as a farmer since 2006 with eight years of experience in the agricultural sector. She works hard to support her husband with the family income.

Today, Simar is requesting $1,200 to buy merchandise such as fertilizers and agricultural supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as fertilizers and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is a widow and has two children. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish since 2002. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Martin Mutiria

texts.en:
Martin K. is married to Agnes and they have two children: Joan and Martha. He is in the business of distributing cakes and also owns a retail shop. He has been operating these businesses for six years. His business is located in a highly competitive area and he relies on the retailers who are near to his shop to supply the cakes in large quantities.

Martin was introduced to KADET by other existing clients and has no previous loan from another micro-finance institution. With the loan he has applied for, Martin intends to increase his stock of cakes to supply to newly identified markets. He anticipates that he will make a profit which he will use to pay for his children’s education and to improve the living standard of his family.

Martin hopes to have a wholesale distribution business as he believes he is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To increase his stock of cakes for redistribution

loans.name: Abdel Razak

texts.en:
Abdel Razak has owned a car repair shop since 1980 and he has been involved in this business for more than thirty-seven years. He's 50 years old and is married with four children.

Abdel Razak is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a used car which he will perform maintenance on in order to resell it and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy a used car to repair and sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a LAPO client. "Lift Above poverty organization" (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Doris is 35 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is 12 years old. Doris is a Bini by tribe. Her husband sells planks to support the home.

Doris owns a stall where she sells groceries like cornflakes, noodles, soap, milk, biscuits, and drinks. She hopes to own a classic supermarket in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Judith Adhiambo

texts.en:
Judith is married to Stephen and they have one child: Sandra. Judith makes dresses for a living and she has done this service for five years. Though she also serves clients who are from within the area where her business is located, she largely relies on orders from other rural areas.

Judith was introduced to KADET by other existing clients and she is going to be servicing her second loan. She has no previous credit history. She intends to use the loan to expand the business by purchasing a sewing machine and increasing her dress-making materials stock. With the extra profits, Judith hopes to expand the business to become a company.

Judith aspires to own a boutique as she believes she is hard-working and focused.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand the business.

loans.name: Debora Aluoch

texts.en:
Deborah Aluoch O. owns a retail shop in Rongo District, Kenya. She has been in this business since 1985. Before that, she was a farmer. Debora buys her inventory once each month. When she gets this loan, she plans to increase her inventory because she is interested in wholesaling and expanding her business into the clothing industry. 

Debora is a widow and the mother and guardian of 5 children. She would like a loan of KShs.90,000 (Kenyan shillings).

loans.use: Increase her business inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose Akeyo

texts.en: Rose Akeyo Nyang’ong’a  is the proud owner of a clinic. She started with a pharmacy and then expanded her business into a clinic in 1994. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She says her clinic has a many clients, mainly common villagers from Rongo District, Kenya. Occasionally, they run out of drugs, so she would like a loan of Kshs.90000 to increase her drug inventory at the clinic.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of drugs for her clinic

loans.name: Julius Kariuki

texts.en:
Julius is married to Faith, and they have two children, Alex and Victor. He sells second-hand clothes to residents within his business locality and also to rural areas where he gets more orders. He has been in this business for six years now.

Julius was introduced to KADET by existing clients and he is servicing his second loan, with no previous credit history. He intends to use the loan he has applied for to increase his stock of second-hand clothes. With the extra profits, Julius will purchase a piece of land.

He hopes to construct his own residence and other rental houses as he believes he is focused and determined.

loans.use: to increase his stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan O. is 29 years old. She is married with a child of 3 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.  She owns a beer parlor and she sells foodstuffs. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family. She says her expectation is to see her business grow and attract more customers in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en: Mouna is a 22-year-old single woman. She works as a home-based clothing sales person in her town. She started her small business in 2005. Today, Mouna is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to expand her inventory for the winter and propose a bigger choice of clothes to her customers.

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received junior high education.  She is divorced and has three children. Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish since 2001. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest and also complete her building.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for sale

loans.name: Emma Achieng

texts.en: Emma Achieng O. is married and blessed with 3 children. She lives in Kajulu, Kisumu, Kenya. She is the proud owner of a clothing business, importing from Uganda (Kampala). Before she started this business, she was employed at an agricultural institute. Her main dream is to build a commercial building in Kisumu city in the future. She would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which will go toward increasing her clothing stock.

loans.use: more clothing inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 41 years old and married with four children. His wife is a petty trader. His children are still dependent on him and they go to school. He is a commercial motorcyclist. He has two motorcycles. He rides one of the motorcycles and he hires another person to ride the other motorcycle.

James hopes to own a big transport company in the future. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase a motorcycle to enable him to hire another person to convey more passengers to their location. He says that this will help increase his profits. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Mary Akinyi

texts.en: Mary Akinyi M. is 38 years old; she is the mother of 3 children whom she stays with, and she is separated from her husband. She  runs a used clothing business at Kibuye market, Kisumu, Kenya. She started her business in order to sustain her family after separation from her husband back in 2008. She would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to spearhead her expansion plan.

loans.use: purchase more used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. owns a grocery stall where she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract her customers to her stall. She is always happy when her customers come to patronize her business. Her customers are mostly residents, friends and neighbours.

Rose is married and has a child. She is 30 years old and her husband is an engineer. She uses her profit from her business to support her home. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn O. owns a grocery stall where she sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendly skills to attract her customers to her stall. She is always happy when her customers come to patronize her business. Her customers are mostly residents, friends and neighbours.

Evelyn is married and has four children. She is 34 years old and her husband is a commercial driver. She uses her profit from her business to support her home. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Judith Atieno

texts.en:
Judith Atieno O. runs two kinds of businesses: a salon and a clothing business, both in Kisumu, Kenya.

Judith is separated from her husband and is the mother of two children, besides being a guardian to two orphans. Before she ventured into business, she was a housewife and solely depended on her husband.

Judith’s future plan is to buy a parcel of land and build a home for herself and her children. She would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 to initiate the expansion of her businesses.

loans.use: To expand her salon and clothing businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam I. makes local drinks called kunu (a popular drink usually made from a grain such as millet or sorghum, although it can be made from maize) and zobo (a local Nigerian drink made from dry leaves called zobo leaves). These drinks are highly medicinal and also have a pleasant taste.

Mariam sells her drinks in a market in Benin City. She needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more materials to produce more local drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Mariam is 38 years old and married with five children. She is an Etsako by tribe but she lives in Benin City. Her husband is a fashion designer and he also supports the home.

Mariam is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce more local drinks to sell

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara B. is 40 years old and married with five children. She is a Yoruba by tribe but she lives in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is a contractor and he also supports the home

Omolara sells children’s clothes and shoes at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She has a wheelbarrow that she uses to hawk her goods (sell door-to-door) within her community. She says that hawking her goods saps her energy and she hopes to rent a store.

Omolara says her major challenge is acquiring a store as it has not been easy moving from place to place to sell her goods. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more children’s wear and shoes, and to rent a stall for her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent a store and to purchase more children's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Sabrine

texts.en:
Sabrine has worked as a hairdresser since 2004. She’s 33 years old and is married with two young children. She helps her husband in the household.

Today, Sabrine is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a special hair machine and beauty products to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a special hair machine and beauty products

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, trabaja de día como chofer asalariado y de noche trabaja como chofer de bus en su movilidad propia.
.
Vive en la zona de Llojeta  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en anticrético.

El crédito que solicita será destinado para arreglo de su movilizad (compra de motor y costo de mano de obra del mecánico). 

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelino works as a salaried driver during the day. At night he works as a bus driver in his own vehicle. He lives in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. He lives in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). The loan he is asking for is to fix his vehicle (buy a motor and pay for mechanic’s labor). It is the second time that he has asked Impro for a loan. His history qualifies him for this loan. In other words, he has had a good payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor for his bus and pay for mechanic’s labor

loans.name: Buba

texts.en: Buba A. is a Lift Above Poverty Organisation (LAPO) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria. She makes local drinks called kunu and zobo. These drinks are highly medicinal and have a pleasant taste. She sells her drinks in a market in Benin City. She is 45 years-old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City. Her husband is a trader and he also supports the home. She needs a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more materials to produce more local drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drink making materials.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos. 
El señor Juan Carlos trabaja como empleado de la administración publica, en el puesto de empleado de mensajería, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los pisos de su vivienda que en la actualidad son de tierra.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos C. lives with his two children in his own house. They live in the Pasankeri area on the west side of the city of La Paz. Juan Carlos is employed by the public administration as a messenger. This income supports his family. The loan he is requesting is to fix the dirt floors in his house. This is the third time that he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the floors in his house

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 38-year-old unmarried man. Since 2000, he has been working in the flooring sector.  Working on a freelance basis, he manages some house projects in his town and its surroundings. Today, Haytham is asking for a loan of $1,200 to replace his tools.

loans.use: To replace tools.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. has a restaurant where she sells mouth watering Nigerian cooked foods and drinks. She is happy because she has a new recipe that her customers love and this has helped retain her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 52 years-old and widowed with six children. Some of her children are already in university. Her husband died some years back and since then she has been taking care of her children all by herself. She hopes to see her business expand and attract more customers. She is seeking a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more ingredients to cook and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis T. sells cooked rice with tomato sauce at Bantuma near Elmina.  Mavis has received a junior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a banker. Mavis has been selling cooked rice with tomato sauce since 2003. She supports her husband in the payment of utility bills, school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business to enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and other ingredients.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el sector Valle Nuevo del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de animales desde hace 20 años, durante estos años ha mantenido a su familia con las ganancias producto de estas actividades. Siembra diversos cereales en un pequeño terreno de cultivo y cría animales para comercializarlos con los negociantes que eventualmente visitan la zona donde vive.

José necesita percibir más ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida así como para seguir educando a sus hijos, siguiendo este objetivo se ha propuesto convertir una motocicleta que posee en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), para ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de un chasís y algunos otros accesorios necesarios para lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales de éxito. El es un padre responsable y muy entregado a su familia.
texts.en:
José, 46, is married and lives with his wife and three children. He lives in the Valle Nuevo sector in the Mochumí district, which is one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture and sold animals for 20 years. During those years he has supported his family with the income from these activities. He plants diverse grains on a small field. He also raises animals to sell to the businessmen who occasionally visit the area where he lives. José needs more income to give his family a better quality of life and to keep educating his children. Pursuing this objective, he plans to convert his motorcycle into a “mototaxi” (a motorized vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). In order to do this he is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 PEN. He plans to buy a chassis and other necessary accessories to achieve his objective. His biggest desire is to see his children become successful professionals. He is a very responsible father, and he is very devoted to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a chassis to convert his motorcycle into a mototaxi

loans.name: Thank You Jesus Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Thank You Jesus' Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Samuel M. in the middle of the photo is the leader of this group. Samuel is 24 years of age. He was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. Still a bachelor, Samuel has earned 3 years of experience in business. He sells vegetables, rice, and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With his share of this loan, he will buy about 100 gallons of palm oil and bags of vegetables to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy about 100 gallons of palm oil and bags of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna I. is married with three children. She is 40 years-old. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She is a fashion designer and she makes lovely designs for her customers. She also sells colorful sarongs and kerosene in gallons.  She has been in this business for a long time. Anna says she hopes to transform her fashion business into a high class fashion house in order to get more customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase more kerosene and tailoring materials. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and kerosene

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 50 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client. The "Lift above poverty organization" (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Patience has a grocery stall where she sells groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She also fries bean cakes to sell. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sorbeh Traders Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Sorbeh Traders' group from the northern City of Makeni. They are petty traders who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, these petty traders will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that sales and profit-to-sales-margin will increase. In this way, they can easily repay the loan and better look after themselves and their children. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu M. on the left in the photo. The 32-year-old sells market food – margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, rice, groundnuts/peanuts, onions, etc.  She has been in this business for 9 years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above items wholesale and selling retail.

loans.use: Buy margi, pepper, rice, groundnuts/peanuts, onions, etc.

loans.name: Albaida

texts.es:
La Señora Albaida Vive en casa prestada, cuida de la propiedad ya que la dueña de la casa vive fuera del País, la Sra. Albaida con el dinero que pudo ahorrar se compro un lote de terreno donde pronto comenzara a construir dos cuartos y que pronto se trasladara ahi que será su domicilio.

Su negocio es la de cerrajería (copias de llaves de puertas), el destino del crédito es para comprar  una maquina  para sacar copia de llaves.

La Sra. Albaida esta agradecida con Emprender y con Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Albaida lives in a loaned house. She takes care of the property since the owner lives abroad. With the money she was able to save she bought a lot of land where she will soon begin to build two rooms and make it her home.

She is a locksmith and the loan destination is to buy a key machine.

Albaida is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown her with granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of locksmith's key machine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. sells the hide of a cow locally called “wele” by Ghanaians. It is normally used in the preparation of soups and sauces; she also sells dried salted fish also called “koobi" or "kaco” that is also used for preparing sauces and soups. She sells at Elmina market near Cape Coast. Rose has received junior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Rose has been in this business since 1999. She helps her husband in the payment of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh cow hide and dried fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business for additional capital.

loans.use: to buy more fresh cow hide and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel I. is a LAPO client. "Lift above poverty organization" (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks at retail prices to sustain herself and her immediate family. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell. Mabel is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Her eldest child is 16 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Paquita Pastora

texts.es:
Paquita L. de 48 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo trabaja como taxista en su carro con el tiene 4 hijos de 22, 23 trabajan y los de 18, 12 estudian en escuela y colegio fiscal.

Paquita comenzó hace 15 años cuando una amiga le presto uno cilindros de gas para que los utilizara y los vendiera poco a poco Paquita comenzó a vender y comprar mas cilindros. Ahora Paquita trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos, vende cada cilindro de gas a $ 2.25. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más cilindros de gas y adecuar mejor el local para el negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de gas y poder sacar sucursales de su negocio.
texts.en:
Paquita L., 48, lives in the peri urban area of Guayaquil, which has all of the basic services. Her husband works as a taxi driver in his car. They have four children. The 22 and 23 year old children work. The 18 and 12 year olds go to public school. Paquita started 15 years ago when a friend lent her some gas cylinders to use and sell. Little by little she started to buy and sell more cylinders. Now Paquita works from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. everyday. Her children help her. She sells each cylinder for $2.25. One of the problems she has is the delinquency in her area. With this loan she wants to buy more gas cylinders and improve her business location. In the future she wants to have a gas distributorship and be able to build branch businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tanks of gas

loans.name: Edgar Rosendo

texts.es:
El señor Edgar es un cliente antiguo y puntual, y responsable es de buena actitud, tambien se vio que es una persona emprendedora al ser muy joven, el señor edgar se dedica al servicio de juegos en red e internet que esta ubicado en la calle imperial donde tambien es su domicilio.
