Su negocio es mediano tiene aproximadamente 10 computadoras en los que da los servicios de internet y juegos en red,  El Sr. Edgar atiende su negocio todos los dias desde muy temprano hasta muy altas horas de la noche, el señor edgar tambien conoce mucho de electronica por lo tanto la reparacion de sus computadoras lo realiza el mismo, el actualmente es soltero, pero todo lo que gana lo invierte en su negocio de internet, su madre es cliente de la institucion varios años y demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad, la inversion que realizara con el prestamo es poner azulejos en su otra tienda para alquilarla.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Edgar is an old client of Emprender. He is punctual, responsible, and has a good attitude. He is also very enterprising for his young age. Edgar has a business of Internet service and web games, located on Imperial Street, which is also where he lives. It is a medium-sized business with about ten computers, which provide Internet service and web games. Edgar is at the business everyday from very early to the late hours of the night. He also knows electronics and is able to do repairs on the computers himself. Edgar is single, and all his earnings are reinvested in his business. His mother has also been an Emprender client for years and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality. This loan will be used to install tiles in his other store to rent it. Edgar is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown by the approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New tiles for his store

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is married and has one child. She has received junior high education. Theresa sells raw rice, gari (manioc grits), maize, onions and other food items at Elmina, which she has been doing for the past fifteen years. Her husband is a teacher. Theresa uses her income to help her husband in the payment of utility bills, school fees, and other family expenses.

Theresa will use the loan to purchase more cereals for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest in her business to boost her profit so that she can have enough savings to help build the house she has planned to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 50 years old and she is married with one child. She sells cooking oil at wholesale prices to her customers. She has been in this business for three years. She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She is a LAPO client. "Lift above poverty organization"(LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.  Grace says thanks to LAPO and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Angelana

texts.en: Angelana A. is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland and sells them at wholesale and retail prices to farmers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Angelana is 45 years old, married and has five children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Angelana says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Anye Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married to Hancuter Nche, and they are blessed with five children, two of them younger than 15. They live in a three room house in Alabukam, a district in the Bamenda-NW region of Cameroon. Anna has decided to work extra hard to assist her husband in providing for such a large family. She has faced many challenges in life such as inadequate funds to sustain her business project and ill health. These challenges made life uncomfortable for her, until September 18th, 2008, when she discovered GHAPE and became a member. In that same year, Anna received her first loan of 40,000 XAF and her repayment was successful. The profit she made was reinvested in her business capital for buying and selling.

With this loan of 150,000 XAF, Anna plans to buy firewood, dry corn and groundnuts, corn, koki beans, salt and magi and pay some transportation costs. Anna will start repayment from the third month after disbursement. She is quite convinced the business will succeed because of her approach to her customers, the way she displays her goods and the experience she already has in the business. Her business will help her locality in that the taxes she will be paying will help to foster its economic growth. With the profit from the business, Anna plans to pay her children's school fees and expand her business. She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because of the social education GHAPE offers and its convenient method of repayment.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, groundnuts and other items

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El banco de Emprendimiento "SAN SEBASTIAN  " es uno del los grupos  màs antiguos de la agencia , se encuentra en su octavo ciclo., el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

La Sr. Carol es la lider del grupo tiene 2 hijas pero que ya son independientes, como negocio tiene la venta de carne en la Av. Siles. 

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Primitiva quien es casada y tiene su negocio de venta de velas en la Esteban Arce es una de las socias mas antiguas y que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos y la Secretaria es la Sra. Casilda Maria  quie es soltera y vende carne en la Av. siles junto a la presidenta, es una persona responsable  y activa.						
						
Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "San Sebastian" Entrepreneur bank is one of the oldest in the agency. It is in its eighth cycle. The bank is formed by responsible and hardworking people. The bank is represented by the following partners:

Carol is the Leader of the group. She has two daughters who are already independent. She sells meat in the Siles Ave.

Primitiva is the Treasurer. She is married and sells candles in the Esteban Arce. She is one of the oldest members and has shown responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Casilda Maria is the Secretary. She is single and sells meat in Siles Ave. along with the Leader of the group. She is a responsible and active person.

They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland and sells them at wholesale and retail prices to farmers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Blessing is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.)  Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland. She sells her vegetables to farmers at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Regina is 42 years old and married, and has 4 children. She is a LAPO client. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.  

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Trifon Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Trifon, tiene un tranporte que lo trabaja en el sindicato de trufis ATL, que hacen la ruta del centro de la ciudad a los diversos lugares de la zona sur, su esposa la Sra. Simona, trabaja de empleada del Hogar en la zona Los Pinos, tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales los dos mayores ya trabajan independientemente y los otros tres en edad escolar.

El trabajo con Emprender desde el año 2003 en el grupo solidario Aguilas, a la fecha tambien trabaja cuando le requieren en el manejo de volqueta para la construcción de los puentes trillizos, él con su familia viven en la casa de un pariente a manera de cuidadores, donde se encuentran ya más de seis años.						
						
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Trifon works in public transportation; he owns a trufi (minibus) and he is a member of the ATL organization (in Bolivia, public transport vehicles are privately-owned and organized into routes by various union organizations.) He drives a route from the center of the city to diverse locations in the southern part of the city. His wife, Simona, is a housekeeper in the Los Pinos neighborhood. They have 5 children; 2 of them are adults and work independently and the others are school-aged. He began working with Emprender in the year 2003 in the Aguilas group. Since that date he has also worked as needed as a dump truck driver for the construction of the "Bridge of Triplets" (a major public construction project in La Paz.) He has lived with his family in a house owned by a relative for 6 years, where they serve as caretakers. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting him this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tires and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad owns a farm tractor. He works on a freelance basis at the request of his customers. He's 45 years old, married, and has three children. Mohamad wants to perform maintenance on his tractor, so he is requesting a loan of $1000 to cover the maintenance costs.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his tractor

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland and sells them to farmers at wholesale and retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time. 

Felicia is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Felicia is 55 years old and married and has nine children. She is a LAPO client. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.  

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Nixon Jacinto

texts.es:
Nixon Y. de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, solo tiene agua y luz como servicio básico, no tiene esposa pero tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad, el  vive solo en su casa. 

Nixon trabajaba como albañil poco a poco pudo reunir dinero para comprarse una camioneta así  pudo cambiar de trabajo a servicio de fletes con su propia camioneta. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 14h00 y desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días, el promedio de fletes que hace son de 8 a12 al día. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es cuando se le daña el vehiculo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para el mantenimiento del vehiculo y así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere abril un negocio de venta y reparación de vehículos.
texts.en:
Nixon Y. is 57 years old and lives in the greater urban area of Guayaquil. He has only basic services of water and electricity. He does not have a wife, but has 4 children who are already adults. He lives alone in his house. Nixon was working as a mason so that little by little he could raise money to buy a truck so that he could have his own freight service. He is now working from 7am until 2pm and from 3pm to 7pm, every day, or 8 to 12 hours per day, on average. One problem that arises is when the vehicle is damaged. He is asking for a loan to maintain the vehicle so that he can provide better service to his customers. In the future he would like to open a business for selling and repairing vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle repair

loans.name: Lola Veatris

texts.es: La Señora Lola ya trabajo tres secuencias con la institucion, en estas secuencias demostro que es una persona responsable y puntual, la señora se dedica a la confeccion de ropa y reposteria de masas que las reparte en las escuelas, la elaboracion de ropa lo realiza con contratos con diferentes instituciones, y la reposteria lo realiza en su mismo domicilio, sus masas lo reparte en los diferentes colegios, escuelas de la ciudad de el alto, el esposo de la señora se llama Carlos  que se dedica la costura en la empresa  "josdo ltda" el señor carlos trabajo varios años como costurero y en la actualidad asendio como jefe de corte, el trabajo de la señora es sacrificado porque ella elabora las masas en la mañana y en las tardes y noches confecciona su prendas, ella tiene un ayudante en la confeccion de prendas, el destino del credito es la compra de rollos de tela por mayor para la confeccion de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Lola Veatris has already completed three cycles with the institution. In those cycles she has proven to be a responsible and punctual person.

She sews clothing and makes pastries. She sews clothing under contracts with different companies. She makes pastries from home and distributes them in schools in the city.

Her husband, Carlos, is a tailor at "Josdo Ltda". He has worked for many year as a tailor and has been promoted to pattern manager.

She has to sacrifice her work because the she makes the pastries in the mornings, sewing afternoons and evenings. She has an assistant who helps her with sewing.

The loan destination is purchasing rolls of fabric wholesale to make the clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rolls of fabric

loans.name: Wilton Francisco

texts.es:
Wilton A. de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, tiene solo agua como servicio básico, su esposa trabaja como costurera con ella tiene dos hijos uno de 14 años y otro de 15 años los dos estudiando en una escuela particular. 

Wilton comenzó su negocio hace 12 años atrás vendiendo solo pescados. Poco a poco comenzó a implementar en su negocio mariscos como camarones, conchas. Ahora Wilton trabaja en un triciclo todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo pescados, camarones, conchas etc. Una de las mayores dificultades son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mariscos como pescados, camarones, conchas para tener más variedad. En el futuro quiere poner ya un puesto fijo de mariscos y tener una distribuidora de mariscos.
texts.en:
Wilton Francisco is 46 years old and lives in the edge of the city of Guayaquil. He has only running water as a basic utility in his home. His wife is a seamstress. He has two children with her, a 14-year old and a 15-year old. Both children go to a private school.

Wilton Francisco started his fish selling business 12 years ago. Little by little, he started to also sell shrimp and shellfish. Wilton Franciso now works in a tricycle selling fish, shrimp and shellfish from dusk until dawn. One of the biggest hardships is the rain.

He wants to buy seafood such as fish, shrimp and shellfish with the loan, so that he will have more variety. In the future he wants to establish a storefront to sell seafood and a seafood distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish, seafood

loans.name: Renan

texts.es:
El Sr. Renan Nació el 14 de septiembre de 1974 en Santa Cruz es casado con al señora Mirtha  tienen dos hijos y el mantiene solo el hogar.
Aproximadamente 2 años que tienen sus propias parcela mediante sindicatos.
Su actividad principal es la agricultura ellos siembran tomate, arroz y maíz, sacan a vender sus productos al mercado central de El Torno. 

El señor esta agradecido por el financiamiento y confianza depositada.
texts.en:
Mr. Renan was born on September 14th, 1974 in Santa Cruz and is married to Mrs. Mirtha. They have two children and only he provides for the family financially. For approximately two years, they have owned their own parcel of communal land. Mr. Renan's main economic activity is agriculture. They grow tomatoes, rice, and corn, which they sell in the central market called El Torno. He is grateful for this loan and and the confidence invested in him.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased working capital

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra de 52 años de edad,  casada, y con dos hijos, vive en el barrio la Esperanza, su esposo de profesión músico, durante muchos años ella ha trabajado en servicio domésticos, para apoyar a sus hijos y a su esposo, el cual  gana por las piezas que toca en una rotonda Bello Horizonte en la Capital, pero no le ha ido muy bien las personas ya no quieren pagar dicha cantidad de dinero, los tiempos han cambiado es por eso ella también  se dedica a la venta de cosmético para obtener mejores ingresos, ya que el salario es bajo, con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su casa, y con este préstamo lo que desea hacer es un cuarto para mejorar las condiciones de privacidad para su familia. Daña Sandra desde joven ha trabajado ya que sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos ha llevado una vida difícil, desde horas temprana sale de su casa para poder ir al trabajo, y llega noche a su casa, ya que sale tarde es por eso a futuro desea dedicarse solo a las ventas de cosmético y ropa para poder gozar mas de su familia como su casa. Para comenzar la obra comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, entre otros. Gracias a estos financiamientos ha mejorado su pequeña vivienda el cual esta sastifecha por que ha logrado sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 52, is married with two children and lives in the La Esperanza neighborhood of Managua. She has worked for many years in domestic services. Her earnings have helped support her children and husband, who works a professional musician. Her husband plays music at the Rotunda Bello Horizonte, but this does not pay well. As the times have changed, Sandra started a business selling cosmetics to increase her earnings. With a previous loan, Sandra made improvements to her house. With this loan, she will add a room to give more privacy for her family. Sandra has worked from a young age, as her parents were poor. She has had a difficult life, leaving the house early in the morning to go to work and coming home late. In the future, she would like to dedicate herself only to the sale of cosmetics and clothing to earn more for her family and her house. For this project, she will buy stone, sand, cement, iron, metal roofing, steel beams and other materials. Thanks to these loans, she has improved her house and she is satisfied to have achieved her goals.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as stone, sand cement, iron, beams, and roofing.

loans.name: Linda Nimsi Abisag

texts.es: Linda Nimsi Abisag Ramírez C. de 21 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 11 meses de vida. Ella junto a su esposo poseen una panadería en la cual se encargar de elaborar y repartir el pan. Así mismo posee dos empleados, los cuales le contribuyen vendiendo el pan en bicicletas, y así mismo hay personas que llegan a comprar por mayor el pan o simplemente por unidad. Linda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, azúcar, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son la materia prima de su producto. Tanto para Linda como para su esposo este negocio es muy importante, ya que es gracias a este como cubren todos sus gastos, así mismo deben esforzarse por mejorarlo debido a que e la única fuente de ingresos que poseen.
texts.en:
Linda Nimsi Abisag Ramírez C. is 21 years old and lives in the San Marcos municipality in the San Salvador department with her life partner and 11 month old son. She and her husband own a bakery where they make and distribute their own bread. She also has two employees, who deliver the bread on bicycles. She has some clients who make wholesale purchases and others who purchase bread by the unit. Linda is requesting this loan so that she may buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other basic ingredients with which she can make her bread. This business is very important for both Linda and her husband as it allows them to cover all of their regular expenses. Furthermore, they are committed to improving it as it is the only source of income they have.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and yeast to make bread.

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Sonia Argentina

texts.es: Sonia Argentina V. D. de 45 años de edad, reside en San Marcos, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es una mujer soltera con dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar, Sonia posee un comedor, en el cual elabora desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales los comercializa con las personas del lugar. Debido a que cuenta con una ubicación muy buena, por el hecho que esta rodeada de escuelas y fábricas, posee muchos clientes quienes a diario asisten a su negocio a consumir sus platillos. Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar verduras, arroz, frijoles y maíz, carne, pollo y otros productos más, los cuales son muy necesarios para la elaboración de comida. Para ella es de mucha importancia poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que es ella la única que trabaja para seguir adelante con su hogar y darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Argentina V. D., 45, lives in San Marcos, which is in San Salvador department. She is a single mother of two, school-age children. Sonia has an eatery where she prepares and sells breakfasts and lunches to area residents. Due to the fact that her location is good, because it is surrounded by schools and factories, she has many daily customers who consume her meals. Sonia is asking for funding to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, meat and chicken, among other ingredients, which are needed for her meal preparations. It is very important for her to improve the condition of her business since she is the only one who works to support her household and to meet all her children's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, meat and chicken.

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia C. P. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Lucia es una mujer la cual trabaja de lunes a domingo en su propio negocio en el cual elabora y vende desayunos y almuerzos, y en las noches hace pupusas. Su ubicación es bastante buena ya que en el lugar en el que se encuentra transitas muchos empleados y estudiantes. Lucia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar un horno, esto debido a que el que tiene en la actualidad no es de ella, y debe pagar mensual por su uso, es por ello que Lucia desea contar con uno propio. Lucia vela a diario por el bienestar de sus hijos y se esfuerza mucho por poder brindarles todo lo mejor, ya que son ellos el motor que hace que Lucia se esfuerce a diario por un mejor estilo de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia C. P., 35, lives in San Salvador department. She is a single mother of four, minor children, who are all in school. Lucia works seven days a week in her eatery where she sells breakfasts and lunches; in the evening she sells pupusas (maize dumpling). Her location is quite good because it has a lot of employees and students that pass by. Lucia is asking for funding to buy an oven because the one she currently uses is not hers and she must pay a monthly rental for its use so she would like to have her own. Lucia works every day to insure her children's well-being and makes an effort to provide them with the best since they are the motivating force for Lucia's daily efforts to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an oven.

loans.name: José Paulino

texts.es: José Paulino S. P. de 56 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. El posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad. Así mismo su esposa elabora tamales los cuales José se encarga de vender de manera ambulante. Debido a que cuenta con 10 años de poseer este negocio es muy conocido en la zona, incluso es muy solicitado por los tamales que vende. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para la tienda ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años de poseerla, carece de muchos productos los cuales son básicos para lograr vender más y obtener mayor clientela. Es por ello que el deseo de José es lograr surtir la tienda y de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias las cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
José Paulino S. P., 56, lives in Mejicanos with his wife and two sons. He has a grocery store where he sells food and basic needs items. In addition, his wife makes tamales that José goes out to peddle. He is very well-known in the area because he has had his store for over 10 years; he is also very sought-after for the tamales that he sells. José is requesting funding with which to buy stock items for his store because, even though he has had the store for many years, he still lacks many basic products that, if he stocked them, his sales would improve and his clientele would increase. José's wish, therefore, is to have a well-stocked store so that his earnings will increase thus benefitting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables.

loans.name: Jaqueline Patricia

texts.es: Jaqueline Patricia M. R. de 29 años de edad, reside en San Luis Talpa, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Ella vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en la zona franca del lugar y su pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Jaqueline se esfuerza mucho por obtener mayores ingresos, ya que su esposo aporta al hogar $120 mensuales, razón por la cual ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar granos básicos, café, leche, huevos y otros productos más, debido que dentro de sus metas esta el poder surtir la tienda de manera que le genera mayores ingresos. Jaqueline desea poder brindarle una vida mejor a su hijo sin necesidad de lo más básico para tener una vida digna, es por ello que espera poder incrementar sus ventas al comprar más productos los cuales satisfagan las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jaqueline Patricia M. R., 29, lives in San Luis Talpa, which is in La Paz department, with her husband, who works in the area's tax-free zone, and her 9-year-old son. She has a grocery store where she sells food and basic needs items. Jaqueline works hard to obtain higher earnings because her husband only makes $120 a month. For this reason, she is requesting funding to buy stock items like: basic grains, coffee, milk, eggs, etc. because among her goals is being able to stock her store in such a way that it generates higher income. Jaqueline wants to be able to provide her son with a better life, where he won't lack any of the basics, so as to have a worthy life. She hopes to increase her sales by having available the items her customers need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, milk and eggs.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: El Mamón Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Mamón está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que laboran arduamente. Una de ellas es la señora Filena del Rosario N. N.  quien elabora zapatos.

Este oficio lo aprendió desde muy temprana edad y es una tradición que ha pasado en generación en su familia. Aun recuerda el primer zapato que izo el cual  dice que dodo muy mal pero con la práctica fue mejorando mucho hasta convertirse en una maestra en este trabajo.

Sus compañeras de grupo realizan distintas actividades María Petrona G. tiene una modesta pulpería la cual sueña en convertir en distribuidora y Modesta P. hace y vende cobertores desde su infancia cuando le ayudaba a su madre.
texts.en:
The group El Mamón is made up of three hard-working, enterprising, and strong-willed women who labor arduously. One of them is Mrs. Filena del Rosario N. N., who makes shoes. She learned this trade at an early age, and it is a tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation in her family. She still remembers the first shoe that she made, which she says turned out poorly, but with practice she got better and better, eventually becoming a master at the job. Her group partners perform different activities. Maria Petrona G. has a modest store, which she dreams about turning into a wholesale distribution company. Modesta P. makes and sells blankets, which she has done since her childhood when she would help her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather, glue, nails, thread, soles, etc.

loans.name: Loira Pricila

texts.es: Loira Pricila Ávalos de 46 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Ilopango, vive junto a tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual vende productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad, negocio el cual es de mucha importancia para Loira ya que ha sido a través de este como ha logrado solventar todos los gastos del hogar, esforzándose mucho para poder hacerlo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más productos como leche, pan, cereales, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales le aseguren nuevos clientes y el poder mejorar sus ingresos, ya que tanto ella como sus hijos tienen la necesidad y el deseo de mejorar su economía y debido a que la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen es necesario invertir en ella para tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Loira Pricila Ávalos, 46, lives in Ilopango with her three children, who are students. She has a grocery store where she sells food and basic needs items. This business is very important for Loira in that it has allowed her, through much effort, to meet her household expenses. She is requesting funding so that she can buy basic items like: milk, bread, cereals, basic grains, etc. which will attract more customers and improve her earnings since both she and her children need and wish to improve their economic situation and because the store is the family's only source of income; she needs to invest in it in order to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic needs items.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa Aminta R. R. de 56 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su única hija la cual se dedica a trabajar y junto a un nieto el cual le ayuda en el negocio. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos y así mismo cada tarde vende platillos típicos como tamales, enchiladas, yuca y papas fritas. Esta venta es muy rentable para ella ya que todo lo que ella comercializa se vende mucho en la zona en la que vive. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de los platillos típicos, así mismo ella desea poder comprar algunas sillas para que las personas puedan llegar al lugar y comer ahí sus productos, lo cual le generará mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa Aminta R. R., 56, lives in Ciudad Arce, which is in La Libertad department, with her only daughter, who is employed, and her grandson, who helps his grandmother with her store. She has a grocery store and each afternoon she sells typical prepared meals like: tamales, enchiladas, yucca and fried potatoes. These sales are quite profitable for her because everything she sells is very popular in the area where she lives. She is requesting funding to buy more ingredients for her prepared meals; she also wants to buy some chairs so that the people who come by can stay and eat their meals there; this will generate higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr: Marie Thérèse C. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Thérèse depuis 02 ans et a eu 04 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la teinture de tissus, couture et tissage de pagnes. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse C. is a 52 year-old married mother of two. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Sainte Thérèse for two years, and has received four loans. She dyes fabric, clothing and 'pagnes' (brightly coloured wax cloth) for a living; her aim is to increase her savings and look after her family.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment funds

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne M. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis deux et a bénéficié de 04 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de développer une petite unité d'élevage de poulets et fait du petit commerce de tissus et de chaussures. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Jeanne M. is a 36 year-old married mother of four. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for two years and has received four loans which have been well managed and repaid. Her loan would help her to set up a small chicken-rearing unit, and a small fabric and shoes business. She is actively involved in looking after her family's welfare.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her investment funds

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es: La señora Aditza Maria  tiene 47 años de edad, casada y vive con su familia en el barrio Enrique Smit, junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales estudian. Su negocio ha sido la venta de ropa durante varios años vende ambulante en un mercado Oriental donde es el mas visitado por su demanda de venta a precios accesibles, para apoyar a su familia a pagar  los gastos de agua, luz, estudios y poder apoyar a su esposo ya que su salario es poco y no alcanza para todo. Gracias Adios tiene su propia casa que poco a poco ha ido mejorando, durante estos ciclos en Afodenic ha logrado invertir en ropa interior, camisetas, gorras entre otros productos, con este préstamo comprara ropa interior variada para niños y adultos ya que se vende mucho por el bajo costo y por ser de gran necesidad. En este mes compra mucha calcetas y camisolines para vender a los estudiantes. A futuro espera seguir mejorando sus ventas a si como tener un lugar fijo ya que anda ambulante por el mercado.
texts.en:
Aditza Maria, 47, is married and lives with her family, consisting of her husband and two children, who are students, in the Enrique Smit neighborhood. For several years she has been a clothing peddler in the Oriental market. She is one of the most popular sellers because she sells at reasonable prices. Her earnings go to pay for household expenses like: water. electricity, educational fees; she is able to help her husband because his salary is low and not sufficient to meet all their needs. Thanks to God, she owns her house which little by little she has been improving. During her loan cycles with Afodenic she has invested in underwear, t-shirts, caps, etc. With this new loan she will buy a variety of underwear for children and adults because it is a good seller due to its low price and its widespread need. This month she will buy socks and athletic shirts to sell to students. In the future she hopes to continue improving her sales as well as having a fixed locale because now, she sells walking through the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Melva Aidee

texts.es:
La señora Melva es otra de las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ya son 11 ciclos los que lleva en la Fundación, vive con su  hijo  ya que se separo de su esposo  y es él quien la acompaña  en casa y en su negocio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace cinco años,  recorre junto a su hijo en una moto para comprar por libras  la pesca  a los mayoristas en el  balneario de Crucita  a  media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo, invierte un aproximado de 200 dólares en cada adquisición de igual manera  salen todos los días a vender y calcula que diario le quedan libre de ganancias 40 dólares;  con este nuevo préstamo solicitado Melva comprará pescado que se vende más en ésta época del año y  tener un suficiente stock para sus clientes. 

Uno de sus sueños es  poder tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Melva is another member of the Mujeres Solidarias communal bank, which is in its 11th loan cycle with the Fundación. She is separated from her husband and lives with her son, who is her companion at home and at work. She has sold fish for the last 5 years. She and her son drive to buy pounds of fish from wholesalers in the seaside resort of Crucita, which is half-an-hour away from the city of Portoviejo. She invests about 200 dollars in each purchase which they go out daily to sell. She figures that her daily profits are 40 dollars. Melva will use this new loan to buy fish which is the best seller during this season and have sufficient stock available for her customers. One of her dreams is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Edith Emelda

texts.es: Edith Emelda M. D. A. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas, negocio el cual en este país es muy rentable por el hecho que las tortillas son parte D. la dieta diaria D. las personas, razón por la cual se venden mucho. Edith es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, la cual se esfuerza a diario por brindarles lo mejor y así mismo darle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar todos los gastos del hogar y también pagar los estudios D. sus hijos, lo cual es D. mucha importancia tanto para Edith como para su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz D. manera que pueda contar con más materia prima para la elaboración D. su producto.
texts.en:
Edith Emelda M. D. A. is 41 years old, resides in the Ilopango municipality, and lives with her husband and three children. She sells tortillas, which is a very profitable business in her country since tortillas are a part of the daily diet, which is why she sells so much. Edith is a very hard-working person and is dedicated to her family. She works hard daily to proviD. the best for her family and also to support her husband as necessary to pay for the household expenses and her children's studies, which mean as much to Edith as to her husband. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of corn so she can have more raw materials for the production of her product.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of corn.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana A. M. de 33 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como conductor de pick up, los cuales hacen viajes hacia el lago de Ilopango; así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, a pesar que cuenta con mucha competencia, Roxana no pierde la esperanza de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que ella cuenta con la necesidad de mejorar su economía familiar y poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijas. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos de primera necesidad, de manera que logre surtir en lo más posible la tienda y de esta manera ser la primera opción para todas las personas del lugar.
texts.en:
Roxana A. M., 33, lives in Ilopango with her husband, who is a pick-up driver, that makes trips towards Lake Ilopango. She has two, minor daughters, who are in schools. She has a grocery store where she sells basic needs items. Despite having a lot of competition, Roxana doesn't lose hope of being able to improve her business's condition because she needs to improve her family's economic situation to provide her daughters with all they need. For this reason, she is requesting funding to buy more stock items so that her store will be more productive and become the first choice for shoppers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic needs items.

loans.name: Sandra Marleni

texts.es: Sandra Marleni N. D. O. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como zapatero, y junto a sus dos nietos D. 6 años D. edad, quienes asisten al kinder. Sandra posee una venta D. plásticos como depósitos D. alimentos, cantimploras, alcanciíllas y otros productos más. A pesar que su negocio es bastante pequeño, le permite poder brindarle la ayuda económica necesaria a su esposo para poder pagar todos los gastos del hogar y la familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos plásticos, ya que estos se venden mucho por el hecho D. ser muy necesarios en el hogar. Sandra desea poder aumentar sus ventas en este nuevo año, ya que espera poder brindarles una mejor vida a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Sandra Marleni N. D. O., 46, lives in San Francisco Goteras, which is in Morazán department. She lives with her husband, who is a shoemaker, and two of her grandsons, who are 6 years old and in kindergarted. Sandra sells plastic items like: food containers, canteens, piggy banks, etc. Although her business is quite small, it allows her to proviD. economic help to her husband in order to meet all the family's and household's expenses. She is requesting funding to buy more plastic items since they are good sellers because they are very necessary in homes. Sandra wishes to increase her sales this new year so that she can proviD. her grandsons with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic items.

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Santos Elida

texts.es: Santos Elida A. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San salvador. Vive junto a su madre y una hermana. Santos se dedica a vender bebidas como sodas, cervezas y jugos, así también vende fruta en trocitos, en una cancha en la cual las personas llegan a observar partidos de fútbol. Ya que posee varios años de trabajar de esta manera, ella es muy conocida en el lugar, y las personas le compran por ser una persona muy confiable y aseada. Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas y así mismo poder comprar diferentes tipos de fruta. Para Santos es de mucha importancia mejorar las ventas debido a que es este la única fuente de ingresos con el que cuentan en su hogar, es por ello muy necesario obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos Elida A. A., 41, lives in San Salvador department with her mother and sister. Santos sells beverages like sodas, beers and juices. He also sells sliced fruit at a sports venue where people come to watch football games. Since she has been in this line of work for several years now, she is well-known and people buy from her because she is trustworthy and clean. Santos is requesting funding to buy a larger amount of beverages as well as different kinds of fruit. For Santos it is very important to improve sales because this is her only source of income for her family so it is very necessary to produce higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and beverages.

loans.name: Santos María Luz

texts.es: Santos María Luz E. F. de 45 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y con sus dos hijos menores de edad. Santos María posee una venta de tortillas en la cual las vende en el medio día y en la tarde. Hace más de 10 años que posee este negocio el cual le ha demostrado ser muy rentable, sobre todo porque le ha permitido solventar muchas deudas y pagos del hogar. Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz al mayoreo de manera que pueda obtenerlo a menor precio de lo normal, de esta manera ella podrá percibir mayores ganancias, las cuales beneficien sobre todo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos María Luz E. F. is 45 years old and resides in Cojutepeque in the district of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and with two young children. Santos María owns a tortilla shop, making tortillas and selling them at mid-day and in the afternoon. She has owned this business for 10 years; it has proven to be a quite profitable activity and has allowed her to pay off many loans and home expenses. Santos is seeking a loan in order to buy corn wholesale, allowing her to buy her corn at a lower than normal price. Thus, she will be able to earn a higher profit, which she will use to benefit her children.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Ana Lucinda

texts.es: Ana Lucinda R. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Tonacateque, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. En dicho negocia ella comercializa leche, pan, golosinas y otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, sobre todo con productos los cuales son muy básicos en el hogar. Ana desea mucho poder mejorar las ventas, ya que es ella quien le brinda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, esto debido a que el sueldo D. su compañero D. vida no da a bastos para todas las necesidad existentes, sobre todo porque como buenos padres, ambos anhelas poder brindarles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos, ya que el mayor D. ellos esta por ingresar a la universidad y Roxana y su esposo desean poder a través D. los estudios brindarle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ana Lucinda R. D. L. is 47 years old and resides in the municipality of Tonacateque, located in the district of San Salvador. Her immediate family is maD. up of her husband and her two children, both of which are currently attending school. She owns a general goods store (of mostly perishable food goods), which she runs out of her home. In her store, she sells milk, bread, soda, among other products. She is seeking this loan in order to re-stock her store, mostly with very basic home goods. Ana would very much like to improve her sales since she is currently helping her husband to cover their household expenses because her husband's salary doesn't cover all their current necessities. Above all, as good parents, they both dream of being able to proviD. their children with college educations, especially since the older one is about to enter college. Both Ana and her husband truly want to be able to support their children through college to proviD. them with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable food goods

loans.name: Viadil Beatriz

texts.es:
Viadil Sánchez de 45 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposo es comerciante ambulante con el tiene 3 hijas de 32, 29, 26 años ya todos casados y trabajando.

Viadil comenzó con el apoyo económico de su hija para ingresar a ser vendedora Yanbal, poco a poco comenzó comprando y vendiendo productos Yanbal. Ahora Viadil trabaja todos los días en las tardes vendiendo perfumes, cremas, shampoo, maquillajes todo esto por catalogo. Una de las dificultades que a veces tiene es su salud.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillajes para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder entregar mejor su mercadería.
texts.en:
Viadil Sánchez is 45 years old and lives in a suburban area located in the Perimetral de Guayaquil. Her husband is a door-to-door salesman and they have three daughters aged 32, 29, and 26 years old respectively. All of them are married and working. With financial support from her daughter, Viadil invested in the sale of Yanbal (a line of cosmetics products). Little by little, Viadil has started buying and selling Yanbal products. Now Viadil works every afternoon selling perfumes, creams, shampoo, and makeup by catalog. However, she sometimes had trouble selling her goods because of health problems. With this loan, she wants to buy perfumes, creams, and makeup to increase her variety of products. In the future, she would like to buy a car in order to better transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, and makeup

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento "NUEVO HORIZONTE " es un Banco que se encuentra en su segundo ciclo,  en el cual demostraron ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Aleja quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. dulces en  calle Nataniel Aguirre y Aroma . Esta separada  y tiene 4 hijos.

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Ivone  esta casada y tiene 2 hijos su negocio es  venta D. anticucho   en la puerta D. su domicilio  es una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas.

La secretaria es la Sra. Liliana  quien es casada y  tiene 4 hijos y  tiene el negocio D. venta còsmeticos es una persona  activa.						
						
Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The microfinance communal bank "NUEVO HORIZONTE " is in its second loan cycle. During its first loan cycle, this group has shown itself to be maD. of hardworking and responsible people. This group is maD. up of the following members: The President is Mrs. Aleja who is the leader and founder of the group. Her business is the sale of candy on Nataniel Aguirre y Aroma street. She is separated and has four children. The Treasurer is Mrs. Ivone, who is married and has two children. Her business is the sale of anticucho (a Peruvian meat dish cooked and served on skewers) from the door of her home. She has proven herself to be very responsible and punctual with her payments. The Secretary is Mrs. Liliana who is married, has four children, and runs a cosmetics sales business. She is an active and hardworking person. All are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having confidence in them and for granting them this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Surayya

texts.en:
Surayya J. is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Surayya has a grocery store that she operates in addition to caring for her family and her home. She started her business seven years ago to increase the income for her large family. The business has been growing gradually ever since. The business went well from the beginning. By the time Surayya expanded her business, her grocery store was well known in her community. 

To further expand her business, Surayya is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN. Surayya is planning to spend the loan to buy more goods to sell so she can increase the variety of food she sells. She promises to repay her loan without any violations and thanks everyone who decides to support her.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Rabiyya

texts.en:
Rabiyya I. is a 41-year old single woman who lives with her parents. Her diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Rabiyya. After trying to earn more by working as nurse, she decided to try a livestock business to find an additional source of income. She started this business 20 years ago with the support of her parents. Now that Rabiyya has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge, she would like to expand her business.

Rabiyya is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to buy more three more calves and fodder so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Seyidhuseyn

texts.en:
Seyidhuseyn J., age 52, is a sheep breeder and the responsible father of four children. He has always contributed to his family’s financial security by caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become and independent businessman with a small number of animals and a small patch of land.

Seyidhuseyn has more than fifteen years of experience. Sheep-breeding is the main source of income for his family and generates the income that enables him to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

Seyidhuseyn has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase 16 sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 16 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Ida María

texts.es:
Ida Maria  es socia del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias se reúnen cada quince días en casa de una de las socias en las afueras de la ciudad de Portoviejo. 

Ida Maria se dedicada a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años, toma los pedidos de sus clientes  recorriendo su sector de residencia, una vez que termina de entregar los pedidos  reúne parte del dinero y  viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil donde adquiere la mercadería a los distribuidores directos.

Nuestra socia cuenta con la ayuda de su hija soltera en  la toma de pedidos mientras que sus otros hijos ya son casados e independientes, ella se separo hace algún tiempo de su esposo  y a pesar de todos los desafíos que le ha tocado enfrentarse no ha dejado de seguir adelante, uno de sus sueños es ponerse una panadería ya que en el sector no hay  y sería una gran oportunidad de trabajo.

Con este nuevo préstamo ella comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, interiores para damas, caballeros y niños  pues ya cuenta con varios pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ida Maria is a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias ("Supportive Women"). They meet every 15 days in the home of one of the members on the outskirts of the city of Portoviejo.

Ida Maria has been selling clothing for three years. She takes orders from her customers by traveling through her neighborhood, and when she finishes delivering the orders, she collects some of the money and travels to the city of Guayaquil where she buys the merchandise from the distributors directly.

Our member counts on the help of her single daughter, who takes the orders, since her other children are already married and living independently. She separated from her husband some time ago, and in spite of all of the challenges she has faced, she hasn't given up on getting ahead. One of her dreams is to start a bakery since there isn't one in her region, and it would be a great working opportunity.

With this new loan, she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, underwear for women, men, and children, which are the different requests from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear for women, men, and children

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil A. is 53 years old. More than 20 years ago, she decided to raise livestock. She began with just one cow and now has many. Every morning, she goes out early so that her beloved cows can graze among the hills all day in hopes that they return happy and satisfied.

Sevil is motivated to continue in this arduous work by the thought of her four children who, along with her husband, help her with the cows. To succeed in her business, she and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy in hopes of ultimately selling them at a good price. Thanks to her continued activity in her occupation, Sevil and her family are able to sustain themselves and this fills her with great satisfaction.

With the support of this loan, Sevil would like to purchase three calves and fodder to increase her income. With your support, she will be able to accomplish her business goals, thus helping to fund the education of all four of her children.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub Q. is 35 years old and married with two children. He has chosen to make his life on his land and work hard and grow with it. That is why he has dedicated himself to agriculture and the raising of cows. He has been doing this kind of work for a long time as he comes from a family with an agricultural background. Now he is the one to hand down all that experience to his children. Teyyub is requesting a loan of 1445 AZN to buy more cows in the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home. Support Teyyub so that he can accomplish his goals.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Quebecor Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal Quebecor, está conformada por 10 socios entusiastas y emprendedores quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 4 años.
Gladis Blanca es una socia del grupo y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta recientemente, tiene 37 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 12 y 18 años D. edad. Gladis se dedica a L. venta D. ropa desD. hace 3 años, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado implementar más su negocio y tener un pequeño ahorro, su gran anhelo es tener una tienda granD., para así captar una mayor clienteL. y mejorar su calidad D. vida. 
El reciente préstamo será utilizado para L. compra D. mercadería D. estación para diversificar sus productos, nuestros socios se sienten muy agradecidos por el apoyo recibido y se comprometen en L. puntualidad D. sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Quebecor Communal Bank is comprised of ten enthusiastic and entrepreneurial members. They have an affinity for devoting themselves to small businesses. They have worked with Edaprospo – Prosperidad for four years. Gladis Blanca, a member of the group, recently assumed the position of president. She is 37, married, and has two children. They are 12 and 18. Gladis has been selling clothes for three years. With the effort in her work, she was able to set up her business more and have a little savings. Her biggest goal is to have a large store in order to gain more customers and improve her quality of life. The recent loan will be used to buy seasonal merchandise to diversify her products. Our members are very grateful for the support they have received, and they promise to be punctual with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal merchandise to diversify their products

loans.name: Maristania Solanda

texts.es:
Maristania forma parte del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella está casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es guardia de una estación de servicio en la ciudad  y ella trabaja hace dos meses   para una amiga en su restaurant en el área de cocina, aparte  de esta labor en su casa vende diferentes  bebidas como colas, cervezas, jugos y aguas, éste negocio lo montó hace tres  meses aproximadamente y sólo lo atiende los fines de semana. En cada pedido ella invierte entre 100 a 200 dólares mensuales.

Con el nuevo préstamo que recibirá de la Fundación Espoir ella invertirá todo en abastecer  su pequeña tienda con suficientes colas, aguas, jugos  y cerveza que en ésta época del año  se vende mucho más.

Entre sus  sueños esta poder terminar su casa y darle el toque  que le falta para que este totalmente habitable.
texts.en:
Maristania is part of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias ("Supportive Women") in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a guard in a service station in the city, and she has worked for two months for a friend in her restaurant in the kitchen. Apart from this work, in her home she sells different beverages such as sodas, beers, juices and water. She has been in this business for approximately three months and she only serves the beverages on weekends. With every request, she invests between 100 and 200 dollars per month.

With the new loan that she will receive from the Fundación Espoir, she will invest all of it in supplying her small shop with soda, water, juice, and beer for she sells a lot more this time of year.

One of her dreams is to be able to finish her home and give it the touches that it is missing to make it completely habitable.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soda, water, juice, and beer

loans.name: Gulchokhra

texts.en: Gulchokhra A. is 53 years old. She is married with three children. She has worked at the business of buying and selling cattle since 1985. She visits farms and settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price so she can increase her profits. She currently has two cows and two calves. Now that her children are grown, Gulchokhra wants to expand her business as they will be able to help her care for more cattle. She is requesting 1200 AZN in order to buy cows. Gulchokhra expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: purchase four cattle

loans.name: Wilson Mauricio

texts.es:
Wilson A. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar con ella tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años de edad todos están estudiando.

Wilson empezó vendiendo  jarros para jugos con el apoyo de un amigo que le presto dinero para que pudiera comenzar. Ahora el se dedica a vender utensilios del hogar  recorriendo todos los sectores de Guayaquil vendiendo ollas, platos, jarras, vasos etc. Trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 13h00 atendiendo un promedio de 6 a10 clientes diarios. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son las lluvias.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas utensilios para el hogar como platos, ollas, cucharas etc. En el futuro quiere tener un buen capital para trabajar y poder tener un lugar fijo para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Wilson A., 38, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. His wife devotes herself to the household chores. They have three children. The children are 14, 12, and 9; and all of them go to school. With help from a friend who lent him money to be able to start, Wilson began selling pitchers for juice. Now he sells household utensils by traveling all of the sectors of Guayaquil selling pots, plates, pitchers, and glasses, etc. He works from 9:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. He waits on an average of six to ten customers a day. The rains are an inconvenience that he has. He wants to use the loan to buy more household utensils like plates, pots, and spoons, etc. In the future he wants to have good capital in order to work and be able to have a fixed location to sell his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household utentsils like pots and plates

loans.name: Ofeliya

texts.en: Ofeliya A. is 52 years old, the self-sacrificing mother of two sons. Her work as an agricultural laborer together with the low income of her husband and her very low pension as a former teacher is not enough to meet her goals. Ofeliya is requesting 1600 AZN to invest in purchasing cattle that will allow her to increase her earnings. This way she will be able to finish remodeling her home in order to give her son and his new wife a place to live. Ofeliya plans to collaborate in the busisness with her daughter-in-law and her mother.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa A. is 37 years old. She is widow and the mother of a son. Hard life conditions pushed Vafa to start her own business eight years ago. 

Vafa breeds cattle. She buys the calves in the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a more profitable price. Vafa works hard to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for her family. 

Vafa is requesting a loan of 1440 AZN to purchase three calves  to raise and sell and fodder to feed them. Vafa would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Señor Cautivo D. Ayabaca”, está conformada por 10 socios, luchadores y emprendedores, quienes tienen por afinidad vivir en la zona central D. Huaycán y se desempeñan en labores D. comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 3 años.
Vite Eufracia es una socia del grupo quien a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta desD. hace 1 año, tiene 39 años, es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. 12, 13, 15, 18 y 20 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. chupetes, golosinas y además hace labores domesticas en casas particulares desD. hace 1 año, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado comprar una computadora y solventar los  estudios D. sus hijos en la universidad, junto a su esposo quien labora como chofer D. transporte público.
El reciente préstamo será utilizado para cancelar sus deudas e invertir en su pequeño negocio, nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Señor Cautivo D. Ayabaca” is composed of 10 members. They are fighters and enterprising, and who all live in the central part of Huaycán and work in the retail industry. They have been working with Kiva partner EDAPROSPO with prosperity for 3 years. Vite Eufracia is a member of the group who has taken on the roll of being the president of the group over the past year. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children, who are 12, 13, 15, 18, and 20 years old. She has been selling lollipops and candy for a living, as well as performing domestic household activities in particular houses for 1 year. As a result of her daily hard work, she has been able to purchase a computer and pay for her childen to go to college, along with the help of her husband who works as a public transportation driver. The recent loan will be used to pay off her debts and invest in her small business. The members of the group are appreciative of the support provided and commit to pay the installments on the agreed-upon dates.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off their debts and invest in their small businesses

loans.name: Encarna

texts.es:
La señora Encarna, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 52 años y es madre de 06 hijos,  ya independientes.

Encarna, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, negocio que hoy en la actualidad, le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 500.00 y se inicio con 02 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Encarna, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Señora Encarna belongs to the Banco Comunal 'Mujeres Audaces', Moyobamba District, Moyobamba Province, San Martín Department. She is single, is 52 years old and is the mother of 6 children, all independent. Encarna is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life's path. The desire to move forward has given her very good results and now she works selling soft drinks, a business which today gives her very good results. She feels very content with what she has achieved. You can find her in a well air-conditioned area in her own home, where she attends to her clients with the amiability and charisma which have always characterised her. It is Encarna that administers her business, without having a timetable or boss. She tells us that she began with capital of S/. 500.00 and 2 packets of soft drink. She saw that this went very well, so little by little she began investing more. With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 she will buy more soft drinks such as: packets of soft drinks in different flavours, sizes and brands, and also still and sparkling mineral water. Encarna is very thankful for the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsbile with her loan repayments and thinks to continue the same way.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase packets of softdrinks

loans.name: Sinddy Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Sinddy Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 25 años y no tiene hijos.

Sinddy patricia, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos, así que decidió implementar su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ya es conocida por sus clientes fijos que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Encarna, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sinddy Patricia belongs to the community bank "Mujers Audaces" (Bold Women) in the district of Moyobamba, province of Moyabamba, in the department of San Martín. She is single, twenty five years old, and does not have any kids.

Sinddy Patricia is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her path through life. Her desire to succeed led to very good results and today, with the business that she runs, she feels very happy with what she has achieved. Little by little she was generating her own income, and because of this she decided to start her own business selling sodas in a very pleasant context in her own home. She is already well know by her regular clients who are neighbors, family, and friends.

With this loan of $525, she will buy more drinks such as: crates of sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands as wells as mineral water with and without gas.

She is very greatful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it, is responsible with her repayments, and intends to continue in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas

loans.name: Flor Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Flor Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la confección de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse a la compra venta de maderas al por mayor y menor, negocio que lo desarrolla en su misma casa, con el apoyo de su esposo, atendiendo pedidos de las carpinterías y ebanisterías mas importantes de la ciudad y la región, entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que los brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.    

Flor Angélica, es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que le sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres, que como ella quieren salir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por contribuir con sus sueños y metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Flor Angélica, 36, is a member of the "Amor y Paz" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is single and has three children, all of whom are still dependent on her. Because wood is an important component in furniture-making, she thought the opportunity to buy wood at wholesale and sell at retail from her home would be a profitable business. With her husband's support, she fills orders from the most important carpentry and cabinet-making shops in the city and region. She is very well-known among her customers for the quality of the woods she sells as well as for the good customer service she offers. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy cuartones (a sixteen feet long, 3x3" beam) of various woods like: tornillo (a tropical wood, scientific name: Cedrelinga catenaiformes), cedar, mahogany, ishpingo (a tropical wood, scientific name: Amburana cearensis. It has a well-established reputation in Peru for decorative purposes and durability), among other varieties that are valued in the making of living-room, dining-room, kitchen and office furniture. Flor Angélica is a persevering, enterprising woman, qualities which serve as examples to other women like her who want to get ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contrituting to her dreams coming true and to meeting her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of wood.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
la sra. Etelvina M. tiene un puesto de abarroteria en el mercado de nacaome, tiene 57 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. vive en la aldea el chorro, Goascoran, Valle.
Etelvina esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas productos como ser refrescos, manteca, aceite, condimentos, baterias, sopas, etc.
Etelvina necesita surtir su negocio para poder darse abasto con todas las exigencias dde sus clientes.
dice estar muy contenta ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Etelvina M. has a grocery store in the Nacaome market. She is 57 years old and has 5 children for whom she cares. She lives in the village of El Chorro, Goascoran, Valle. Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase more products such as soft drinks, butter, oil, condiments, batteries, soups, etc. She needs to stock her business in order to be able to cope with all of her clients' demands. She tells us that she is very content, since everything is going well for her and her business is growing more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soap, toilet paper, pasta, soft drinks, soup, condiments, batteries, butter, margarine, and oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años y es madre de 03  hijas, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Carmen Rosa, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de ropas para bebes, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 500.00, comprando 06 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas y poco a poco fue invirtiendo más. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará  más mercaderías de ropas de bebes como: roponsitos, vestidos, pantalones. 

Ella manifiesta que se siente orgullosa, por lo que logro con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo y agradece al Movimiento  Manuela Ramos, que le brinda el apoyo de  contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa belongs to the Amor y Paz Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 51, married, and has three daughters. One is still dependent upon her. Carmen Rosa is a woman who likes to work, so she decided to set up her own business selling baby clothes. The business is located in a well equipped area of her house. She runs the business herself, without having a schedule or a boss. She tells us that she started with 500 PEN, and she bought six packages of soft drinks. She saw that it was going very well for her. She was running out of soft drinks, so she was buying more little by little. She currently continues with the same business, and she is well known by her customers. She will use this loan of 1,700 PEN to buy more baby clothes like cotton t-shirts, dresses, and pants. She feels proud of what she has accomplished with great enthusiasm and optimism. She is grateful for the opportunity to have loans that the Manuela Ramos Movement has offered her. They have helped her to develop as a woman and a small business entrepreneur.
