Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby clothes

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Matilde, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y se inicio desde muy joven por iniciativa propia, se encuentra ubicada, en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde atiende a sus clientes día a día. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día, vende por las mañanas y tardes. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Matilde, se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su restaurante al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Matilde belongs to the Amor y Paz Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 42, married, and has three children. One is still dependent upon her. Matilde decided to sell prepared food. She started on her own initiative when she was very young. Day to day she waits on her customers in the Central Market in her district. She tells us that she has very good daily sales because of the delicious seasoning she gives her food. She currently continues with the same business. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She sells in the mornings and the afternoons. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, and vegetables. She will use part of the money to buy utensils to replace her old ones. That way she will give her customers better service. Matilde feels full of life, and she still has the desire to keep going forward. She has a lot of dreams and goals in her life. For example she wants to better equip her restaurant. At the same time, she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Brillantes” Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 46 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 01  que aun depende de ella.

Rosario, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 200.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Rosario, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Rosario belongs to the Mujeres Brillantes Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, department of San Martín. She is 46, single, and has two children. One child is still dependent upon her. Rosario is a fighter and a hard-working woman. She decided to set up her own business selling carbonated drinks. It is in a very well equipped area in her own house. She runs the business without having a schedule or a boss. She tells us that she started with 200 PEN; she bought five packages of soft drinks. She saw that it went very well for her, so, little by little, she invested more. She currently continues with the same business. She is well known by her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy more drinks like packs of soft drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands. She will also buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Rosario has lots of goals ahead, and she feels very motivated to be able to make her dreams come true. That is what she has made up her mind to do. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments, and she plans to continue that way.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy packages of soft drinks

loans.name: Silvia Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Natividad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Brillantes”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada tiene 51 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, 01 que aun depenD. D. ella.

Silvia Natividad, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio D. ventas D. bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00, comprando 08 paquetes D. gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo más. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Silvia Natividad, se siente muy bien y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas D. pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Silvia Natividad, 51, is a member of the "Mujeres Brillantes" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is married and has 5 children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Silvia Natividad is a woman who loves to work. She decided to set up her own business selling carbonated beverages from a well-equipped area of her home. She is her own boss. She tells us that she began with a 300 sol investment that bought 8 cases of soft-drinks. She saw that she did well and little by little invested in more stock. Currently, she has the same business and is well-known by her customers. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy more soft-drinks in a variety of flavors, sizes and brands as well as still and sparkling mineral water. Silvia Natividad feels good and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed help; she is responsible with her repayments and intends to continue to be so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Pedro tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos que dependen de él: Sandra tiene 12 años y Fabricio tiene 6 años. El socio Pedro vive en la ciudad de Calca departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio se dedica a la elaboración de panes. El socio nos cuenta que sus padres le enseñaron la elaboración de panes desde muy niño y ahora tiene su propio horno donde produce 420 panes entre los especiales y empanadas por día. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura y leña. El socio esta pensado producir panteón para esta campaña navideña.   
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Pedro is 36 years old, lives with his partner, and has two children who depend on him: Sandra is 12 years old and Fabricio is 6 years old. Pedro lives in the city of Calca, in the department of Cusco, and belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Asunta" which is part of the Arariwa Association.

Pedro makes bread. He tells us that his parents taught him how to make bread when he was a small child, and now he has his own oven where he produces 420 loaves of bread per day, between the specials and the empanadas. He has been in this business for 15 years and it has been very good for him thanks to all of the effort he puts into his work. He is a hard-working father and businessman who gets his family ahead. He requires the loan in order to buy more consumables such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, and firewood. He is thinking about making a special bread, panettone, for the Christmas season.

Pedro is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and likewise commits to complete the payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He requires the loan to purchase more consumables such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
la Sra. Santos Estela A. tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos,  de los cuales 1 ya se graduo del colegio y dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando, Santos vive en el barrio Morazan de la ciudad de Nacaome. Tiene una pulperia desde hace 4 años y medio y esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion.
Santos necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos y con este negocio sale adelante con sus hijos, cubre los gastos del hogar. ahorita necesita tener mas ganancias ya que esta teniendo mas gastos del hogar.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz porque gracias a su negocio esta educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is forty years old, married, and has four children, one of whom has already graduated from high school and two of whom are studying. Santos lives in the Morazan neighborhood of the city of Nacaome. She has had a grocery store for four and a half years and she runs it from her home.

Santos needs the credit to supply her business, since it is her only source of income and with this business she improves things for her and her children and covers the household expenses. Right now she needs more profits since she is facing greater household expenses.

She told us she feels very happy because, thanks to her business, she is educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candy, churros, razors, spices, tortillas, beans, butter, margarine, oil, bulbs, batteries, biscuits, coffee, soap, pepper, sanitary napkins

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
la señora Maria Suyapa C. tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en el barrio Buenos Aires. Maria se dedica al comercio, tiene 3 años de tener su negocio propio, Maria vende 
comida, granos basicos, perfumes, zapatos, sandalias y mucho mas.
necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes y a veces se queda sin producto para la venta.
Maria se siente feliz ya que en poco tiempo esta viendo frutos de su negocio. su sueño es tener una tienda grande en la cual pueda tener de todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. Maria is engaged in commerce and has had her own business for three years. Maria sells food, dried goods, perfumes, shoes, sandals, and much more.

She needs this loan to stock her business since the demands of her customers are great and sometimes she is left without any goods to sell. Maria is happy that, in only a short time, she has started seeing the fruits of her business. Her dream is to have a large store where she can have all types of product.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, pork, beef, sugar, rice, beans, sodas, juices, candy, soups, pastas, sauces, condiments and cakes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JULIO, pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKILI”, el socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestro socio tiene 32 años de edad es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 9 años de edad, él es empresario, el tiene una pizzería en la esquina de su casa en mateo pumacahua, nuestro socio es cheff de profesión, dedicado a la elaboración de diferentes potajes resaltando entre ellos todo tipo de pastas y pizzas, nuestro socio tiene este negocio hace 1 año y está feliz por que logró mantenerse en el mercado con buena calidad de sus productos.

Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más insumos y reinvertir en su propia pizzería.

El socio agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y les envía a sus colaboradores en este sueño un fuerte abrazo a la distancia.
texts.en:
Our member Julio is a member of the "KUKILI" community bank and was born in city of Cuzco.

Our member is 32 years old, is married and the father of a 9 year old son. He is an entrepreneur. He has a pizzeria in the corner of his house in Mateo Pumacauha. He is a chef by trade, dedicating himself to concoct different dishes among them and all types of pastas and pizzas. Our partner has had this business for a year and is happy to have been able to maintain himself in the market due to the quality of his products.

Our member requests the loan to buy more supplies and reinvest in his pizzeria.

The member is thankful and expresses his satisfaction for being able to continue to grow his business. He sends a long-distance hug to the contributors to his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la Sra. María Luisa, pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKILI”, la socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 años y 8 meses de edad, la socia es artesana, ella realiza trabajos en arcilla, nuestra socia tiene un stand en la calle san Andrés, en la feria artesanal a una cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco, nuestra socia trabaja desde hace 5 años en esta feria, comenzó ayudando a su mamá y finalmente ella misma aprendió el negocio de la madre y se independizó, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder así comprar materia prima para elaborar sus trabajos en arcilla.

La  socia agradece y valora el préstamo lo cual le permitirá seguir aportando e su hogar y así seguir haciendo maravillas con la arcilla.
texts.en:
Our member is Senora María Luisa, who belongs to the communal bank 'Kukili'. She is from the city of Cusco. Our member is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children - 4 years and 8 months of age. She is an artesan, doing her work in clay. She has a stand in San Andrés street, in an artesanal market one block from the principal plaza of the city of Cusco. Our member has worked in this market for 5 years. She began helping her mother and finally learnt her mother's business herself and became independent. Maria Luisa is is seeking a loan to be able to buy primary materials to complete her works in clay. María Luisa is thankful for and values the loan, which will permit her to continue building her house and in this way continue making marvels with clay.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Primary materials to make artesanal objects

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Marco Antonio V. tiene 45 años de edad, tiene un hijo y viven en el barrio Buenos Aires, en su casa de habitacion tiene su taller de carpinteria, tiene  4 años de tener su negocio en el cual elabora muebles para cocina, puertas, ventanas y tambien vende articulos como ser cameras, colchones, camas, ollas y otros articulos para el hogar.
Marco esta solicitando el credito para comprar madera y otros materiales para fabricar sus muebles.
 
Marco es una persona muy cristiana y nos comento que desea que todo el mundo este en paz.
texts.en:
Señor Marco Antonio V. is 45 years old, has a son and lives in the suburb of Buenos Aires. In his house he has a carpentry workshop, which he has had for 4 years. He makes kitchen furniture, doors, windows and also sells articles such as cameras, mattresses, beds, pans and other household articles. Marco is seeking a loan to buy wood and other materials to make his furniture. Marco is a very Christian person and tells us that he desires the world to be in peace.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, sandpaper, varnish, nails, screws and paint

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la Sra. Ruth. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “KUKILI”, la socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 6, 3, 1 años de edad, la socia es comerciante y empresaria, ella junto a su esposo tiene un stand de venta de computadoras y todo tipo de accesorios de computo, la socia particularmente alterna sus labores de la casa con el apoyo casi permanente con su esposo.

Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar accesorios para computadoras.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos establecidos en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Our member is Senora Ruth. She belongs to the communal bank 'Kukili', and is from the city of Cusco. Our member is 35 years old, is married, and has 4 children of 13, 6, 3 and 1 years of age. She is a storekeeper and business woman. Together with her husband she has a stand that sells computers and all types of computing accessories. She alternates her housework with the nearly permanent support of her husband. Our member is seeking a loan to be able to purchase computer accessories. Ruth values and is thankful for the loan granted and promises to adhere to the established repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories and improve her stand

loans.name: Leonor Gioconda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Leonor, pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKILI”, el socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 11, 5 años de edad, nuestra socia tiene 10 años trabajando con la asociación Arariwa en bancos comunales, ella es socia antigua, comenzó desde muy jovencita a trabajar con préstamo de este tipo y gracias a esto ella pudo independizarse y poner su propio mini taller de artesanía, ella elabora sus propios diseños en arcilla y los vende en la feria artesanal de san Andrés  ubicado a una cuadra de la plaza principal del Cusco, desde 1998.

Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus propios diseños.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Our member Leonor belongs to the communal bank 'Kukili' and is from the city of Cusco. Our member is 34 years old, is married, and has 3 children - 13, 11 and 5 years old. For 10 years our member has been working with the Arariwa association in communal banks. She is an old member, and from a very young age began working with this type of loan. Thanks to this she was able to become independent and install her own artesanal mini-stand in 1998. She makes her own designs in clay and sells them in the artesanal market in San Andrés, located one block from the principal plaza in Cusco. Our member is seeking a loan to be able to purchase primary materials to make her own designs. Our member is very thankful and expresses her satisfaction with being able to continue to grow her own business. She promises to meet the total payment for her debt in the determined period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase primary materials and merchandise for sale of artesanal goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent land for growing cotton

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla H. is a 52-year-old beloved mother of three children and a farmer with many long years of experience. Her husband passed away. She dedicates herself to producing seasonal fruits and vegetables, especially pomegranates.

The most important thing to Leyla is the well-being of her family. Through her work, she tries to cover their expenses and give them peace. Her work is very hard. Without her husband, Leyla bears all of the burden of bringing up her children on her shoulders. 

The difficulties that she faces now result from a lack of money to acquire the fertilizer that she needs for her farm. For this reason, she is requesting this loan. She wants to increase her production and improve her family's living conditions. A quality fertilizer will produce a quality harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Fredy tiene 29 años, es conviviente y va nacer su hijo por que su esposa esta embarazada, El socio Fredy vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio es técnico en informática y trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud en el área de informática hace cuadros estadísticos de cuantos pacientes se atienden en el hospital mensualmente y también tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de cervezas y gaseosas en su restaurante “Las gemelas” en la ciudad de Calca. Ya son 5 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más bebidas como cervezas y gaseosas. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, Fredy, is 29 years old, lives with his partner, and will soon have a baby because his partner is pregnant. Fredy lives in the city of Pisaq in the department of Cusco and belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Asunta" of the Arariwa Association.

The member is a computer technician and he works in the Ministry of Health in the area of information technology making statistical tables of the number of patients who are attended to at the hospital each month and he also has a small family business selling beer and sodas in his restaurant "The Twins" in the city of Calca. He has already run this business for five years and it has gone very well for him thanks to all the effort that he has put into his work. Our member is a hardworking dad and entrepreneur who is supporting his family. The member needs the loan to buy more drinks such as beer and sodas.

The member is grateful for the opportunity offered to him in this way and promises to complete the repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan to buy more drinks such as beer and sodas.

loans.name: Alberto Cayetano

texts.es:
Desde hace 8 años, en el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Alberto F. se dedica a la venta de queso comercializado por él mismo y ofreciéndolo a sus clientes que le visitan para comprar el productos que es de mucha calidad.

Él se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y esforzado y por atender a las necesidades de su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando porque requiere invertir en la compra del queso y es por esta razón que espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado y así logrará obtener el queso para comercializarlo y obtener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
For the last eight years Sr. Alberto F. has been selling cheese in the municipality of Somotillo in the department of Chinandega. He sells the cheese himself and also has customers come to him for the high-quality products. He is well known for being very hard-working, for putting in a lot of effort, and for paying attention to the needs of his family. Alberto is asking for a loan because he needs money to buy cheese, and for this reason he hopes that his request will be granted. Then he will be able to obtain cheese to sell and earn money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cheese

loans.name: Enoc Adán

texts.es:
El señor Enoc C. vive en el municipio de Somotillo en conjunto con su esposa y su hijo en edad escolar al que debe de brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle. Actualmente ha decidido iniciar a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y lo está haciendo mediante el mejoramiento de un pozo ya que necesita enladrillarlo.
Por estos motivos es que el señor Enoc ha acudido a Ceprodel con el deseo de recibir un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los ladrillos para llevar a cabo este trabajo y así finalizar el mejoramiento del pozo para continuar extrayendo agua sin ningún problema y de esta manera mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Enoc C. lives in the municipality of Somotillo with his wife and their school-aged son. He needs to provide a good home for his son to grow up in. Enoc has now decided to start work on improving the family’s living conditions by buying new bricks for their well. For this reason Enoc went to Kiva partner Ceprodel to ask for a loan so that he could buy bricks and carry out the work. Then he will be able to get water without difficulty and thus improve the lives of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Juana A. se dedica arduamente a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su hijo que depende de ella. Se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y tener muchos deseos de continuar mejorando su nivel de vida. Ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello lo realiza para brindarle a su hijo un techo digno donde vivir. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de los materiales de construcción con el propósito de continuar en esta obra y así lograr su sueño de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Juana A. works very hard in the municipality of Somotillo to provide a home for her son who is dependent on her. She is well known for being very hardworking and for wanting to continue improving her life. She has started to improve her home so that her son has a decent place in which to grow up. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy construction materials so that the work can continue enabling Juana to achieve her dream of a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
El señor José Pedro L. es padre de familia, tiene un hijo pequeño de edad que actualmente estudia.
Con un crédito anterior de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta los acabados del interior. Tiene el proyecto de realizarlo de un buen material para que sea más duradero.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa mejora y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene como guardia de seguridad.
Su deseo es que su familia tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
José is the father of a family and has one young son who is currently studying.

With the previous loan from FVP he has built a room, but he is missing the interior finishings. He want to do this in a good material so that it will be more durable.

He is requesting a loan for this home improvement and he plans to repay it with the income that he makes as a security guard.

His wish is that his family will have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finishing

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La señora María Dolores Treviño esta agradecida por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos,
Esta solicitando otro préstamo para invertir en el negocio le está haciendo falta mas mercancía, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio, ya que los gastos familiares se encarga su esposo el señor Antonio de Jesús Daniel.
texts.en:
María Dolores Treviño is grateful for the cooperation given through her previous loans. She is asking for a new loan to invest in her business because she needs more merchandise but, at the moment, lacks the funds to invest. She plans to repay from profits earned in her business since her husband, Antonio de Jesús Daniel, takes care of family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Nuestros  socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito D. Huanchac.

Nuestros socios son un grupo D. 13 personas entre varones y mujeres, todos ellos amigos, nuestros socios son personas emprendedoras y ansiosos D. seguir creciendo más con el capital que mediante este medio se les otorga; los señores alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio, en este ameno grupo tenemos a profesores D. diferentes áreas D. un instituto, también a secretarías y a dos socios que compran y venden dólares, a una farmacéutica que tiene su botica cerca a la institución donD. laboran los otros socios, todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en  sus diferentes negocios y otro grupo para sus libros D. trabajo.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members make up the “SEÑOR D. HUANCA” communal bank, which is located in the city of Cusco, Huanchac district. It is a group of 13 persons, both men and women, who are all friends and enterprising persons anxious to continue growing with the capital they get through this means. They each have different commercial activities. Among them are: teachers at an institute, secretaries, two members that do currency exchange, a pharmacist that has her drug store near the institution where the other members work. They all request funds to reinvest in their various businesses and another group to pay for their work-related books. The members appreciate and value the loan obtained and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members will use the funds to buy ingredients and to reinvest in their various businesses.

loans.name: Jesus Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Jesus Alejandro C. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Como desea tener su propia casa vivienda está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (crédito gubernamental) pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
El trabajo en una fábrica en el departamento de mantenimiento a la maquinaria, con una parte de su ingreso separa para pagar el crédito.
Portal motivo el solicita el préstamo para completar su crédito Gubernamental y así adquirir su casa. Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus Alejandro C. lives in a borrowed house with his wife and two children. He wants to have his own house and is negotiating with INFONAVIT (government subsidized housing loan). However, the value of the house is higher than the loan he qualifies for because his salary is low; he works in a factory in the machine service department. He sets aside part of his income to pay the loan. For this reason, he is asking for funding to make up the difference between the government loan and the down payment required so that he can afford the house. He hopes to establish secure equity for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the difference in down payment cost of a house through INFONAVIT.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Yolanda A. le esta haciendo falta material para empezar la construcción de una cuarto ya que tiene un negocio de papelería y le esta ocupando un habitación.
Es por eso que desea construir un cuarto al frente de la casa y acondicionarlo para su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda de mercancía y no tiene suficiente esparció para exponerla.  
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de su negocio ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Fernando Ramos, quien trabaja de supervisor de unas farmacias.
texts.en:
Yolanda A. needs building materials to complete a room addition to her house because she runs a stationary shop in one of the bedrooms and she needs the space. She would like to build a room in the front of the house and set it up as her business since demand for her products is high and she doesn't have enough space to exhibit her merchandise. She plans to repay the loan with profits from her business since her husband, Fernando Ramos, who works as a pharmacy supervisor, takes care of family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.es: El Sr. Gerard tiene 24 años de edad  es conviviente, aun no cuentan con carga familiar, ellos viven en la casa de su suegra en el Distrito de la tinguiña, recientemente  han adquirido un vehiculo de segunda el cual el mismo lo trabaja, Gerad es un joven muy trabajador  y emprendedor, el  trabajo desde muy pequeño, el ultimo trabajo que realizo fue en una mina como chofer el cual pudo juntar el dinero para la compra de su vehiculo, Gerard tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propia casa, con el dinero que solicita invertira en algunas mejoras de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Gerard, 24, lives with his life partner in his mother-in-law's home, which is in the Tinguiña district. They have no children yet. He recently acquired a used vehicle which he operates. Gerard is a hard-working, enterprising, young man who has worked from a very young age. The last job he had was as a driver for a mining operation; he was able to save enough money to buy his own vehicle. He has many dreams and goals, one of which is to own his own house. The funds requested will be used to do some vehicle improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle improvements.

loans.name: Patricia  Janet

texts.es: La Sra.Patricia tiene 24 años de edad es conviviente tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, vive en la casa de su madre juntamente con su conyugue  y su hijo, ellos vienen en el Distrito de la Tinguiña en casa de material adobe, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora hace 2 años, su conyugue es operario de construccion civil, Patricia tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener su propia  casa, con el dinero que solicita incrementarâ su capital  de trabajo para la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Patricia, 24, lives with her life partner and their 3-year-old son in her mother's adobe house, which is in Tinguiña district. She has been a clothing peddler for the past 2 years; her husband works in construction. Patricia has many dreams and objectives, one of which is to have her own home. The funds requested will be used to buy stock merchandise for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es: La señora Estefana G. G. es una cliente distinguida e nuestra Institución en donde todos sus pagos se han registrado con puntualidad, sus créditos anteriores fueron para la inversión en la tienda de abarrotes “Abarrotes G. “ que inicio hace un par de años negocio que ha dado fruto gracias al esfuerzo y la dedicación por parte de la solicitante, ahora nuevamente esta tramitando para un mejoramiento de su vivienda donde su proyecto es ampliar su vivienda para una mayor comodidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Estefana G. G. is a distinguished client of our Institution where she has always made her payments on time. Her previous loans were used to invest in her grocery store, called "Abarrotes G.," which she started a couple of years ago; it has produced profits thanks to her efforts and dedication. Now, she is again requesting funds, this time to do some home improvements; her project is to enlarge her house for greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For house addition.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco Antonio D. es casado con la señora María Elizabeth son una familia muy sólida y comprometida con salir adelante para el bien de la familia, ella labora para una clínica medica donde ella es jefa de enfermeras, y en su hogar iniciaron un negocio “Abarrotes Marcos “establecido desde hace 2 años para el cual están tramitando este crédito ya que desean invertir en mas mercancía para que sus clientes siempre encuentren el producto de su preferencia.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio D. is married to María Elizabeth. They are a solid and committed family dedicated to getting ahead in life for the good of the family. She works at a medical clinic where she is chief of nursing. They set up a grocery store, called "Abarrotes Marcos", in their home two years ago for which they are negotiating this loan because they want to have more stock inventory available so that their customers can always find what they are looking for.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: El joven Joel Alberto M. es un muchacho joven de edad pero muy responsable y con una gran visión de salir adelante, el vive con su mama quien labora para una empresa  restaurantera como cocinera y el trabaja en el mismo lugar como mesero y además tiene establecido un negocio de abarrotes desde hace 2 años donde lo trabaja el por las mañanas y por la tarde esta encargada una hermana. El esta tramitando este crédito para la ampliación del local del negocio ya que desea invertir en más mercancía pero falta mas espacio.
texts.en:
Joel Alberto M. is young in age but very responsible and with great vision to get ahead in life. He lives with his mtoher, who works as a cook in a restaurant; he works in the same restaurant as a waiter. In addition, he has had a grocery store for the last two years where he works during the mornings; his sister looks after the store in the afternoons. He is negotiating funding to enlarge the store because he'd like to stock more products but lacks space to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his business's locale.

loans.name: Suth

texts.en: Suth V., 43, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. V. has a business selling liquor, dried beef and cakes and is able to earn an income of US $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 1998. Her husband sells grilled chicken eggs, earning an income of US $5 per day. V. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are also seeking to improve their businesses. As a result, V. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase a motorbike to transport her food products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem S., 36, is married and lives with her three school-aged children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

S. is engaged in raising crops such as cucumbers and rice, and is able to earn an income of US$3 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2006. Her husband is a construction worker in the province, earning an income of US$5 per day.

S. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US$500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a couple of cows to help plow her rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows to help plow her fields

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut S., 37, is a hardworking woman who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Ut S. was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She now has three kids who attend school and depend on her income.

To pursue a daily income, Ut S. built a medium-sized grocery shop where she sells different types of cooking ingredients to her villagers for a profit. Normally she sells her items in retail or in bulk and she is able to earn around $10 each day to manage her family’s daily requirements.

Recently Ut S. exhausted her wares and she hopes to acquire more inventory to continue selling. Due to her lack of money, Ut S. requests a loan of $1,200 which will enable her to purchase inventory to sell.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Kork

texts.en: Kork S., 26, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. S. makes a living selling palm juice, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover family expenses. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband is a construction worker, and earns $5 per day. S. and her husband work hard, help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family, and are seeking to improve their businesses as well. To make this improvement possible, S. is requesting $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner, and will use the loan to buy animals to help plow her rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy animals to help plow the field

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., 43 years of age, is a widow mother of four children. One of her children is married and lives away from home while the other three are single. Sen M. and her single children currently depend on the revenue from their work as sewing employees in the garment factory. They always walk or take a taxi to work because they don’t have a vehicle. Sen M. would like to own a vehicle but she has no money to buy one. Therefore, she would like to borrow a loan of $1200 to buy a motorcycle, which will allow her to commute to her work location.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Oum R., 41, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.

R. is engaged in the business of selling vegetables and is able to earn an income of US$104 per month to help cover the family expenses. She has been with this business since 1994. Her husband is engaged in the business of growing rice and some kinds of crops, earning an income of US$4 per day.

R. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, R. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport her vegetables for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike  with an attached trailer to transport her vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang S., 29, has established her own small family with three other members. Her husband’s name is Makara, age 28, a motor taxi driver. He is also hired by his nearby neighbors to cook foods for their wedding parties. The family has two school-aged kids, who depend on their parent’s income.

To seek a daily income, Eang S. sews clothes for the garment industry and is able to earn a salary over $70 a month to help control the financial crisis of her family. Eang S. also owns farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. On her land she wants to plant crops but she lacks money to invest. Thus she would like to request a loan to purchase fertilizers and crop seeds.

Eang S. was busy working when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and crop seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun L., 55, and her husband grow rice and raise livestock. They live with their two school-age children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. They earn $1 US per day to cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 1979. 

L. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their business as well. L. is requesting a loan of $1100 US from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work more easily. This is her second loan from CREDIT. 

L. is pictured here with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: El

texts.en: El H., 44, lives in the area of located over-crown Islamic people, in Cambodia. She is married with three kids, all three of whom are teenagers and attend the public secondary school. To earn a living, El H. and her husband buy chickens in bulk at reasonable prices from rural people and they then bring them to the market retail sellers for a profit. Normally they generate their income approximate of over $10 per day to cover their entire family’s daily expenses. Due to the approaching fish season when the fish is at special lowest prices El H. proposes to use this great occasion to make extra income by investing in fish sale trade.  Because of her lack money, she requests a loan as capital to buy fresh fish and she will turn them into paste fish for selling.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou R., 56, is married and lives with his three childR. in Takeo Province, Cambodia. R. operates his motorbike as a taxi driver in Bati district, and is able to earn an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. He has been with this business since 1979. His wife is in the agriculture sector of growing rice and some types of crops, earning an income of USD 0.5 per day. R. and his wife try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, R. is requesting for a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the expected loan to purchase recyclable materials for re-sale. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy recyclable material for re-sale

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Mrs. Rotha Chhoun is 28 years old. She lives in Tonle vollage in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who has a piece of land for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Tao Choun, is a motorbike taxi driver in the local village. Both of them try to work hard but they still earn less income than needed to support the family. 
Mrs. Rotha Chhoun wants to expand and improve her farming so she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and the rest of the loan she wants to get a new motorbike for her husband. Mrs. Rotha Chhoun is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and the rest of the loan she wants to get a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S. is a 58-year-old widowed mother. She has a son who currently lives with her in the family home. Her son is employed as a worker in a private factory and is also a bicycle repairman. Kim S. has been working as a primary school teacher for more than ten years. She also provides a vehicle parking service in the school, which fetches her up to $9 a day. She would be able to look for her second loan of $1,000 through Kiva's partner, HKL, to buy a new motorbike to meet the transportation needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn K. is 48 years old. She lives in Pris Leu village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and rice middleman. With her farming, she has a problem because she doesn't have enough money to buy rice seeds, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy them for her current business.

Mrs. Morn K. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, while the other does housework.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Neary's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is led by Mrs. Neary K.. The group consists of three people who live in Chrouy Dang Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Neary K. and her husband, Mr. Sengtong Bun, are vegetable sellers who can make a small income for supporting their family. Now, Mrs. Neary K. wants to expand her business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell for an income.

Mrs. Neary K. is 44 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a fisherman and the other one makes fishnets for selling. Mrs. Ton Ny, who is a group guarantee, is also shown in the picture with the group members.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to re-sell for an income

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van Y., 35, is married and lives with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Y. is engaged in the agriculture sector, raising pigs at her home in the village, and is able to earn an income of USD $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 1993. Her husband (pictured here) operates his motorbike as a taxi driver, earning an income of USD $8 per day. Y. and his wife try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, Y. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to provide his services to clients staying at the hotel in his province. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Mrs. Roun Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Roun P. is a village president of 18 people who all live in the village of Pong Tuek, in Takeo province. She is a grocer in a local market and her husband, Mr. Hing Chhouk, is a farmer who owns a 0.6-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn income for his family. Since her grocery business is going well, she would like to expand her grocery store. Thus, Mrs. Roun P. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to resell. She hopes to increase her income with this loan. Mrs. Roun P. is a mother of one child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa V. is a vegetable seller. She is 55 years old and lives in Khsom village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Sarin Mom, helps her with the business. Mrs. Channa V. has eight children: five of them are employed in different positions, while the other three are students. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. 
Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth S., 32, sells food for construction workers in the city and is able to earn $2 US per day to help cover the family expenses. She is married and lives with her three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been in her business since 1993. Her husband is a construction foreman earning $13 US per day.  

S. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 US from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more wood for her husband to build houses for his customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy wood to build houses for customers

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn M. and her husband, Mr. Chon Sout, are farmers who own a 1 hectare field and cultivate rice to support their family. She is 50 years old and has three children who are all students in the local school. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Oeurn M. wants to start another business raising pigs. Since she does not have enough money, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pigs and pig feed for the new business.

This is a group loan for four people located in Prey Chhoeteal village in Takeo province. The four members will use their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Oeurn M. is the group leader.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun C. and her husband, Mr. Meas Put, are farmers who own a 1.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from the farming, Mr. Meas Put is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to sell. With the farming, Mrs. Phoeun C. faces a problem because she does not have enough oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy another ox to add to the old one for plowing the field.

Mrs. Phoeun C. is 45 years old and lives in the village of Tmey in Takeo province. She is the mother of four children: two are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field

loans.name: Nurn

texts.en:
Nurn V., 35, sells vegetables at a local market in town and is able to earn $4 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2000. She is married and lives with her six children in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband grows vegetables for sale, earning $2 US per day. The family is also supported by one of the children, who is a worker for a local garment factory earning $2 US per day. 

V. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, V. is requesting a loan of $1000 US from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin M. is 50 years old and lives in Kouk Doang village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 4.5 hectares on which to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Sarin Men decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to buy a watering machine to water her crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Lorn Om, is a house contractor and he can earn a little income to help his family. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and to buy a watering machine to water her crop

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math D. is 38 years old and the mother of three teenage children who are still living at home. (Her husband, a military policeman, appears in the photo.) To earn a living, Math D. sells a few wares from her store in front of her home. She sells items like vegetables, groceries and some meats to villagers. 

Math D. has been constructing a grave which belongs to her grandfather for a long time but the building process is not finished due to lack of equipment. In order to continue building, she requested a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To continue building a grave

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun K. is a widow with a child. They live in Tamouk village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Khun K. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field in which to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is a grocer who can make a small income to support her family. On her rice plantation, she has a problem because it is harvesting season and she would like to ask for a loan to buy a harvesting machine to harvest her rice.

loans.use: To buy a harvesting machine to harvest her rice

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Doung is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell for a better price. Her husband, Mr. Nhab Yim, is also a farmer. In this farming, Mrs. Srey Doung and her husband face a problem because their field is far from an irrigation system, so Mrs. Srey Doung decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to support the field. 

Mrs. Srey Doung is 40 years old and lives in Tamouk village in Takeo province. She is the mother of four children: two are pure drink water sellers, while the other two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and fertilizers

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich C. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Now Mrs. Pich C. wants to improve her standard of living and increase her income. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan from AMK to buy a cow for breeding. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her field. Mrs. Pich C. is 53 years old and she lives in Angkunh village in Takeo province. She is a widow with three children. Two of her children are waiters in a restaurant and the other is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fertilizer

loans.name: Rot

texts.en: Mrs. Rot S. is 41 years old and she lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bros Soth, is a duck breeder who can earn a small income to support his family. In her farming, Mrs. Rot S. faces a problem because her rice field has infertile soil so she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy ducklings and duck food. Mrs. Rot S. is a mother of four children who are all students in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, ducklings and duck food.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla K. is the group leadE. of four people. This group will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Phalla K. is 35 years old and she lives in Russei Srok village in Kandal province. She is a banana sellE. who owns 0.5-hectare of land to grow banana trees. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mrs. Phalla K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more banana trees to grow in hE. field. Mrs. Phalla K. has four children; three of them are students in the local school and the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy banana trees

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna E., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Emelito E., a tricycle driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn an income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for three years.

Edna has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than eight years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy additional stock for her variety store business.   Her business lets her earn a net profit of 12,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business to buy soft drinks and other grocery items.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that their lives will continue to develop. She also prays that their children will have a better future.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and other grocery items

loans.name: Mrs. Shimorn Som Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Shimorn S. is a village bank president who leads 21 people in the Damnak Sangkae village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan they obtained for different purposes.

Mrs. Shimorn S. is 50 years old and a farmer who owns a 0.20-hectare field to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, she is a cake seller and her husband, Mr. Bunrith Hun, is a soldier, so they can earn a little income to support her family. This time, Mrs. Shimorn S. wants to expand her cake selling business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make more cake to sell. Mrs. Shimorn S. is a mother of two children who are both students. All the members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Ya Soth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which is located in Domrei Chhang village in Kandal province, consists of twenty-two people, and all the members of the loan will use it for different purposes. Mrs. Ya S. is the village bank president. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children who are all students in the local school.

Mrs. Ya S. and her husband, Sorom Sao, are farmers who own a .32-hectare field where they cultivate rice. They face a problem because their field has infertile soil. Mrs. Ya S. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to buy gasoline to run the machine for irrigating her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field and to buy gasoline to run the machine for irrigating her crops.

loans.name: Seu

texts.en:
Seu Y. is an old married woman who currently lives with and cares for two kids. The other five of her children are married and have already started new family homes. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals for the family. 

Presently Seu Y. relies on the income from her husband and her children, who work in different occupations. Her husband is a taxi driver, while her children are fish-sellers and garment workers. Seu Y. has a plot of forest land that is covered with grass; she hopes to clean up her land, on which she will build a new home. 

Seu Y. needs to hire a laborer to help clean up her land, but she doesn’t have enough money yet. Therefore, she decided to request a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To hire labor to help clean her land

loans.name: Milojane

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur in this story is the operator of a motorcycle transport known locally as “Jabal-jabal”. She is Mrs. Milojane E., 40 years of age, married and a resident of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married to Magellan E., a motorcycle driver himself. Having four children was not easy for them but still they were able to raise an average income of P3,000 from their own motorcycle business. She joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2009 because she was interested in the many products PMPC had to offer. As a newly recognized member, she borrowed P5,000 to repair and recondition her single motorcycle for hire. She is hoping that someday they can buy another motorcycle and to be able to send her four children to college.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Repair and reconditioning of her motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Muslima A., age 42, is married. She has 2 children, ages 18 and 14. Muslima owns a clothing Store from where she sells women’s clothers making. 

This will be Muslima’s 1st Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to obtain a loan to increase her business. 

Muslima will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Muslima is seated 2nd from the left, wearing a dark dress.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase the stock of the clothes store

loans.name: Son

texts.en: C. is 35 years old and resides in the province of Kampong Chhnang where she built a medium pigpen next to her house. In her stall, she feeds many pigs either to produce babies or to sell to the slaughterer. Her husband is a civil servant officer for an industry. C. has a child who is a student and lives with her in the family home. C. will be using her first loan to purchase a motorcycle to use as transportation. She intends to use the remaining money from the loan to add to her capital for her pig breeding enterprise. C. was not available for a photo so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juvy's Group

texts.en:
Juvy A. is from Cabaruan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Juvy is married. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a metal shop business providing key duplication and sharpening services for scissors, nippers and knives.  She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Juvy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of PHP8,000, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the improvement of her business.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juvy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mrs. Nhaeth Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhaeth V. is a village bank president who leads 22 people who all live in Domrei Chhang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nhaeth V. is a mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker and the other two are students in the local school. 

Mrs. Nhaeth V. and her husband, Mr. Vy Von, are farmers who own a 0.9-hectare field to cultivate rice. In her rice farming, Mrs. Nhaeth V. faces a problem because the soil is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to buy gasoline for her water machine to water her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline .

loans.name: Utamadumi Group

texts.en:
Reham S. is 28 years old and lives in Dar es Salaam. Reham owns a telecom shop where he sells telephones and prepaid airtime. He has been in this business for two years and currently earns 196,000 shillings a month (~ $150 USD).

This will be Reham’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, he hopes to increase the inventory of his telecom shop and improve his business. 

Reham will share this loan with his loan group which includes 18 other men and women from his community. They work mainly in food sales and retail sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

In the picture, Reham is seated on the far left wearing a white t-shirt and white pants.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his telecom shop, such as phones and prepaid airtime vouchers

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev H. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang. Since 1979, Khiev H. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Khiev H., 46, is a widowed mother who has given birth to two children. Both of them are single daughters who work at sewing clothes in the garment factory. Khiev H.’s daughters complain that it is hard to travel to work because they do not have a vehicle. They go to work by taxi or they walk. Khiev H. is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her daughters to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mrs. Mann Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mann T. is a village bank president who leads 16 people in Domrei Chhang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Mann T. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this farming, she faces a small problE. because her soil is infertile. In order to deal with this problE., Mrs. Mann T. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Oeun Ai, helps her on the farm. Mrs. Mann T. is a mother of one child who is employed in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marivic's Group

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the village of Santiago. She is 35 years old. Marivic is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marivic is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila P., 33, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Rolly P., she makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that they can have a better life. Together they manage their plant-selling business and variety store.

Precila has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy fertilizer and seeds for her plant-selling business and added stock to her store.  Her two businesses let her earn a total net profit of approximately $186 a month.  

Now with your help, she would like to receive a 11,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, to buy assorted grocery items for their store.

She dreams that someday that they can have their own mini-grocery and prays to God in earnest that they will have a child in the near future. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items for their store.

loans.name: Moeng

texts.en: V. is a local farmer who has been planting various crops for years. She is married with five children. Her husband, whose name is Saron, is a military policeman. Currently, V. has a daughter who doesn’t have a job. She wants to encourage her daughter to work as a housekeeper through a private company, but she is required to pay a service tuition. That is why V. is applying for a loan.

loans.use: To pay a service tuition

loans.name: Mrs. Vantha Aork Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. consists of seventeen people in Domrei Chhang village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loA. for different purposes. 

Mrs. Vantha A. is farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from farming, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to request a loA. to buy more piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Srong Dim, is a farmer. They have two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food to support her current business.

loans.name: Srey Yi

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Yi H. is 61 years old and she lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 7-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pen Yang, is a duck breeder who earns a small income to help his family. 

In rice farming, Mrs. Srey Yi H. faces a problem because her field has infertile soil, so she would like to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. Mrs. Srey Yi H. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field.

loans.name: Medy's Group

texts.en:
Medy L. is from the village of Santos. She is 29 years old. Medy is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI, one of Kiva's field partners. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Medy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Medy plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Medy has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $66 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Medy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Medy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeun P. is 41 years old, and she lives in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sarun Parch, is a cow middleman. Since this business is doing well, Mrs. Noeun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for her husband's business. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer to support her field.

Mrs. Noeun Paeni is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory. The other one is a student in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for her husband's business and fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey M., 38, is a hard-working father who makes sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Irine M., a housewife, they are blessed with one child. He has been managing their variety store for four years.

Joey has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than four years now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow ten times through CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to buy added stock for his store.   His business lets him earn a profit of about $135 a month.  

Now with your help, he would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for his expanding business by buying additional stock for his store.

His priority in life is that he can raise his child well. He intends for his business to improve so that he can provide more for his family. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.
